GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy wood, varnish, chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye S. vit à kolda où il est né. Il tient un atelier de menuiserie métallique avec l'aide trois (apprentis). Il est établit dans le quartier Doumassou et fabrique pricipalement des portes et des fenetres en fer, des grilles et d'autres objets en fer.Ses activités marchent et il parvient à faire face aux besoins sociaux de sa famille. Il voudrait cependant agrandir son atelier et ainsi utiliser plus de main-d'oeuvre.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye S. lives in Kolda, where he was born. He runs a metal welding workshop with help from three apprentices. He's located in the Doumassou neighborhood and mainly makes iron doors and windows, grilles, and other iron objects. His business is doing well, and he manages to support his family. Nevertheless, he would like to expand his workshop to be able to increase his workforce.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his metal welding workshop

loans.name: Afi Delphine

texts.fr: Cette femme vit avec son mari et ses 2 enfants dans le quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de  poissons frais et d’huile. Une bonne partie de sa clientèle sont propriétaire de restaurant, ils achètent chez elle les poissons  pour leur activité de restauration. Le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet de satisfaire ses clients, elle demande alors à WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 paniers de poissons et 8 bidons d’huile.
texts.en:
This lady lives with her husband and their two children in the Kégué district, which is an outlying neighborhood of the town of Lomé. She sells fresh fish and oil to earn a living. A good number of her customers are owners of restaurants. They buy fish from her for their restaurants.

Her present stock does not allow her to satisfy her clientele's needs, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 baskets of fish and 8 jerry cans of oil.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish and oil for re-sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 36-year-old woman. She is divorced and a mother with three children. All her children are in school. She lives with the children at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She works very hard to support her children's basic needs. She is a food vendor who sells rice and stew in the community where she lives. She started her operation about seven years ago to take care of her entire family. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business.

She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support and provide for her family and finance her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: J. Zuhro is 50 years old and is working to support her single son who is the drive for her to live. She is operating her own clothing sales business, which she has owned for more than three years. The savings she earns from her business goes to improve their health and living conditions. Zuhro is requesting this 3,000 Somoni loan to purchase more merchandise to restock and increase her inventory. Her business is growing and she has shown that she can increase sales with a larger supply of product. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora de 47 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos de 8 y 18 años que estudian, reside en el barrio Concepción de Maria en la capital de Managua, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace ocho años logro poner el cual inicio con ayuda de su exmarido.  Con este crédito es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por los beneficios ya que a través de los prestamos ha logrado poder seguir con su pulpería ya que le ha tocado seguir adelante con la venta ya que su esposo se fue de la casa, lo que mas desea es poder ayudar a sus hijos que estudien. Con este crédito comprara mercadería variada como: granos básicos, carnes, productos lácteos. Ya que son los alimentos diarios de los Nicaragüenses.es la variedad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora is 47 years old. She is single and has two children, who are 8 and 18 years old. Both children attend school. She resides in the town of Concepcion de Maria, in the capital of Managua. Her business is a convenience store which she started eight years ago with her ex-husband’s help. This loan brings her to her eighth with Afodenic. She is grateful since thanks to these loans she has been able to continue with her convenience store, despite her husband’s leaving the house. Her desire is to help educate her children. With the loan, she will buy an assortment of merchandise, such as, grains, meats and diary products, which are the basic staples of Nicaraguans daily grocery needs.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains, meats and dairy products.

loans.name: Na We This Ii Group

texts.en:
This is Alhaji M. T., Memunatu C., Mariatu K., Kadiatu S. and Fatmata S.. They called their group Na We This II. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them to improve their businesses. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva lenders. With this loan, their businesses will improve both in size and quality. They will be able to make better sales, more profit and consequently, improve their standards of living. They will be able to better look after themselves and their school-going children. 

Alhaji M. T. (right) is the leader of this group. Alhaji was born in Magburaka town, 15 miles from Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. He is 27 and married with four children between the ages of 1 and 4. Alhaji is a car driver who plies the Magburaka-Makeni highway. He has been a driver for five years. With this loan, he will buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: Invest in his car

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is married and has five dependents. She has received senior high school education. Her husband is a trader.

Elizabeth sells various kinds of paints, turpentine, sandpaper, nails and spare parts at Castle near Nyankumasi, which she has been doing since 1989. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of utility bills.

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more nails, paints and other building materials for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans save to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase more nails, paints and other building materials

loans.name: Nwachukwu

texts.en:
V. is married with a child and is 35 years old. She sells sarongs and has been in this business for the past six years. She uses the profit from her trade to assist her husband.

V. hopes for the loan of N50,000, to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona L. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Mis. Oriental.  She is 44 years old, married, and has five school-age children. 

Alona makes and sells specialty food products in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Alona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a 28-year-old single man living in the peaceful Barangay (village) of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. Joel is well known in the village as a good  and friendly neighbor.  Joel is engaged in beauty services. He offers manicures, pedicures, and hair cutting and he earns a daily income of PHP250.00. He has two workers in his salon. Joel wants to obtain a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 7,000.00 to invest in his business and for the education of his niece. He hopes and prays that KIVA lenders will grant his loan in order for him to have a productive business.

loans.use: To invest in a beauty salon.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mr. Saren S., 29 years old, (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Chariyas El, 28 year-old, were married in 1999 and have two sons.  Both of them are still young. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Saren has been operating a business repairing and cleaning motorcycles for two months. He runs the business at his shop in front of his house. Mrs. Chariyas assists her husband in the business.  

Saren wants to purchase more motorbike spare parts to respond to his customer’s needs. So, he is requesting a loan of $500 in order to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for his stock.

loans.name: Eldith

texts.es:
Eldith es una socia dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayal. Ella tiene 47 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad (independientes).
Eldith tiene una panaderìa y junto con ella trabaja su esposo hace muchos años que gracias al esfuerzo va prosperando.
Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace tres años y empezò con un crèdito de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizò en la compra de sacos de harina para la preparaciòn de panes y tortas.
En la actualidad Eldith necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles que seràn utilizados en la compra
de insumos para panes y panetones.
El anhelo de Margarita es mejorar su negocio y poder tener una pastelería bien implementada.
texts.en:
Edith, 47, is a dynamic, hard-working woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has three adult children. She and her husband have had a bakery for several years which, thanks to their efforts, has been making progress. She has been a member of the "Las Rosas" communal bank for the last 3 years. She began with a 300 new sol loan which she used to buy sacks of flour for bread and pastry making. Currently, Edith needs 3000 new soles which will be used to buy ingredients for breads and panetones [(typical bread of Milan, usually prepared and enjoyed for Christmas and New Year around Italy, and one of the symbols of the city. In Latin America, especially in Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, Chile and Peru, it is a Christmas dinner staple and in some places replaces roscón de reyes (Kings cake)]. Margarita's wish is to improve her business and have a well-equipped pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredient for bread and panetones.

loans.name: Edelvina

texts.es: Edelvina de  35 años, vive con su  esposo y sus 4 hijos en la casa de su suegra.Desde hace 13 años se dedica a 2 actividades que son esenciales para el sustento de su hogar;primero empezó con la fabricación de guitarras artesanales, también ofrece el servicio de espectáculos durante los fines de semana ,donde ella es la vocalista principal ,deleita a su público con su melodiosa voz entonando diversas canciones ; debe trabajar durante toda la semana  ya que con su esposo fabrica las  guitarras , y los fines de semana sale a cantar con su equipo de sonido ,además la acompaña una banda musical cuyos integrantes  son sus socios y se reparten las ganancias al finalizar los espectáculos . El sueño de Edelvina es tener una  fábrica con modernas herramientas para elaborar sus instrumentos musicales en menor tiempo y con mayor calidad, además de  tener un grupo musical consolidado.Es la sexta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y durante todo el  tiempo de permanencia en su banco comunal ha sido muy puntual en los  pagos de sus cuotas.El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para fabricar sus guitarras, tales como barniz, madera, cuerdas, entre otros y también quiere adquirir un amplificador de sonido para sus espectáculos musicales.
texts.en:
Edelvina is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and four children in her mother-in-law's house. For 13 years she has been doing two activities that are essential for the livelihood of her home. First she began to manufacture artisinal guitars. She also offers the service of shows on the weekend in which she is the lead singer. She delights her audience with her melodious voice singing various songs. She has to work all week since she builds guitars with her husband, and weekends she sings with her musical equipment. She is also accompanied by a musical group whose members are her partners and they share the earnings after finishing the shows. Edelvina's dream is to have a factory with modern tools to produce her musical instruments in less time and more quality, in addition to having a consoldidated musical group. This is the sixth loan opportunity she has had with MFP. For the entire time she has been with the communal bank she has been very punctual with her payments. She will invest the money in the purchase of materials to build her guitars, such as varnish, wood, strings, among others. She also wants to acquire an amplifier for her musical shows.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and outfit her business

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 35 años, es conviviente  y tiene cinco hijos: Alexander tiene 13 años, Maria tiene 10 años, Ana Susana tiene 9 años, Roland tiene 7 años y Sayli tiene 5 años. Ellos viven en el poblado de Rarcchí de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Rarcchí esta a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 
  
Susana vende artesanía en el mirador de Rarcchí desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Susana tiene una chacra donde cosecha papa y cebada y también cría animales como vacas, toros chanchos, gallinas y conejos. 
Susana es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo de los 500 soles y desea comprar artesanía y insecticida. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Asunta de Racchi”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children: Alexander (age 13), Maria (age 10), Ana Susana (age 9), Roland (age 7), and Sayli (age 5). They live in the town of Rarcchí in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco. Rarcchí is 45 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Susana sells handicrafts from a location overlooking the town of Rarcchí, where she works from 7am to 5pm. In addition, she has a field where she grows potatoes and barley. She also raises cows, bulls, pigs, chickens, and rabbits.

Susana is a working mother and entrepreneur who is requesting a loan of 500 soles so that she can purchase handicrafts and insecticides. She has been in business for several years and has done very well as a result of her hard work.

Susana is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts to sell and insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn C. is a woman full of determination to rise above poverty. She is 40 years old and is still fighting the challenge of poverty. She is married and the mother of three minor children, all of whom need her continued support. She lives in the coastal town of Cardona in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. 

In 1998, she decided to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, to acquire working capital for her business of making and selling “bukayo,” a sweet delicacy.  As a busy entrepreneur, she also embarked on another business of Buy and selling of pork meat and fish. Both businesses are delivering solid profits.

During her membership in ASHI, Novelyn has achieved strong performance with steady repayments and regular attendance to center meetings. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 pesos to pay for more stock to make sweet delicacies such as coconut, sugar,and other supplies.  Furthermore, the remaining money will use to purchase a second hand tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar).

The loan from Kiva will help Novelyn achieve her goals in life. She wants to help her children with their school fees until they finish college so they can achieve a better quality of life. She is very thankful to ASHI and Kiva for the continued support of her dreams.


About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To pay for more stock to make sweet delicacies such as coconut, sugar, and other supplies and remaining fund will use to buy a second hand tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar).

loans.name: Abaroa Okinawa Group

texts.es: El grupo  “Abaroa Okinawa” esta representado por las señora Santa María y conformada 14 miembros la cual son 10 mujeres y 4 son varones. La señora Santa María es emplead D. una industria con el cargo D. envasa y encajona el producto terminado ella es madre D. tres niños que sustenta junto con su esposo, debido a que la empresa actualmente se encuentra modernizando sus maquinarias y ella ve la posibilidad D. que la remplacen por una D. ellas, la señora Santa María desea poder iniciar un puesto D. venta D. refrescos y empanadas en la puerta D. su caso o buscar la posibilidad D. salir a una avenida principal para tener mayor venta, pero para ello requiere D. capital es por esta razón que requiere del préstamo para poder iniciar su negocio nuevo que mientras tanto pueD. funcionar fuera del horario D. trabajo actual. El resto D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesa, venta D. pan, venta D. comida, venta D. productos D. cosméticos. La competencia entre las socias es realmente difícil, especialmente en la venta D. comida y en la venta D. cosméticos, ya que cada socia espera cada día un buen resultado en sus ventas. El crédito lo destinaran para poder surtir sus tiendas y comprar más productos y ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes para que a futuro tengan sus negocios con mayores ingresos y una mejor situación económica. Como es un grupo nuevo se les ha dado una capacitación que están satisfechas y contentas D. ser clientes D. Agrocapital  pero algunas D. las socias ya poseen experiencia gracias a créditos similares en otras entidades
texts.en:
The “Abaroa Okinawa” group is represented by Santa María and is maD. up of 14 members: 10 women and 4 men. Mrs. Santa María is employed by a firm; she is in charge of the final packing of the finished product. She has three children, who she supports together with her husband. Because the firm she works for is currently modernizing its machinery she thinks that she might be replaced by one of them. She wants to set up a beverage and turnover stand in her doorway or, if possible, set up on one of the town’s main avenues to have better sales. For this to happen, however, she needs capital and this is why she’s asking for a loan to start her new business which, for the time being, she can operate outsiD. her normal employment hours. The rest of the members are involved in various commercial activities like: hamburger sales, bread sales, food sales, cosmetics sales. Competition among them is really difficult, especially in food and cosmetic sales, because every member expects good results from her daily sales. The loan will be used to stock their stores, buy more products and offer better services to their customers so that they will have more income and a better economic situation in the future. As this is a new group, they have received training and they are happy and satisfied to be clients of Agrocapital although some of the members already have experience thanks to similar loans with other entities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Anaju

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Anaju G. R. tiene 35 años de edad, es casada tiene 2 hijos menores de edad y desde hace más de 4 años se dedica a administrar  una  panadería artesanal realizando panes simples y dulces, picos, queques y galletas. Sin embargo las utilidades son pocas por lo que desde hace un año también se a dedicado a vender algunos productos tales como papel higiénico, confites, meneitos, sopas y otros productos en pequeñas cantidades.

Esta microempresaria ya fue beneficiada con préstamo por parte de Kiva el cual cancelo en tiempo y forma. Actualmente quiere invertir comprando un horno nuevo ya que el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado por el uso que le ha dado y además comprar productos para surtir su pequeña pulpería.


Esta solicitando se le financie para comprar:

Un horno artesanal que le cuesta US 230, dos cajas de sopa maruchan a US 20 cada caja, 3 quintales de harina a US 38 cada quintal y un bolsón de papel higiénico a US 16 el bolsón.
texts.en:
35-year old Anaju G. R. runs a small business. She is married and has two children. About four years ago she started a bakery selling bread, candy, snacks, cakes, and cookies. However, she didn’t earn very much so a year ago she started to sell other products too such as toilet paper, sweets, meneitos (a local snack), soup, and other items in small quantities. Her business has already benefitted from a Kiva loan which was repaid properly and on time. Anaju now wants to buy a new oven as the one she has is in poor condition after being used for so many years. She also wants to buy more stock for her store. She would like a loan to buy an oven (US$230), two boxes of Maruchan soup ($20 per box), three quintales (100 pounds) of flour ($38 per quintal), and a carton of toilet paper ($16).

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy an oven and products for her store

loans.name: Mirna Lorena

texts.es: Mirna Lorena tiene 51 años, pues es el único medio de ingreso que tiene para mejorar su condición de vida. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte, consiste en llevar a los niños a sus diferentes escuelas, este negocio nace por su esposo e hijo, que compraron un carrito para realizar este tipo de trabajo, pues su esposo es quien se hace cargo de manejar y ella de administrar el negocio, ella está muy feliz de tener este ingreso. Pero solicita este financiamiento para la compra de llantas, forros para los asientos, repuestos del automóvil entre otras cosas. Ella sueña con tener otro automóvil para brindar el servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Mirna Lorena is 51, and the income from her business is her only means of improving her standard of living. She provides transportation services, taking children to their various schools. This business was started by her husband and son, who bought a small car to carry out this type of work. Her husband is the one who is responsible for the driving, and she administers the business. She is very happy to have this income. She requests a loan to purchase tires, seat liners, spare parts for the vehicle, and other items. She dreams of having another automobile to provide taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy auto parts

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily A. M. deals in shoe sales in Nambale, Busia District. She started this business as a source of income to supplement her farming, in the year 2004. Emily is 23 years old, married and blessed with 3 children who are all in primary school. She buys her stock from Busia town twice a week.

She would like a loan of KShs. 20,000 to expand her shoe business. Her future plan is to ensure education for her children through high school and college.

loans.use: Expand Business

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr: T. Séraphine est mariée à DOSSA Marcellin, un chauffeur. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leurs charges. Séraphine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Kindonou, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Séraphine assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Séraphine n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Séraphine vend du haricot, mais aussi du « chapalot » (boisson local, fait à base du maïs et du sucre) à Cococodji et à Kindonou. Séraphine s’approvisionne aux marchés de Cococodji et de Cocotomey à Cotonou. Séraphine mène cette activité depuis trois ans environs et a déjà bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Séraphine a bien remboursé ledit crédit. Face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle, Séraphine sollicite un deuxième prêt afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité. Séraphine envisage plus tard diversifier son activité par la vente d’autres produits.
texts.en:
Séraphine T. is married to Marcellin DOSSA, a driver. The couple has four children, all of whom have attended school and three of whom are in their care. Séraphine lives with her children and her husband in Kindonou, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Séraphine shares the responsibility for the various family expenses with her husband. She has never been to school. In order to provide for her needs, she sells beans, but also "chapalot" (a local drink made out of corn and sugar) in Cococodji and in Kindonou. Séraphine gets her supplies at the markets in Cococodji and in Coctomey in Cotonou. She has been carrying out this activity for around three years and has already benefited from one loan from ALIDé. She repaid this loan in full. Faced with increasing customer demand, Séraphine is requesting a second loan so that she can increase the level of her activity. She envisages diversifying her activities later on with the sale of other products.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and sugar for the preparation of "Chapalot", and beans

loans.name: Roguesa

texts.en: Roguesa C. is from the village of North Park Area, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Roguesa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Roguesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Roguesa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: North Park Area, Wao, Lanao de Sur

loans.name: Tamguila

texts.fr: Cette femme est une jeune femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, en 2007, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de charbons de bois, plus tard elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de céréales. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays. Elle veut rehausser son stock de marchandises qui est réduit raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  5 sacs de maïs et 7 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This young lady is married and mother to two children. In 2007 she set up an activity selling charcoal, and since then she has combined this with the sale of cereals. She gets her supplies inland. She wants to boost her stock of good which has fallen, and for this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES for the purchase of five sacks of corn and seven sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and charcoal

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma P., 31 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. Alma is a hard-working mother, spending most of the daytime tilling her land, preparing it for planting rice crops, and then selling the harvest to people in her community. As a result of her hard work, Alma is able to feed her family and pay for her children's education, hoping one day to see them obtain a college degree. 

Alma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Desederia

texts.en: Desederia S. is from the village of Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years old, married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Desederia runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Desederia has been engaged in her business for 19 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Desederia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Desederia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Desederia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Desederia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Ana Dalinda

texts.es:
Ana de 56 años, , vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), ella tiene una papelería en su casa vende bebidas, papelería, cuadernos .(en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”).   

Comenzó hace 6 años con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa ya que hay un colegio cerca de donde vive. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, bebidas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere triplicar su mercadería y que su hija de 17 años termine sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Ana is 56 years old and lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a periurban area with dirt roads and hills). She has a stationery shop in her home where she sells beverages, paper, and notebooks. In Ecuador, this type of business would be called a bazaar.

She started her business six years ago in order to support her family. Ana began selling notebooks, pens, and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances. When she had enough money to set up a small store, she remodeled her house and placed her business in the front part of her home since there is a high school near where she lives. She works from 7:30am to 8pm every day.

With his loan Ana plans to buy notebooks, beverages, and display cabinets for her business. In the future, she hopes to triple her inventory and see her 17 year old daughter successfully finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, beverages, and display cabinets

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en: Namiq M., a married father of two children, has been selling groceries for the past three years in a store located in a very busy place, one of the reasons he always has many customers.  A hard worker who labours long days to make sure his family has everything they need,  his monthly income is about 330-400 AZN.   Namiq` s business is the only source of income for his family, so he takes this responsibility seriously and is doing his best to meet the needs of his children. Today he is requesting a loan of 900 AZN to purchase more food items.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for his grocery store

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Pha S. is a 28-year-old married man with a child who is six years old and not in school yet. He and his wife, Mrs. Samnang Meas, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land upon which they cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Pha is also a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family.

Pha was selected to be the village bank president by fourteen members who all live in Samraong K'aer village, Kandal province. With the loan the members of this village hope to increase their income to improve their families’ living standards. Pha owns some farm machinery that they use to work their field. The machinery broke, so Pha decided to ask for a loan from AMK to repair it.

loans.use: To repair some farm machinery

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es: Rosa Melida P. D. G. D. 59 años D. edad, vive junto a sus dos hijas mayores D. edad, y así mismo junto a tres nietos, con quienes resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango.  Rosa posee un comedor, en el cual se dedica a elaborar desayunos y almuerzos D. lunes a sábado, debido a que dicho negocio esta en las cercanías del mercado D. Soyapango ella cuenta con varios clientes fijos, los cuales le permiten mantener su negocio estable. Esta es la única fuente D. ingresos con la que ella cuenta por lo que sus hijas y sus nietos le ayudan en el comedor. Rosa depenD. por completo D. su negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir, comprando mayor cantidad D. verduras, granos básicos, frutas y todo lo necesario para aumentar sus ventas y D. esta manera poder contar con una estabilidad mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Melida P. D. G. is 59 years old. She lives with her two grown daughters and three grandchildren in the Soyapango municipality. Rosa has an eatery where she makes breakfast and lunch from Monday through Saturday. Because her business is close to the Soyapango market she has many fixed customers. They allow her to maintain a stable business. This is the only source of income that she has, and her daughters and grandchildren help her in the eatery. Rosa is completely dependent upon her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of vegetables, basic grains, fruit, and everything that is needed to increase her sales. That way she and her family will be able to have more stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, basic grains, and fruit

loans.name: Affi Rose

texts.fr: M. Affi Rose est née le 23 Décembre 1971 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Mariée à YEHOUENOU Expédit, Rose est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Rose et sa famille vivent à Hêdomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, depuis environs onze ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Rose n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Rose mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (allumettes, lait, sucre, pâtes alimentaires, savons, conserves de tomate, cubes, etc.)à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Rose vend de l'igname frit et des beignets de haricot. Rose achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Rose exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a obtenu antérieurement deux crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de Rose s'agrandit de plus en plus et Rose désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux répondre aux différentes demandes de sa clientèle. C'est donc pour augmenter son fonds de roulement que Rose sollicite pour une troisième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Affi Rose M. was born on December 23, 1971 in Ouidah, a historical city in Benin. Married to Expédit Yehouenou, Rose has four children, all of whom go to school. Rose has  been living with her family in Hedomey, in the community of Abomey Caliv, for about 11 years. The couple take care of the family expenses jointly. Rose has not been in school. In order to support herself and her children, Rose sells various general products (matches, milk, sugar, pasta, soap, canned tomatoes, bouillon cubes, etc) out of her home. As a secondary activity, Rose sells fried yams and bean fritters. Rose stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for five years and already obtained two loans,  both   properly repaid. Rose’s customer base keeps growing, and Rose would like to expand her business and better respond to various requests of her customers. In order to bolster her operating capital she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing various general products and bags of beans, yams, and potatoes

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and their child in their own home in Caserio de Porcon Bajo in the district of Cajamarca. Her community is primarily rural with the majority of the population working in agriculture.

Maria operates a small general store out of her home, in which she sells items to meet basic needs such as soap, cooking supplies, rice, beans, flour, beverages, etc. In addition to the store, she raises cattle on her property and sells them in local markets for their meat. Maria has been involved in these businesses for the last four years. She tells us that the demand for her store is steadily growing and customers often ask her for items she doesn’t have.

This is Maria’s first loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional merchandise in order to expand the selection she offers to her customers in her store. She believes that by increasing her offerings she will be able to draw more customers and solidify her clientele.

Maria is an incredibly hardworking woman and dedicated mother. She is well recommended by neighbors and authorities in the area. She plans to continue reinvesting her profits into her business in order to realize growth as soon as possible. She hopes that she will be able raise sufficient income over the long term to provide for her child’s education and improve her family’s life style.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Nyamabare Tweyimukye Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
He has subsisted on a produce sales business for a time frame of more than 2 years. Emmanuel B. of Nyamabare Tweimukye group, is a fledgling agro-sales business trend setter, whose example is bound to stand out as a benchmark for other people in his home area of Nyamabare, Bushenyi. Many in his home area preoccupy themselves in self-destructive activities like drinking alcohol and smoking, rather than working hard and taking on their family responsibilities. With his hard work ethic, he has managed to take firm root and in a month he makes 200,000 Ugandan shillings.

With his monthly savings, he has managed to diversify his small business where he is involved in coffee, beans, bananas, and livestock sales, especially goats. This has, however, not come the easy way as he has had to grapple with many adversities such as small livestock. He is looking forward to purchasing more goats on the farm for fattening. With this loan, he hopes to implement the aforementioned as he looks forward to improving the household income.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for fattening on the farm.

loans.name: Ekua Agyeiwaa Hagah

texts.en: Ekua Agyeiwaa Hagah O. smokes fish at Abura.  She also fries fish for sale. She has been through senior high school. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Jerose

texts.en:
Jerose M. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Jerose is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jerose owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice per kilogram in the local community. Jerose has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jerose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerose is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional rice to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jerose from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dossolo

texts.fr:
Né vers 1971  à  SAN, préfecture du même nom, Monsieur Dossolo M. n’a pas pu faire de brillantes études (car abandonna l’école en classe de 8ème année  fondamentale : système éducatif Malien), alors il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus c'est-à-dire le commerce de céréales. Il est marié à deux épouses et est père de 5 enfants. Il vit chez lui même à Sienso de la préfecture de San.  
Il excelle dans la vente de céréales  qu’ il a appris  auprès de son père il y a une vingtaine d’année. Il l’exerce actuellement pour lui même à Sienso.  Il est très sollicité   dans les foires hebdomadaire de San  ville et environnants.  
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de son activité, il décida de faire recours à l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans.  Il est à son deuxième prêt  individuel. 
Monsieur Dossolo  compte acheter, 1 tonne de riz paddy, 2 tonnes de petits mils et 0,5 tonnes de mils. Il s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants  grossistes de Sienso, mais avec l’augmentation du fonds de commerce, il compte aller jusque chez les cultivateurs pour  s’approvisionner. Il vend tous les jours  à Sienso au bord du goudron, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes à crédit et au comptant. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt,  utiliser le reste pour payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, acheter la nourriture et investir le reste dans d’autres activités  génératrices de revenus .
Il ambitionne augmenter son prochain prêt afin d’améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Born around 1971 in San, in the prefecture of San, Mr. Dossolo M. did not have a chance to excel  in academic studies (having left school in 8th grade of general studies, as per Mali educational system), and so he turned his attention to making a living, more specifically selling cereals. He has two wives and is the father of five children. He lives in his own home in Sienso, in the San prefecture. He masters the cereals business, having learned it from his father some twenty years ago. He has his own business in Sienso. He is very much in demand at the weekly markets of the town of San and nearby areas. 

With the goal of expanding his business, two years ago he decided to seek assistance from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second individual loan.

Mr. Dossolo plans to purchase 1 ton of rice paddy, 2 tons of small millet and 0.5 tons of millet. He buys his stock form wholesalers of Sienso, but with the increased working capital he plans to go directly to farmers to stock up. He sells in Sienso everyday,  next to the asphalted road, to a client base composed of women and men, on credit and for cash. He expects to achieve a monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, which he plans to use for repaying the loan, with the rest used to cover school fees of his children and food. The rest will be reinvested in his business. He has his sights set on increasing his next loan in order to improve his life conditions.

loans.use: Achat  de céréales

loans.name: Edison

texts.es:
El Sr. Edison tiene 24 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres en CONAVI La Esperanza. Él se dedica a la venta de joyas, ropas, CD y DVD  por la ciudad de Itá, dicha actividad lo viene realizando desde el año 2005. Cuenta que el negocio le va muy  bien por la clientela que ya formó gracias a los préstamos realizados en la fundación.
Su objetivo es ir creciendo como comerciante para así lograr todos sus metas propuestas.
El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de mercaderías ya que en estas épocas tiene la mayor demanda de las mismas.
texts.en:
Edison is 24 years old. He lives with his parents in CONAVI La Esperanza. He sells jewellery, clothing, CDs and DVDs around the city of Itá. He has been doing it since 2005. He explains that the business is doing very well because of the customer base generated thanks to previous loans arranged through Fundación Paraguaya.

His aim is to continue to grow his trading activity so as to achieve all of his goals.

The loan he is requesting is to purchase different goods for which there is a greater demand this time of the year.

loans.use: Buy jewellery, clothing, CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine members living in Ta Hing village in Kandal province.  The members of this group selected Mrs. Heang S., a 40-year-old married woman, to be the group leader.  The members of this group will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Heang S. and her husband, Mr. Ngorn Nart, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate corn for a living. In order to support this farming, Mrs. Heang S. needs a loan to buy fertilizers, corn seeds, and gasoline. 

This couple is working hard to support their six children, four of whom are attending in the local school and the other two are 4-year-old twins.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, corn seeds, and gasoline to grown corn.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a 39 year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: buying and selling rice grains; working as a rice retailer; and running a food vending business. She lives in E.B. Magalona, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mary Grace aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva Lending Team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital to purchase goods.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu A. is single and sells clothes, cosmetics, and other items s at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast.  Salamatu has received a junior high school education. She started this business recently and it is her livelihood. Her loan will be use to expand her business and she hopes to build another shop with the increased income.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaire avec leurs  enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Massablacoura l’un des quartier de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des relations de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et élargir la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de céréales, de poissons et des ustensiles de cuisines à l’image de  Kadia D..
Elles sont à leur vingt deuxième prêt de groupe dont tous les  vingt un  précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Kadia D., compte acheter, 20 douzaine de tasses INOX, (grand, petit et moyen modèle), 3 cartons de tasse thermos et 8 cartons de verre à café et  40 douzaines de cuillères.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako capitale de la république du Mali au niveau des grossistes pour les revendre  en détail , au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de BOUGOUNI  à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et le reste sera  utilisé dans la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
The group named Djiguisseme is made up of married women averaging 45 years in age and each has 6  children.  They live in conjugal nuclear families with their children and husband. These women  live in Massablacoura, a quarter in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the  Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family and in the neighborhood. 

IN order to satisfy their clients and in order to increase their business activities, they have decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner).  It will help them with their business selling cereal grains, fish, and kitchen utensils through Kadia  D.. 

They are no their twentieth group loan and all twenty previous loans were successfully repaid. 

With this new loan Kadia D. will purchase 20 dozen Inox brand drinking cups (large, small,  and medium size models), 3 cartons of thermos containers, 8 cartons of coffee mugs, and 40 dozen  spoons. 

She makes her purchases in Bamako, the capital city of the Republic of Mali, from the  wholesalers with the intent to resell in retail. She completes her sales in cash and credit in  the large market in Bougouni and she sells to a clientele generally made up of  women. 

With this loan she expects to earn a monthly income of 20.000 FCFA, a part of which will be  reinvested in the business and the rest will be used to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ángel Marcelo

texts.es:
Ángel Marcelo C. G. tiene 32 años, vive en Unión Libre vive  con la cónyuge en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir la casa.

Le gusta salir por la tarde a la cancha deportiva para jugar boly con los amigos.
texts.en:
Ángel Marcelo C. G. is 32-years-old, lives in a common-law marriage, and lives with his partner in the Cantón Chillanes Province of Bolivar.  He does not have children.

The members of the V.R.C. Juntos Venceremos (Together We Will Overcome) is located in the Matilde Esther region in the Cantón Chillanes.  This group of 12 members works in agriculture cultivating cacao and yucca.

Ángel works in agriculture growing cacao and yucca.  He buys his products in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells them at the Sunday fairs in Chillanes.

He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer for his cacao and yucca plantings.  The support of this loan will help him to supply himself with necessities.  He faces many challenges such as pests and plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to build a house.  

He likes to go to the athletic field in the afternoons to play volleyball with his friends.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for cacao and yucca cultivation.

loans.name: Silvana Maribel

texts.es: La señora Silvana Maribel B. M. trabaja en una imprenta el negocio empezó con ayuda de sus padres sin embargo aun mantiene todos los datos del negocio a nombre de sus papas ,es casada su esposo maneja una moto taxi eL cual es propio su meta a futuro es hacer crecer mas su negocio de imprenta para que le genere mayores ingresos tiene buenas referencias ,el dinero del prestamos sera invertido en darle mantenimiento a su moto taxi para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes ,se propone crédito por ser persona responsable y con ganas de salir adelante al lado de su familia.
texts.en: Silvana Maribel B. M. has a printing business.  She started her business with her parents' help and still keeps it all in her parents' name.  Silvana is married and her husband drives a motorcycle taxi which he owns.  Silvana's goal for the future is to grow her printing business so that she can make more income.  She has good references and the loan money will be invested in having maintenance work done on the motorcycle taxi so that her husband could provide a better service to his customers. She is a responsible person who wants to help her family succeed.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for the car's engine

loans.name: Angela Concepcion

texts.es:
Ángela, tiene 34 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 19, 17 y 15 años de edad, él se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario fijo para el trabajo, y actualmente quiere un préstamo para invertirlo en mariscos, elotes, frutas y verduras.
La compra le ayudara a contar con todo lo necesario para le ofrecer a los clientes, comercializando variedad de productos.
Su sueño es establecer un negocio fijo, dejar de ofrecer los productos de forma ambulante y proveer para su familia todo lo necesario para subsistir.
texts.en:
Angela is 34 years old and lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband and three children who are 19, 17 and 15 years old.  She is a travelling vender selling fruits and vegetables and does not have a fixed work schedule.  She currently wants a loan to invest in seafood, corn, fruit and vegetables.
The purchase will help her have everything she needs in order to offer them to her customers, selling a variety of products. 
Her dream is to establish a fixed business and to stop traveling to sell her products, and to provide everything her family needs to subsist.

loans.use: to buy seafood, corn, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes actividades como comerciantes y empelados de fabricas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada hace varios años pero aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo es taxista. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos años y  le gusta por el compañerismo que ha encontrado en el grupo y también por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.

Ella trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta pero también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja de lunes a viernes  desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00 en la fabrica pero en las noches y fines de semana se dedica a sus ventas, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lleva dos años que se dedica a esta labor y que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas.
 
Su sueño es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) community bank meet in Bajo de Montecristi, in Manabí province.  This is a small place which is surrounded by vegetation.  The locals work pursue different business activities such as selling merchandise and working in factories.

Here we meet 35 year-old Ana who has been married for several years but does not have any children yet.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  Ana has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes it because of the camaraderie that she has found within the group and also for the help that she receives through the loans.

Ana works in a factory in the city of Manta but she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works from Monday to Friday, from 8.30am to 5.00pm, in the factory and makes her sales in the evenings and on weekends.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  She tells us that she has been in this line of work for two years and that she started out with the first loan that she received from her community bank.

Ana will use this loan to buy perfume, jewelry, cosmetics and creams.  Her dream is to own a store.

loans.use: to buy perfume, jewelry, cosmetics and creams

loans.name: Kambeng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KAMBENG est créé le 26 Mai 2001. Il est composé de 6 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par le lien de parenté et de voisinage. Leur activité principale est le maraichage et le petit commerce.

Madame Aramata M. debout à gauche de la photo emmitouflé d'une écharpe bleu est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 03 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches

Elle fait une activité de maraichage. Elle exploite à domicile un petit jardin de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis environ 10 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter des intrant agricoles pour faire son jardinage

Son objectifs est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux(scolarité des enfants, santé etc...)
texts.en:
The Kambeng solidarity group was created on May 26, 2001. It is composed of six women from the same neighborhood. They are relatives and neighbors who decided to form a group together. Their main line of work is market gardening and vending. 

Mrs. Aramata M., on the left in the photo wrapped in a blue scarf, is the group’s leader. She is married and the mother of five. She also has three other children in her care, entrusted to her by relatives.  Her business activity is marked gardening. She has a small vegetable garden by her house. She has lots of experience after having practiced gardening for about 10 years. Her new loan will allow her to buy agricultural inputs needed for gardening. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family needs (her children’s education, healthcare, etc.).

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Meyling Raquel

texts.es: Meyling casada, su esposo trabaja como inspector, tiene a sus hijos estudiando, planes que se profesionalicen para un mejor futuro.  Tiene su propio negocio vende  variedades de ropa, bisutería,  prendas de plata y oro desde hace años atrás inicio su negocio como vendedora de otra persona y poco a poco con fondo propio empezó a vender sus propios productos. Proyección aumentar su ventas así adquiriendo mayores ganancia.  Hoy en día con  el préstamo comprara mercadería: anillos, cadenas, pulseras, chapas, dígitos, ropas de damas, para aumentar su inventario y ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Meyling is married.  Her husband works as an Inspector.  She has her children in school and plans for them to become professionals to have a better future.

She has her own business selling clothes, costume jewelry, silver and gold items.  She started out years ago working as a salesperson for someone else but gradually started selling her own products using her own funds.  Her aim is to increase sales to earn higher profits.

Today, she’ll use the loan to buy merchandise: rings, chains, bracelets, make-up, fingernails, women’s clothes to increase inventory and offer customers more variety.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jesús Irving

texts.es:
Este cliente reside en esta ciudad capital   de Managua, el señor Jesús Irvin  se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre honrado  trabajador con buenos valores y principios  morales como persona, debido a que ha sabido  ganarse el aprecio de sus  compañeros de labores. 
Se presento ante esta oficina  de  Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción, como es lamina   de zic perlìnes y  pago de  mano obra, este crédito será utilizado para cambiar techo en mal estado de su vivienda.
texts.en: He lives in the capital city of Managua. Jesus Irvin is known to be an honest, hardworking man with good personal values and morals. He has won the appreciation of his work colleagues. He came to the offices of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) to request a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials, such as zinc sheets, and structural steel, and to pay for the labor costs. This loan will be used to change the roofing of his house which is currently in poor condition.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Henrry

texts.es: El señor Henrry, oriundo de provincia Larecaja de la ciudad de La Paz, su actividad es la renta de su vehículo y sus dos líneas de la asociación "moto taxis ", también como otra fuente son las maquinas de juegos que funcionan con monedas, el sr. Henrry esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en el y brindarle un apoyo para poder obtener una motocicleta así utilizara el crédito en la compra de una motocicleta para poder trabajarla de la cual obtenga otra fuente de ingreso y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia es una persona dinámica siempre viendo a que actividad dedicarse, pensando en su familia.
texts.en: Henrry, originally from the province of Larecaja and the city of La Paz, rents out his vehicle and his two telephone lines through his business Moto Taxis. Also, as another source of income he has slot machines. Henrry is grateful to our organization for placing confidence in him and helping him get a motorcycle. He will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle so he can use it for another source of income and have a better quality of life for his family. He is a dynamic person, always looking at whatever activity he is doing and thinking of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  Harriet has a business of selling bananas.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products from home by means of retail. 

Harriet has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Harriet include defaulters and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to farmers for bananas, and also to sell on a wholesale basis only. 

She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Videkon 2 Group

texts.fr: VIDEKON 2 est un groupement composé de seize personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quarter au Bénin. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pierrette est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Félix. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés ; et un autre enfant à leur charge. Les charges de la famille sont supportées de façon conjointe par Pierrette et son mari. Pierrette  n'est pas allée à l'école. Pour assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Pierrette vend des tissus et des mèches depuis trois ans par le système de distribution. Pierrette achète ses produits au Togo et au Bénin. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Pierrette et à son groupement VIDEKON 2 de rehausser leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaires et leur revenu.
texts.en: The Videkon 2 group comprises 16 people who all live in the same area in Benin. This is the first time this group is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ, in order to raise the level of their business and better respond to the demands of their clientele. The group representative, named Pierrette, is the one with the raised hand in the photo. Pierrette is 42 years old and married to a man named Félix. The couple have three children, all of whom are in school; they also have an additional child in their care. Pierrette and her husband together provide for the family. To meet her children's needs, Pierrette has been selling fabric and hair extensions for three years through the local distribution system. She gets her products in Togo and in Benin. This loan will certainly allow her and her group, Videkon 2, to enhance their business and increase their sales and income.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and hair extensions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for baby clothing to sell

loans.name: 9.3 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Ms. Toàn is applying for a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Toàn is 65 years old and she is married with four children. Toàn is the group leader of the 9.3 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of six members. Toàn supports no dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Toàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Toàn has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Toàn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Using her business profit, Toàn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a 45-year-old man. He is married and has six sons and four daughters. He lives in Rafah city in Gaza Strip located in Palestine. Emad is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets decent salary. He needs to pay for purchasing a new home refrigerator with better technology options, but his decent salary doesn't 'allow him to do that, so he is in need of a loan for 1,000 from FATEN. When Emad gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay easily to purchase a new home refrigerator and let his family live in healthier and better conditions.
Emad is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a new home refrigerator.

loans.name: Mery Anselma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery Anselma; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, ella vende chupetes, caramelos, chocolates y galletas, la socia tiene un kiosco escolar en la universidad, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chupetes, caramelos, gaseosas y chocolates al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “QORIMANCACHA”.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

This is Mery Anselma; she is 45 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling candy.  She sells lollipops, caramels, chocolates, and cookies.  She has a school kiosk at the university.  She works from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm.  She wants to grow and better her business selling candy.  She requests this loan to buy lollipops, caramels, soda and chocolates wholesale.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make all her payments.

loans.use: to buy lollipops, caramels, soda and chocolates wholesale.

loans.name: Kapatu W.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maximillah and the members of Kapatu WG group in Western Kenya!  Maximillah is the Kapatu WG facilitator. She and her co-group members joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Like the majority of farmers in Western Kenya, the farmers of Kapatu WG group farm maize as a staple crop.  They will receive in-kind input loans from One Acre Fund to plant maize in 2012.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Maximillah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Maximillah takes care of six children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to ensure food security for the family and to be able to access fertilizer and high quality hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Maximillah had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Maximillah was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 2 acres of land.

With income from the maize sales, Maximillah will invest in her children's education.

In 2012, the members of Kapatu WG group will each plant maize on plots between ½ and 2 acres of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Olimchon

texts.ru: Олимчон проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст,  33 года. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Жена его домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу. Он покупает стекла большого размера, нарезает и продает. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для покупки стекол.
texts.en: Olimchon lives in the Dangara district.  He is 33 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He provides a service.  Olimchon buys large-size glass, cuts it and sells it.  He has been involved in this business for 8 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of glass.

loans.use: to purchase glass

loans.name: Gloria Stella

texts.es: Gloria Stella de 46 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto con su pequeña hija Ericka  de 7 años la cual se encuentra estudiando. Gloria se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honesta y con muchos deseos de superarse. Para ella lo más importante es su familia. No pierde las esperanzas de algún día ver a su hija convertida en una profesional y con mejores oportunidades de vida. Esto es lo que inspira a Gloria a trabajar duramente en su salón de belleza que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya logró ganarse la confianza de muchas personas. El objetivo Gloria es ampliar su negocio de tal manera que la capacidad del mismo sea más grande y logre cubrir una mayor demanda. Esta inversión piensa hacerla por medio de un crédito ya que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para hacerlo por sus medios. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar los materiales necesarios (peines, secadoras, planchas, artículos para el cabello, tijeras, esmaltes, etc.) para continuar dando el servicio y  lograr el objetivo de ampliar el negocio.  Tiene mucha confianza de alcanzar el objetivo trazado ya que es una mujer perseverante y siempre logra lo que se propone. Confía mucho en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta manera su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejorará.
texts.en:
Gloria Stella is 46 years old and lives in her own home together with her young daughter Ericka who is 7 years old and in school.  Gloria is a hard-working, honest woman who has a great desire to do well.  The most important thing in her life is her family.  She doesn't lose hope of one day seeing her daughter become a professional with better opportunities in life.  This is what inspires Gloria to work hard in her beauty salon which she managed to set up with a great deal of effort.

Gloria has been working in her business for a long time and has gained many people's trust.  Her goal is to expand her business so that she can serve more people and so that she can cope with more demand.  She plans to make this investment through a loan as she doesn't have the money she needs to do it on her own.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the materials she needs (combs, dryers, hair straighteners, haircare products, scissors, nail polish, etc.).  This will enable her to continue providing her service and achieve her aim of expanding her business.  She is very confident that she will achieve her goal as she is a persevering woman who always achieves what she sets out to achieve.  She trusts in God and in her work that, in this way, her own quality of life and that of her family will improve.

loans.use: to buy combs, dryers, hair straighteners, haircare products, scissors, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra.
