She closely monitors the growth and development of her chickens, as that is directly tied into the price for which she can sell them. Once they reach the desired size and weight, she kills and cleans them, and prepares them so they are ready for the grill. Her business is successful due to the fact that the chickens reach the desired size and weight in 40 days. This is her second loan from MFP, and she enjoys working with her community bank because all of its associates are responsible and there are never any problems regarding re-payment schedules. With this loan, she will buy baby chicks as well as food for their breeding.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase baby chicks and food for their breeding

loans.name: Marcela Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Marcela Yolanda P.
texts.en: Marcela Yolanda P.

loans.use: To purchase speakers, and for maintenance of her sound equipment.

loans.name: Peter Luis

texts.es:
Peter  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres del Dos Mil.
Peter es conviviente  tiene 41 años, tres hijos de 12, 9 y 4 años ellos están estudiando en la escuela estatal 
Peter estudio contabilidad en un instituto, pero no lo ejerció por qué no encontraba trabajo  y se puso a trabajar en lo que encontrara   hace diez años se  dedica a trabajar trabaja medio tiempo en un agencia de envió y recibo de dinero, y por las tardes trabaja vendiendo y comprando dólares.
Peter necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles para la compra de dólares para su negocio.
Desde que Peter esta en Finca, ha recibido orientación en el negocio.
 El sueño de Peter es tener su casa de cambio.
texts.en:
Peter is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres del Dos Mil.” He lives with his partner, is 41 years old, and has three children (ages 12, 9, and 4), who all study in the state school. Peter studied accounting, but has not worked as an accountant because he wasn’t able to find any work. Therefore, he tried to get work wherever he could find it. For ten years, he has been working part-time at an agency that sends and receives money. In the afternoons, he works selling and buying dollars. Peter needs a loan of 1,600 soles so he can buy dollars for his business. As a member of Finca Peter has received business training. Peter dreams of having a currency exchange.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Peter necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles para la compra de dólares para su negocio.

loans.name: Mahsudchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Махсудчон Чабборов занимается торговлей. Он продает женскую обувь. В самом начале предпринимательской деятельности Махсудчон сам привозил товар из Китая и продовал его на рынке города.Сейчас он покупает товар у поставщиков. С 14 лет он помогал своей матери на рынке, которая так же продовала обувь. Теперь, он имея достаточный опыт работы в сфере торговли, сам справляется с этой работой. 
 Хочет получить кредит для закупа обуви летнего сезона, а так же расширить ассортимент своего товара. Для достижения этой цели, Махсудчон запрашивает сумму в размере 1600 сомони
texts.en:
Mahsudchon C. is involved in sales of women’s shoes. At the beginning of his entrepreneurship, he brought merchandise from China and sold it at a city market. Now he buys the merchandise from suppliers. Since Mahsudchon was 14 years old, he helped his mother sell shoes at a market. Now that he has plenty of experience in this field, he is able to do the work himself. Mahsudchon wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase a stock of summer season shoes and to expand his goods assortment. Mahsudchon needs a sum of 1600 somoni to achieve this goal.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer season shoes

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La Sra. Felipa C. M., tiene como actividad económica la venta de comida la cual expende en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la puerta de su domicilio, actividad que desarrolla diario desde hace 1 año en el lugar, constituyéndose en una fuente principal de ingresos para ella ya que su familia se encuentra en el exterior.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felipa C. M. has as her economic activity the sale of food which she sells from a stand found in the doorway of her home, an activity she has done daily for one year, constituting a principal income source for her now that her family is gone.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Going to investment in building a kitchen menage and working capital.

loans.name: God Is Good Group

texts.en: Charlotte is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children. She is a food vendor. Charlotte is the leader of a trust bank group called "God is Good." She is shown at the right of the photograph. They are a group of seven but only two showed up at the meeting. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors, or farmers. They work to support their spouses in providing for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares, or goods from other towns, and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for a loan to help them procure more goods to enable them to expand their businesses. It is the heartfelt desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Jose Donald

texts.es: El señor José Donald Pavón C., tiene la edad de 39 años , habita en el barrio Covilaco ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le poya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos una de veinte la cual trabaja y estudia y una adolescente que actualmente estudia y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don José desde hace 16 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son los  recursos económicos , los planes futuros hacia sus cultivos es hacer renovación y reforestación . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos.
texts.en:
José Donald Pavón C. is 39 years old. He lives in the Covilaco neighborhood in the municipality of La Concepción with his wife, who works and helps him with the household expenses. They have two daughters: the older one, who is 20, works and goes to school, while the younger one is a teenager and currently goes to school and helps her family with the household chores. José wants to improve his family’s standard of living. He has made a living in farming for 16 years. The greatest difficulty he has faced is economic resources. His plans for the future involve changing his crops and reforestation on his land. He will use this loan to purchase fertilizer and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Helyn

texts.en:
Helyn F., a 42-year-old mother of six children, the eldest 23 years old, has been a CEVI client since 2005. She dreams of improving her business profits in order to meet the expenses of tuition and books for her children's education and is therefore requesting a loan of Php 22,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to be used to finance her water-selling business.

Helyn hopes that her loan from CEVI will result in good business returns. She likes the services of CEVI because it offers a very small interest rate of 2% a month which she feels is affordable, given her circumstances.

loans.use: For business financing

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema operates a fruit and vegetable vending business in their rural village of South Caronsi, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She roams around their village to sell her merchandise.  From the business, Jema is able to generate an income of PHP1, 000 a week which is very beneficial in providing the daily needs of her family and give the educational needs of her children.  For the continuous improvement of her enterprise, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP12,000 from the KIVA lenders.  She is hoping that her loan will be granted for it will really help to achieve her goals.  

Jema is 22 years old and she is already married to Jessie who assisted her in planting different kinds of vegetables in their farm that she sells after harvest. Her husband sometimes works as a carpenter in their village to earn additional income. The couple is blessed with two children: James - 5 years old and Jessie Jr. is one year old. Jema is willing to extend help to others because she always believes that “it is better to give than to receive”.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Positivas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo. Podemos hablar de la Sra. Maria Nilda P. con 40 años de edad  tiene 1 hijo ella es peluquera trabaja en la peluquería de una prima, pero ahora esta por montar su propia peluquería en su casa para estar mas cerca de su hijo, ya que el niño queda bajo el cuidado de su abuela.
Tiene casa propia pero es madre soltera, de esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías varias para la venta.

loans.name: Santa Cruz Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal “Santa Cruz” esta representado por la señora Beatriz y conformado por 14 miembros, del barrio Melchor pinto. La presidenta que fue quien motivo a la demás para solicitar el crédito se dedica al comercio D. diferentes productos D. la época para generar ingresos, el resto D. las socias se dedican a la elaboración y comercialización D. artesanías, construcción D. viviendas, venta D. gaseosas, llantas para vehículos, perfumes, atención en billar y el servicio domestico. La competencia hoy en día se ve más que en otros años pero lo importante es que ellas tienen clientes fijos y ellas siempre cumplen al pedido D. sus clientes, además tratan D. vender su producto a un menor precio minimizando sus costos y  generando una ganancia razonable para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para empezar un negocio, compra D. rocola para sus locales D. expendio D. comida, para emprender nuevos negocios y para la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que les ayuden a generar una mejor rentabilidad. Este es su primer crédito comunal que adquieren como grupo se ve en las reuniones que son gente responsable y con ganas D. salir adelante. El señor David se encuentra acompañado por su esposa en la fotografia.
texts.en:
The Santa Cruz Communal Bank is led by Sra. Beatriz and consists of 14 members from the neighborhood of Melchor Pinto. The group president was responsible for encouraging the other members to pursue a loan since most of them have different businesses in which they sell various seasonal products to generate income. The remaining members make and sell handicrafts, build houses, sell soft drinks, install vehicle tires, market perfumes, operate billiard halls, and proviD. domestic services.

The competition they face today is greater than that of previous years, but the important thing is that they have regular customers and always strive to satisfy their requests. In addition, they try to sell their products at the lowest price possible so that they can generate a decent income to support their families. Their loan will be used to start new businesses as well as acquire merchandise, supplies, and tools to help them become more profitable. This is their first loan as a group. They are all responsible people and united by their desire to succeed.

In the photograph, Sr. David is accompanied by his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Eniseria

texts.en: Eniseria P. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Eniseria owns and operates a hog raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Eniseria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Eniseria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sandag-Ochir

texts.en:
Sandag-Ochir E. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and six children in a house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. Her husband runs a taxi service; her two oldest children each own their own businesses, her four youngest children all attend a local secondary school, and E. operates a retail clothing business. She began her business in 2000 and operates it out of a stall in Narantuul, Ulaanbaatar’s largest outdoor market.

Over the past nine years, E. has proven to be a very hard-working entrepreneur with a lot of business and customer service experience. Currently, her working capital exceeds 2 million tugrugs (and she operates with a profit margin of 30%). She hopes that when the time comes, she and her husband will be able to afford to send all of their children to university, where they can learn how to improve their own lives and the lives of others. E. is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (approx. $1013 USD) loan in order to purchase more clothing for her business and to increase her working capital. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her business and increase her working capital

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon T. lives in Sambou village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice.  His field is infertile and he does not have enough money to buy farming supplies to support the rice field. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to support his rice field.  His wife, Khouv South, is a snack seller.  Thon T. is 53 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are farmers and the others are employed in a garment factory. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to support the rice field.

loans.name: Luz Mercedes

texts.es:
Luz Mercedes es una mujer activa y trabajadora, vive en distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 62 años, es madre de tres hijos (todos mayores de edad)y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabja en el sector maderero.
Luz se dedica al alquiler de cuartos y está contenta de estar en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque le diò la oportunidad de mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. 
Luz forma parte del Banco Comunal “Perlas de Yarinacocha” desde hace cinco años y el primer  crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en el arreglo de las puertas de los cuartos que alquila.
Actualmente ella necesita de un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de madera para posteriormente venderlas. 
La meta de Luz es tener una tienda de artículos del hogar y prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Luz Mercedes is an active, hardworking woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha District in the Ucayali region. She's 62-years-old and the mother of two children (both grown up). She enjoys the support of her husband who works in the timber industry. Luz earns her living renting rooms and is pleased to be with the Manuela Ramos Movement because it has given her the opportunity to raise her household income. Luz has been a member of the "Perlas de Yarinacocha" Village Bank for five years; her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to fix the doors to the rooms she rents out. Now she needs a loan for 3000 soles, which she plans to use to buy wood for resale. Her goal is to have a clothing and household items store.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She'll use her loan to buy wood to resell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou F., 44 years old , is a mother and a farmer in Norala, South Cotabato in Mindanao. She has three children, who also help her on the farm, tilling the soil. They work as a team from morning until sunset, so that they will be able to ensure that they will have an abundant harvest. This is because they take seriously the growing of their rice crop. 

She hopes to receive a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way she will be able to improve the size of her harvest and income as well.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Oftab Faroozan Group

texts.en:
This is Oftab Faroozan group.Faroozan is the leader of oftab faroozan group and married with 2 childern.One son and on daughter.They are students at school. She is a hard working woman who always supports her husband and childern. She wants to receive a loan for the business of carpet weaving.She has experience in this business for more than 10 years.The beaustiful carpets that she weaves is quite popular in her area and she sells them with high price. By this loan she would like to buy a new carpet frame for her work. She hopes to expand her business and to be able to send her childern in better private schools. 
She would like to extend her gratitude to all Kiva lenders who really support people around the world.

loans.use: purchasing a new carpet frame

loans.name: Tamunang

texts.en:
Born in 1948, Tamumang J. is married  and they are having three children. Due to the fact that he is too difficult for him to take care of the family single-handedly and provide the children’s basic care, and also that his wife could not do it alone, he decided to join GHAPE in 1998. Also, he has been having a lot of marital problems with his family and this has made him sad all the time, but he is appreciative of the fact that he is alive.

J. desire is to give his children love and education. He states that he feels better each time he provides something small for his children. His inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs is what motivated him to obtain a loan from GHAPE.

Given the loan, J. plans to buy a motorcycle to start a transportation business. He knows this business will succeed because he is located at a good business site and he has a good rider for the motorcycle. He plans to use the generated profits to sponsor his children in school and to cater for the basic needs of his family.




About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Propositos 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Eladia, 49, is a borrower who lives in Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres Unidas con Propositos (United Women with Purpose), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Eladia and her husband live in a simple home in Santiago with their two children. Santiago is the second-largest city in the Dominican Republic. Life in urban areas of the Dominican Republic is overcrowded and can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Eladia runs a successful business selling miscellaneous items to her friends and neighbors. With this loan, she will purchase perfumes, clothing, appliances, and sweets to sell for a small profit at her street stand.

This is Eladia’s fifth loan with Esperanza International. With continued profits, Eladia hopes to purchase a small truck so that she can buy her merchandise more easily and in greater quantities. She also hopes to support her children’s education with the benefits from her business, making sure that they receive the best schooling possible. In the future, Eladia hopes to purchase her own store and continue increasing the size of her sales and customer base.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Eladia and the Mujeres Unidas con Propositos group!

loans.use: To purchase clothing, perfume, appliances, and sweets for resale

loans.name: Sinavaiui

texts.en:
Sinavaiui S. is 25 and married with 2 children (ages 3 and 4).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Sinavaiui has 2 years of experience in this business.  Sinavaiui needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 260 tala or US $108 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Sinavaiui joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sinavaiui's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sinavaiui S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard Q. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. He is 31 years old. Leonard is married and has 3 school-aged children. Leonard owns & operates a business providing trisikad (a motorized tricycle) transportation to local community members. Leonard has been working in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Leonard joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Leonard is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leonard from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla S. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Perla is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her business comes from buying and selling spices like onions, garlic and tomatoes. Perla has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Perla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Perla from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John C., 37 years, old is a rice grower from Veruela, Agusan del Sur. He started tilling a farm last 2006. He is a very experienced farmer and would like to raise his family with his farm products. He dreams that someday they will have enough for all their needs. He prays that all his children would know and serve God as well. 

He would like to apply for a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidia  M.  est âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari avec ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle avec 2 autres coépouses  au  quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fait l’école et issue d’une famille de commerçants, elle commença très tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des  poissons. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière jusqu’à son mariage, elle décide d’évoluer seule en menant le commerce de jus de fruits et de glace. 
Elle  mène cette  activité  depuis  maintenant 10 ans et  jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. 
Dans le dessein de renforcer ses capacités de production, elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 30 mois, après 5 prêts solidaires tous  bien remboursés. 
Elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel et compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 2 congélateurs. Elle s’approvisionne en République Islamique de Mauritanie. Madame Kadidia  M.  vend ses jus et glace au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 75 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de subvenir à certaines de ses charges (habillement, savons et médicaments).
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadidia M. is 51 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives at her husband’s place with her children in a traditional family with two other co-spouses. They live in the neighborhood of Hamdallaye in Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She did not attend school and came from a family of retailers. She started very early in the business with her mother who sold fish. After several years of apprenticeship next to her mother and until her wedding, she decided to develop by herself by conducting a business of fruit juices and ice cream. She has been in this business for 10 years now and enjoys a large customer base and notoriety. With the intention to strengthen her production ability she appealed to Soro Yiriwaso. She has had this relationship for the last 30 months, after 5 group loans all fully reimbursed. This is her first individual loan and she would like to use it to buy 2 freezers. She buys her supplies in the Islamic Republic of Mauritania. Mrs. Kadidia M. sells her juices and ice cream for cash or on credit to customers made up of women and men. She is planning on making a monthly profit of 75,000 Francs CFA, which will allow her to provide for some of her expenses (clothing, soap, medications).

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of freezers

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn H. (pictured here), is 49 years old. Her husband, Mr. Yi Srey, is 56 years old. They have been married for nineteen years and have two daughters. The family lives in suburb of Phnom Penh.

Her husband is a fisherman and Yorn sells the fish that he catches in the local market. Unhappily, some of his fishing equipment breaks and does not work well. This upsets his business. 

Therefore, Yorn is requesting her first loan of $400 to purchase new equipment for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Milion Mussa

texts.pt:
Milion Mussa C. nasceu em Niassa Capital Lichinga, Norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos, os dois mais velhos gêmeos de 14, 12 e de 3 anos de idade destes três vão a escola. Fez a 12ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe enviando dinheiro para despesas de casa.

Saiu de Lichinga para Maputo com seu irmão para continuar com os estudos. Trabalha como conselheiro e gestor de dados nos médicos do mundo ha mais de 8 anos, onde mensalmente aufere 700U$D dólar americano, correspondente a (17.500.00mt) que aplica nas despesas de casa e da sua obra. Consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria, mas não sempre porque tem que pagar as despesas escolares da sua esposa na Faculdade.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Milion na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual será usado para legalizar o terreno em anexo ao anterior. Os anteriores e ambos de 15.000.00mr foram usados na compra de material de construção para sua obra.
Esta convicto que vai pagar cem nenhum problema e pedir um novo para erguer uma casa no terreno que esta por legalizar.
texts.en:
Milion Mussa C. was born in Lichinga--the capital city of Niassa province--in northern Mozambique. He is married and is the father of 4 children. The two oldest are 14 year old twins, and the other children are 12 and 3 years of age. Three of them attend school. Milion studied through the 12th grade, but did not continue due to a lack of resources. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother by sending her money to use for household expenses. Milion left Lichinga for Maputo with his brother in order to continue his studies. He has worked as an advisor and a data manager for Doctors of the World [Médicos do Mundo/Médicins du Monde, a non-governmental organization] for over 8 years. He makes 17,500 MZN per month--equivalent to $700 USD--, which he uses to pay for household expenses and his own work. He saves some in his bank account, although he is not always able to because he has to pay for his wife's college expenses. This is Milion's third loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva. It has a value of 15,000 MZN, which he will use to legalize the land attached to his other property. The previous loans, both for 15,000 MZN, were used to buy construction material for the work. He is sure that he will be able to pay back the loan without any problems and ask for another one in order to erect a house on the land to be legalized.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To legalize land

loans.name: Lokina Enole

texts.en:
Lokina Enole S. is 44 years old and is married to David Sadera. They have two children who both go to school.

Lokina is a farmer who later sells what she harvests at a profit. She has been doing this for the last ten years.

She learned about KADET from another womens group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan which she is planning to spend on preparing her land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Lokina's dream is do large scale farming and attain financial independence. She describes herself as a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To plough her two acres of land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Brgy. Pipindan, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 39 years old. Rebecca is married and has three children. The eldest is 17 years old and the youngest is a 12-year-old high school student. To make a good living, Rebecca is engaged in the fish-vending business. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Rebecca joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in income-generating activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI. This previous loan was used for the expansion of her fish-selling business. 

She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell and to continue to expand her business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Rebecca from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to increase her ventures. With the help of ASHI, she has already funded the education of her three children.

With the chance given to her family by KIVA partner ASHI, the couple believes that they are getting nearer to the success of their family dreams. Rebecca’s dreams are for her children to complete college.  Additionally, she hopes to continue fish vending as a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell and continue to expand her business

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre de familia de 50 años que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector San Miguel del caserío Lagartera, una de las tantas zonas rurales que conforman el distrito de Mórrope, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir en un pequeño taller que está instalado en su vivienda, el cuenta con una máquina de coser pequeña con la que confecciona pantalones, los cuales ofrece en venta a un acopiador de la zona que los distribuye en ciudades de la sierra norte del país, este negocio es la principal fuente de sustento para la economía de su familia, adicionalmente tiene ganado de engorde, el cual vende eventualmente con lo que se genera ingresos adicionales.

Cesar desea implementar su taller adquiriendo una remalladora que le permita realizar sus labores con mayor comodidad y eficiencia, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su meta.

Cesar es un hombre trabajador y entregado a su familia, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas. En la zona donde vive es considerado una persona responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 50 year old husband and father who lives with his wife and children in the San Miguel sector of the village of Lagartera. This is one of the many rural areas that make up the district of Mórrope, an agricultural district that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is found forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He makes clothing in a small workshop set up in his home. He has a small sewing machine with which he makes pants that he sells to an area warehouse that distributes them in cities in the northern sierra of the country. This business is the main source of support for his family. He also has beef cattle which he sells eventually and with which he generates additional income. Cesar wants to outfit his workshop adquiring an overlocker which will allow him to do his work with more convenience and efficiency. That is why he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles which will allow him to attain his goal. Cesar is a hardworking man who is dedicated to his family. He has worked with our institution previously and has shown himself to be punctual and responsible when it comes to making payments. In the area where he lives he is considered a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an overlocker to improve his clothing making business.

loans.name: Félix Jerónimo

texts.es:
El señor Felix Jerónimo M. R. se dedica a reparación de bicicletas y es propietario de dos triciclos, habita en el bario Camilo Ortega, es casado, tiene solo un hijo y ya es independiente, es mayor de edad.

Lleva ya 21 créditos con CEPRODEL los cuales los ha pagado en tiempo y forma, actualmente solicito créditos para realizar unas reparaciones en su casa ya que el techo está un poco deteriorado y se le pasa el agua, los creditos anteriores los ha utilizado para reparacion de sus medios de trabajo.
texts.en:
Felix Jerónimo M. R. repairs bicycles and owns two tricycles. He lives in the Camilio Ortega neighborhood, is married and has one adult son who is now on his own. He has had 21 previous loans through CEPRODEL, which he has repaid as agreed. He is asking for this loan in order to be able to make repairs to the roof of his house, as the roof is a bit deteriorated and it leaks. He used the previous loans to make repairs to his work media.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Veasna's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of 15 members who live in Boeng KrU. Leu village, Kandal province. Mrs. Vaeasna C. is 38 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its members. With the loans, the members of this village will use their money to support different purposes. 
Mrs. Vaeasna C. is a farmer who owns 1.3 hectares of land, which she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sinat Tith, is an iron welder and also helps his wife on the farm. With both of these occupations they hope to increase income to improve their family. 

This couple has four children: One is a seamstress in a garment factory and two are students, while the youngest one, a six year old, is not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed to cultivate rice

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie B. is 41 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the town of Banga in South Cotabato province in the Southern Mindanao islands. Elvie is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. She also raises pigs for fattening and wants to raise ducks as well.

Elvie joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. Elvie successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and feed for the pigs and ducklings. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and feed for her pigs and ducklings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase goats and sheep

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. Hing M. is a hardworking woman who has spent her life cultivating crops. Mrs. Hing M., 40, is an older woman. She owns a few farmlands in which she grows crops. Her husband works in a private organization in the province of Kampong Chhnang and has a proper salary to cover the family expenses. This couple has four children, all of whom are currently single. Mrs. Hing M. has had great success growing crops, which is an annual process. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. Unfortunately, her old cow is getting old, and it can’t support her during the plowing process. Because of that, Mrs. Hing M. is taking out her first loan to purchase a new cow to replace the old one, and the remainder of the loan will be used to buy fertilizers for her crop.

loans.use: To purchase a new cow to replace the old one

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard O. is 32 years old and is married to Josephine, who is a shopkeeper. They have four children: Yvonne, 12 years; Philemon, nine years; Steve, seven years and Mathew, four years. 

Benard has a welding business that he has been running for the past ten years. He needs materials for welding, so he is applying for a loan. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD and has a good credit history.

His hopes to open up a welding workshop and create employment by having people there help him manage his business.

loans.use: Buy welding materials

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg S. is 29 years old and a single parent with three children.  She lives with her children and her mother in a winter house in her brother's yard in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, . All three of her children attend a local secondary school while her mother is retired. 

Battsetseg operates a knitting and felt products making business in her town. She started her business in 2007 after purchasing a wool spinning machine. In addition, she started to make traditional boots for children to supplement her earnings.  She has received many orders for her new item.  She is a modest person and is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase materials and supplies to make traditional Mongolian boots.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies to make traditional Mongolian boots.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.en:
Porfirio E. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 54 years old. Porfirio is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale.  He has been engaged in his business for over 27 years and earns approximately $184 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Porfirio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 29,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Porfirio is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 6th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret N. lives in the Namungoona neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Gorret has a retail shop. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Gorret has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Gorret are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop. Gorret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Doña María de 49 años de edad, reside en Corinto, departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo don José Martin y dos hijos Juan Carlos de 14 años y Xiomara Yamileth de 17 años de edad, doña María administra una tienda desde hace tres años donde ofrece a sus vecinos artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para compra mercadería para la tienda, con esta inversión ella pretende ofrecer a los clientes variedad de productos para cocinar y para las prioridades del hogar como pastas, pollo, condimentos, arroz y frijol.
Sueña con un negocio estable con mucha clientela y generar los ingresos para dar la educación y salud a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and she lives in Corinto, in the region of Morazan. She lives with her husband Jose Martin, and their two children: Juan Carlos, 14, and Xiomara Yamileth, 17. Maria has had a general store for the past 3 years, selling to basic household needs items to her neighbors.

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for the store. With this investment she will be able to offer her clients a variety of products for the kitchen, such as pastas, chicken, condiments, rice, and beans. 

She dreams of having a stable business with a large clientele to generate enough income for the education and welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase pasta, chicken, condiments, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 40 years old, married and has one child. Amy is a farmer. She plants rice crops and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from rice farming. Amy wants to improve her earning, and be able to provide for all her family's needs. She hopes and prays for better harvest.

Amy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks and more lappas (a traditional dress for women)

loans.name: Activas De Chapulco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ACTIVAS DE CHAPULCO, el cual esta ubicado en la comunidad de CHAPULCO en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. En la fotografia se muestra la actividad comercial a la que se dedica la señora Teodora S. M., Ella tiene 55 años y estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria y tiene  un hijo. La señora vende cosméticos por catálogos aproximadamente más de 3 años, sus clientes la prefieren porque les da precio razonable y en pequeños pagos, comentan que aparte de su amabilidad ha procurado entregar sus productos lo más rápido posible. La señora Teodora comenta que este crédito lo destinara a la compra de más mercancia y para surtit los pedido pendientes. Las ganacias las esta destinando para cubrir sus pago de mercancía. También desea construir una pequeña barda en un terreno que tiene en su localidad. Esta segura que con la ayuda de la institucion y con la entrega de mas creditos a futuro lograra sus meta.
texts.en:
This group is called "Activas de Chapulco" and is located in the community of Chapulco in the state of Puebla, Mexico.  The group has 10 members.  

The photograph shows Teodora S.M.'s business.  She is 55 years old, studied until fifth grade, and has a son.  She has sold cosmetics by catalog for more than three years.  Her customers prefer her because she offers reasonable prices and small payments.  In addition to her kindness, she also delivers her products as quickly as possible.  

This loan will allow Teodora to purchase more merchandise and fill all of her outstanding orders.  The profits will cover her payments for more merchandise.  She would also like to build a small fence on a plot of land she has.  She is certain that with the help of the institution and with future loans, she will be able to meet her goal.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a 35-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  a general store , e-loading and a trisikad transport business. She lives in Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Bernadette is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Bernadette aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.Kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en:
From the province of Kompong Cham, Thuok C. is a 31-year-old mother caring for four children. All of her children are still living in the family home. Thuok C. is a recycling seller, buying used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods she deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires, cans, old bottles, and plastic items. Her husband works in the construction field as a building worker. 

Thuok C. is concerned that she is can barely use her old bicycle for traveling far away in order to buy used goods, and she dreams of having a vehicle to pick up her goods, but she doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Therefore, Thuok C. would like to borrow a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her transportation. She intends to use some funds to add with her savings to buy a plot of land for building her a new house. Thuok C. and her young child are in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her transportation and buy a plot of land for building her new house.

loans.name: Martha Paubla

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo, está rodeada por maravillosas playas de clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 43 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos ya es casado y vive independiente, el otro estudia en universidad. Su esposo es empleado público.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalias y  sabanas que son muy solicitadas por su calidad ya que ella ofrece un gran producto. Trabaja  de miércoles a domingo en las tardes realizando sus entregas y cobros ya que deja a crédito sus productos. Su mercadería la adquiere en Guayaquil y a veces en Huaquillas donde compra mercadería peruana que es muy buena y barata. Nos cuenta que lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad, que le va muy bien y le gusta lo que hace.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, sabanas y  sandalias. Está en el banco comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Sus metas son seguir trabajando y crecer cada dia más con su negocio.
texts.en:
The May 8th Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, which is surrounded by beautiful beaches. The weather is warm and pleasant, while the women are lovely and strong-willed.

It is in this place one can find Sra. Martha. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. One child is already married and lives independently, while the other is attending the university. Her husband is a public employee.

Martha sells clothing, sandals, and bed sheets. These products are highly sought after because of their quality. She works Wednesdays through Sundays in the afternoons, making deliveries and collecting payments for the products that have been sold on credit. Martha acquires her merchandise in Guayaquil and sometimes in Huaquillas, where she buys Peruvian goods that are better and cheaper. She says that her business has been in existence for several years and has done very well. Martha also states that she enjoys what she does.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, bed sheets, and sandals. She has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and enjoys the very low interest rates. Her goals are to continue working and to grow each day with her business.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, bed sheets, and sandals.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 34 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Sus padres son agricultores y le enseñaron esta actividad desde muy niña y hoy se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, que junto con su esposo y sus hijos se esfuerzan diariamente para lograr sus ingresos diarios levantándose desde muy temprano. Se siente satisfecho el ver desarrollar sus plantaciones, asimismo lleva a sus ovejas y vacas para que se alimenten de los pastizales que se encuentran en  el campo. Este trabajo es de todo los días y regresa en horas de la tarde para descansar muy temprano y empezar otra jornada más, Sin embargo hay días en que el clima baja su temperatura pero aún así continua trabajando ya que de eso depende la economía de su hogar. Tiene anhelos de seguir adelante, como el tener un establo grande y pueda abastecerse de forraje para sus animales y por tal seguirá esforzándose en el trabajo.Es su primer crédito número que tiene con MFP, acceder a esta oportunidad significa mucho para ella porque va a mejorar significativamente  en su actividad además de que tiene oportunidades de aprendizaje muy ventajosas para ella y su familia.
Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de papa y sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Maruja is 34 years old and lives with her husband and five children in their own home.  Her parents are farmers who taught her when she was a little girl and now this is her primary source of income.  She, her husband, and children work daily and rise very early in the morning.  She is satisfied to see her plants develop, as well as taking her cattle and sheep to graze in the fields near her home.  She does this all day, every day, and gets home late to rest and prepare to begin again the following day.  There are days when the weather gets cold but she continues to work because she depends on the income.  She has a desire to continue and to have a large fully stocked stable, and continue working hard.  This will be her first loan through MFP and this opportunity means a lot to her because it will significantly improve her activities and she will have the chance to learn things that will be advantageous to her family.

She will use the money from this loan to buy potato seed and sacks of fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy potato seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Estela Angelica

texts.es:
Estela es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.    Estela tiene estudios superiores pero no concluido.
Ella se dedica al servicio de transporte suburbano o interurbano (transporte).  También cuenta que brinda servicios de juegos de videos y play station.  Trabaja con e Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 2500.00 nuevo soles, comprará algunos play station, para que su  negocio tenga más clientes.  En el negocio de transporte, trabaja junto  con su esposo.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de internet con el cual pueda complementar su otro negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, los bajos intereses y la solidaridad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of the “Cinnamon Flower” Communal Bank, located in the district and department of Puno. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. Estela has some college education but she didn’t graduate.

Estela works in transportation local or long-distance. She also provides video games and play station games for her customers. Estela has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for some 6 years. Her initial loan was of S/ 300.00 nuevo soles and was used for her business.

With the new loan of S/ 2500.00 nuevo soles, Estela will buy some play stations, so that her business has more customers. She works with her husband in her transportation business.

Estela’s dream is to have an internet café business that would complement her other business and to improve her earnings.

What Estela enjoys about her Communal Bank is the ease of acquiring the loan, the low interest rates and the solidarity between the members.

loans.use: buy some play stations.

loans.name: Maria Aixsa

texts.es:
María es una joven soltera de 26 años de edad que vive con sus padres en el caserío El Verde,  ubicado en el distrito de Pitipo que se encuentra a a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Esta pequeña zona rural se caracteriza por dedicarse a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Desde hace 2 años  María es propietaria de una bodega, que está acondicionada en un pequeño ambiente de adobe, donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.

Las ganancias de su negocio le permiten apoyar a los ingresos del hogar. Debido a la gran demanda que tiene su bodega, se ha visto en la necesidad de gestionar un préstamo, para invertir en compra de arroz y azúcar ya que estos productos han subido de precio considerablemente.

El préstamo que María solicita a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1200 nuevos soles. El sueño que María tiene es que su pequeña bodega llegue a ser una tienda mayorista y con la ayuda de este crédito ella seguirá caminando paso a paso hacia su meta.
texts.en:
María is a young, single 26 year old woman. She lives with her parents in the community of El Verde, located in the district Pitipo, which is located 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. This small rural area is characterized by its agricultural work and the raising of animals. 

María has been the owner of a store for two years. It is set up in a small adobe ambience where she sells basic necessity items such as rice, sugar, oil, etc.  

Her business' earnings allows her to help with household expenses. Due to the high demand her store has, she has decided to take out a loan to invest in purchasing rice and sugar, since these products have gone up in price considerably. 

The loan that María has asked Edpyme Alternativa for is for1200 nuevos soles. Maria's dream is for her small store to become a wholesale business. With the help of this loan, she will keep going step by step toward her goal.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas, tiene 63 años, es casada y tiene 10 hijos.
Fernanda tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general, siembra de cereales, papa, maíz en Pomacocha – Vizchongo, provincia de Vilcas Huaman.  
Está en FINCA Perú desde hace 1 año y medio, ingresó por la invitación de su nuera. Le gusta porque ayudan a las mujeres a trabajar a mejorar en lo personal y en su negocio.
Está ahorrando ahora para tener mas capital para trabajar. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Cocharcas”. She is 63 years old, married, and has 10 children. Fernanda has a grocery store. She also grows grain, potatoes, and corn in Pomacocha-Vizchongo, Province of Vilcas Huaman.

Fernanda has been with FINCA Peru for a year and a half after being invited to join by her daughter-in-law. She enjoys being a member because the other women have helped with her work and with improving her business and as a person.

Now she is saving so that she can have more operating capital. Her dream is to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La Sra. Paulina es una cliente antigua que retorna después de años, vive en la zona de bella vista y tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado de la zona, ella vende todos los días sin  días de descanso,  ella vende desde haca mas de diez años, sus hijos ya son mayores actualmente independientes, prácticamente vive ya sola ya que el mayor tiempo pasa en su puesto de venta. En este momento ella necesita incrementar su capital (compra  de verduras por mayor), es un apersona responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Paulina is a long-standing client who is returning to us after years away.  She lives in Bella Vista district and has a stall in the local market.  Paulina sells her products every day, without a day's rest.  She has been selling her products for more than ten years.  Her children are already grown up and live independently.  She practically lives alone already since she spends most of her time on her stall.  Right now, she needs to increase her capital (buying vegetables wholesale).  Paulina is a responsible and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support she has been offered.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (to increase her capital)

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda tiene la edad de 53 años, solo estudio la secundaria, se encuentra casada  y tiene un hijo de 21 años llamado Angel  que estudia en el Tecnologico de Tierra Blanca Veracruz. Ella vive en el estado de Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela, esta region se caracteriza por ser una zona cañera y a 15 minutos se encuetra el ingenio Don Pablo Machado.

Doña Leonarda nos platica que hace un poco mas de 8 años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella tiene un local en el centro de su comunidad en el cual vende antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tostadas, tacos, gorditas, garnachas y chiles rellenos) los fines de semana (vienes, sabado y domingo) ella vende por las noches y las familias salen a cenar a su local.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de maiz, aceite, chiles, tortillas, carne, frijol, queso, crema, col, sal, gas, mole, platanos, papas, tomates, cebollas y ajos para la elaboracion de sus antojitos mexicanos y venderlos posteriormente.

Doña Leonarda espera que con este credito su negocio propere ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y seguirlo apoyando para que termine sus estudio ademas de que le gustaria agrandar su negocio y comprar algunas mesas y sills para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonarda is 53 years old and only has a high school education. She is married and has a 21-year-old son named Angel who is studying at the Technological Institute of Tierra Blanca Veracruz. Leonarda lives in the community of Tetela in the State of Oaxaca. This region is known for growing sugar cane and is located 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Leonarda says that she decided to start working a little more than eight years ago. She wanted her own business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses. Leonarda has a stand in the central area of her community where she sells Mexican street food such as empanadas, tostadas, tacos, gorditas, “garnachas” (tortillas topped with shredded meat, cheese, and cabbage), and stuffed chili peppers. She sells her food on the weekends, specifically Saturdays and Sundays. Her food is sold at night when families leave to have dinner at her establishment.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of corn, oil, chili peppers, tortillas, meat, beans cheese, cream, cabbage, gas, mole sauce, plantains, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and garlic for preparing Mexican street food that she will sell.

Doña Leonarda hopes that this loan will help her business prosper because she wants to provide her son with a better quality of life and to continue supporting him as he finishes his studies. In addition, she wants to expand her business by adding a few tables and chairs so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her street food business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 27 years old, married with one child who is  3 years old.  He is living in his own house in Hioma Uganda.

For 3 years Godfrey has been running a transport business and from it he has been able to provide for his family. He has been laying bricks where he saved and bought a plot of land, which is expensive and hard to acquire.  He has hopes of buying a taxi for transport in the future. Godfrey wants a loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en:
Fazil is 51, married and has one child. He is a livestock breeder with 3 years of experience. 

Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, Fazil is proposing to expand his flock and to repair his animal enclosure. This will meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and from neighboring villages. Some of his clientele come to buy animals from far away villages. With his goal in mind, Fazil is requesting a loan of 1000 ANZ to serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve his living conditions and he will also make some investments to his business.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep to invest in his business.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina, who is 51 years old, is a married woman who has four children. Her spouse is a farmer working in the Philippines. They earned the average of PHP 60,000 each crop season during April and November. Their profits were usually used in maintaining their basic needs, paying for their children's schooling and for electric bills and loans.    

Martina is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers needed to grow her rice crop. Part of the loan will also be used to pay labor fees in the preparation of her rice field.
 
Someday, Martina hopes to educate all her children to assure them a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur with a used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell. Elvira has been in this business for five years. Elvira earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Elvira has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola, de 30 años es una mujer ejemplar. Ella cuida sola de su pequeño hijo Fabricio de 7 años. Al que educa en casa de sus padres ubicada en la localidad de Santa Ana, en compañía de sus 2 hermanas menores. Elaborar panes en sus diferentes variedades y biscochos, es su especialidad, por eso lleva 10 años dedicada a la panadería bajo las enseñanzas de su padre; hasta hoy en día que laboran juntos. Asegura que gracias a la rentabilidad de su negocio ah podido implementarla aún más, adicionando la venta de mantequilla, queso y embutidos que acompañan a todo pan, por lo que sus ventas subieron. En todo este tiempo a podido cubrir gastos domiciliarios, la educación de su hijo y de ella misma. Pues se encuentra estudiando educación primaria en un instituto de sus localidad en busca de progreso, ya le falta muy poco para culminar. Lo que más le gusta de  su trabajo es repartir los panes y adornar las tortas para ocasiones especiales, además de la temporada de navidad donde hornea pavo. Para su futuro piensa estudiar chocolatería y repostería para incrementar pasteles y bocaditos y ayudar para que sus ventas sean más constantes y seguras. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Banquito” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde está feliz y entusiasmada de continuar laborando de manera activa en su banco comunal. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Fabiola de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos necesario como harina, levadura y manteca para la preparación de sus ricos panes.
texts.en: Fabiola is 30 years old and she is an exemplary woman. She alone takes care of her young son Fabricio, who is 7 years old. She home schools him in her parents' house, located in the locality of Santa Ana. She lives with her 2 younger sisters. She makes various types of breads and biscuits, her specialty. She has been a baker for 10 years and she learned the trade from her father, and to date they work together. She states that following her business success she has been able to expand it even more, adding the sale of butter, cheese, and sausages, to be enjoyed with any type of bread. And given these additions her sales have increased. Throughout all this time she has been able to cover the household expenses, as well as her son's and her own education. In her quest for progress, she is learning to be a primary school teacher at an institution in her locality, and she is almost finished. What she most enjoys about her work is delivering breads and decorating cakes for special occasions. She also likes the Christmas season when she bakes turkeys. In the future she's thinking about studying to be a chocolatier and a pastry chef to improve her cakes and snacks. This will help her sales be more constant and secure. She is a member of the communal bank "Mi Banquito", meaning "My Little Bank" and this is her ninth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is very happy and enthusiastic about continuing her active involved in her communal bank. She also promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Fabiola on receiving your support says she will invest the funds she requests in the purchase of ingredients necessary in the preparation of delicious breads, such as flour, yeast, and lard.

loans.use: to purchase flour and lard, ingredients needed to bake bread.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José es un joven de 24 años que a pesar de su corta edad es una persona muy responsable, el aún vive en casa de su mama, pero el no es una carga ya que trabaja en maquiladora para apoyar con los gastos del hogar. José se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo y terminar de construir la barda enfrente de su vivienda. Este proyecto lo quiere realizar por que en temporadas de lluvia se trasmina el agua y acusa de esto el techo se esta deteriorando, al igual que terminar la barda para brindar a su madre mayor protección. Con el préstamo el comprara cemento, arena, impermeabilizante y pagar la mano de obra para que su proyecto quede realizado.
texts.en: José is a young man of 24 who, in spite of his young age, is a very responsible person.  He still lives in his mom's house but isn't a burden as he works in a cross-border assembly plant in order to support his mom with the household expenses.  José needs to request a loan to waterproof the roof of his home and finish building a perimeter fence out front.  He would like to carry out this work because during rainy seasons the water leaks into the house as the roof is in a bad state of repair.  He would like to finish building the fence in order to provide his mother with more protection.  José will use his loan to buy cement, sand and waterproofing material.  He will also pay labor costs so that his project can be completed.

loans.use: to waterproof his roof and finish building a perimeter fence

loans.name: Trang's Group

texts.en:
Trang was born in 1986. She lives in Xom Cho village, Co Loa commune. She is married with one child who is still small. Her husband is a worker with an income. 
Mrs Trang has a restaurant where she sells rice and noodles. Every day she has to get up early and go to the market to buy goods for her restaurant. She has run her restaurant for three years and makes a monthly income of about 4,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Since 2007 she has participated in Kiva partner, SEDA. For her last loan she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid it punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy more rice and noodles for her restaurant. 
Trang is the leader of a five-member SEDA group. The other borrowers in the group are:
Dung is 26 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
Hien is 36 years old. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to invest in her store.
Vinh is 55 years old. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy pork to resell.
H. is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy food for poultry.

loans.use: to buy more rice and noodles for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ndula

texts.en:
Ndula is 26 years old and married to Mulanja. Together they are blessed with one child. Ndula is a livestock trader in the busy market of Bissil where most of his clients are males. He has been in this business for the last seven years and gets an income of KES 5,000 per month.


Ndula was introduced to KADET by client of KADET. He has got a good credit history in KADET  and he is applying for his second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to buy goats and sheep to rear and sell later at a profit.

He will use the anticipated profit to pay the school fees of his son. He  hopes to start a ranch. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase livestock with the whole amount.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Emily is buying and peddling fish, like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy fish to sell. Emily has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. 

In the future, Emily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy large quantities of flour for making a lot of doughnuts to sell

loans.name: Korokoro S.h.g B Group

texts.en:
Naloba is the facilitator of Korokoro S.H.G.B. group. Naloba and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Naloba and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Naloba had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on three quarters of an acre of land.
