Before joining One Acre Fund, Naloba was only able to harvest two bags of maize on that land. 

With income from maize sales, Naloba will invest in livestock rearing and will also build a house. 

In 2012, the members of Korokoro S.H.G.B. group will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in West Point. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children between 2 and 7 years old. For twelve years now, she has been selling fufu, pepper, and cassava in the market. She received a small amount from her husband to start her business. She likes her business because it helps her  to support her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fufu (ground cassava), pepper, and cassava for her business. Her plan is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fufu (ground cassava), pepper, and cassava for her  business

loans.name: Jesukpego2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO2 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pierrette est âgée de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Pierrette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pierrette ne vit plus avec son mari. Pierrette a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste encore à sa charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant à charge, Pierrette vend depuis trente ans, de la nourriture (riz et haricot) qu'elle prépare et qu'elle vend à la devanture de sa maison. Pierrette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO2, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les cinq premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The JESUKPEGO2 group is composed of three friends. This is the sixth time the group has sought financial assistance from Alidé, in order to increase the scale of their business. The group representative, Pierrette, is the lady with her hand raised in the photo. Pierrette is 65 years old and lives in Benin. Pierrette did not go to school. Pierrette no longer lives with her husband. Pierrette has five children, all school educated, one of whom still lives at home. In order to meet her basic needs, and those of her child, for the last thirty years Pierrette has sold food (rice and beans) which she prepares and then sells from the front of her home. Pierrette buys her supplies at a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying her customers' wants and to increase her turnover and her income, Pierrette is seeking a sixth loan from Alidé together with the other members of the JESUKPEGO2 group. The five other loans have all been successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, beans and sauce condiments

loans.name: Mapela Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mapela Group in Western Kenya! Getrude is the facilitator of the Mapela group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Getrude takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Getrude had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Getrude was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Getrude and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Getrude will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mapela Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Getrude with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Simorn, pictured with her loom, is a widow with one young son. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Simorn is a weaver. She is requesting another loan in the amount of $500 to renovate her house.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Fifonsi Gbenandou Group

texts.fr: FIFONSI GBENANDOU est un groupe de six personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Fidèle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un certain Sylvain. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Fidèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Fidèle a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis un an, Fidèle vend des fruits .Parallèlement à cette activité, Fidèle vend des patates douces et des ignames. Fidèle achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin et dans une région du Bénin. En vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle, Fidèle et les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI GBENANDOU sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Fifonsi Gbenandou is a group of six people, whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Fidèle (whose hand is raised on the photo), is 27 years old and is married to a certain Sylvain. The couple has three dependent children, of whom some go to school. Fidèle lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the different household responsibilities together. Fidèle stopped school at the primary level.

Fidèle has been selling fruit for one year. At the same time, Fidèle sells sweet potatoes and yams. Fidèle buys her products in a market of Bénin and in a region of Bénin. In order to strengthen their working capital and their business and to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, Fidèle and the other members of the Fifonsi Gbenandou group are requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fruit, yams and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child 

Amelita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde dedicates her life to selling various types of cosmetics of different brands. She goes out to her community to offer her merchandise and expand her client base. She began selling comsmetics when she was single but once she got married she stopped for a while. Because her husband’s job is not consistent and reliable Matilde felt obliged to return to selling. Today she has a small store in front of her home. She is very happy because she finds her self contributing to her household income. Matilde was born in Guayaquil and is currently 47 years old. She has two children both of whom are in school, and her husband is a construction worker. She is happy to be bale to send her children to school and to the doctor whenever they are sick. Matilde and her family are very lucky because their home was in very poor conditions but with much effort they have been able to fix it up. She says, their wish is to provide better opportunities for their children so they can have an education and be able to defend themselves later on in life.

loans.use: Diversify product supply and attract new clients

loans.name: Lima

texts.en: Lima is fine, talented woman. She’s from the village of Levi Saleimoa.  She’s sixty-two years of age and she runs a pancakes canteen for the village school.  Lima’s experience in making pancakes makes her the best seller within her area.  She’s doing fine with her business and earns money to meet both the business and the family needs.  One of her sisters is helping her run the business project. A loan will help her purchase a new stove and additional ingredients for her growing pancake business.

loans.use: Purchase a new stove, a sack of flour, sugar, flavourings, eggs, and other ingredients

loans.name: Siline

texts.en: Siline is a mother of eight and baking is the main source of income for her family. She sells her product at a local school. Mostly she produces donuts, which she knows that the small children at the school can afford to buy for lunch.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast,sugar,yeast

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Bernadette would like to buy pigs and renovate the pig sty.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is considered a strong, responsible woman with a lot of perseverance. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is retired, so she decided to start her business because they could not cover their monthly costs. She began selling clothing, but one day she was invited to a demonstration of beauty products. She was excited about this and liked that it did not require much initial investment. In addition, the prices of the products are accessible to the public and it's a well known brand, already well accepted in the market.

Now Juana has her own group of salespeople and receives commissions from their sales. She has a good sales record. Juana is asking for a loan of $925 to fill more orders for products and have a better selection of products for her clients and expand her range. She is offering to pay back the loan in 6 months.

She and her family very much appreciate the help that will let her continue to grow her business, and improve the quality of their lives.

Juana se considera una mujer luchadora, perseverante y responsable, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es jubilado, y ella decidió poner su negocio por que al jubilarse su esposo los ingresos de él ya no podrían cubrir los gastos familiares y por ello empezó con su negocio, ella empezó vendiendo ropa, pero un día la invitaron a una demostración de productos de belleza y se animo a dedicarse a eso ya que le gusto mucho la idea y no requería de mucha inversión, además que los precios de los productos son cómodos y accesibles al público y como es una marca conocida tienen mucha aceptación en el mercado.

En la actualidad ella ya tiene su propio grupo de vendedoras y recibe comisiones por las ventas de ellas y ella tiene un buen record de ventas. Juana está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para realizar más pedidos de productos y tener un mejor surtido de los mismos para poder atender a sus clientes y ampliar su cartera, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses

Te agradece mucho junto con su familia por el apoyo que le das para continuar su crecimiento con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise for businss

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores is 37 years old and has five children. She runs a small grocery store from her home from which she sells a variety of products such as rice, sugar, coffee, oil, cookies, and drinks. She belongs to the Santa Barbara 4 collective along with two artisans, Rosalia Hernandez Hernandez and Alicia Mendez Vazquez. Rosalia and Alicia make blouses, and are also hoping to obtain funds separately to buy raw materials to expand their businesses. Dolores would like to use her loan to purchase a variety of supplies for her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

DOLORES tiene 37 años, cinco hijos. Ella tiene instalado en su casa una tienda donde vende: arroz, azúcar, café, pastas, aceite, galletas, bebidas, etc. Pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Santa Bárbara 4 junto con doña Rosalía Hernández Hernández (artesana) y doña Alicia Méndez Vázquez (artesana). Rosalía y Alicia invertirán en la compra de tela e hilos para aumentar la producción de blusas artesanales características de la región y Dolores comprara un surtido de productos para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for grocery store.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married with two kids – a 10-year-old daughter and a 3-year-old son. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk. Oleg rents a bus and offers transportation services. His business is the only source of income for the family. Oleg’s usual itinerary is the Ivano-Frankivsk – Galych route. He usually has many passengers as there are no other bus drivers who take this route. Oleg has been in this business for 7 years. Currently, his daily profit is about $60.

Oleg’s bus needs maintenance. At the moment its running gear has to be fixed. That is why Oleg is requesting a loan of $800 to fix the problem. One of his long-term plans is to buy the bus and continue to be self-employed. Oleg is hoping to repay this loan in six months.

loans.use: To repair running gear of the bus

loans.name: Jurahon

texts.ru:
Jurahon H., who is 48, is a graduate of college with specialization of an accountant-statistician. He has 7 children. Currently, he is employed by the city of Yavan as an accountant. Using funds from the loan, he is planning to purchase additional cattle for breeding and later sales. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. This allows him to have an additional source of income, which helps them to support his big family, because his earnings from the city are not sufficient to last a whole month. At the end of the loan term, Jurahon will have 3 breeds of cattle as his profit. He is planning to repay his loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Холов Джурахон, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее-техническое, по специальности бухгалтер – статистик, женат, имеет 7-х детей. В настоящее время Джурахон работает в Электрических сетях города Явана, в должности бухгалтера. На полученный кредит клиент хочет приобрести 2 головы крупного рогатого скота для их откормки и продажи. Этим видом деятельности клиент занимается уже в течение 10 лет. Это позволяет иметь ему дополнительный источник дохода, который помогает содержать большую семью, так как зарплаты не хватает на целый месяц. В конце кредитного цикла клиенту в качестве прибыли останется 3 головы молодняка. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of two cows for breeding and later sales

loans.name: Felícita

texts.es:
Felicita sells treated water by delivery and according to her clients’ orders. She has been doing this for a very long time. She is 37 years of age and has five children, for whom she wishes to progress. Her husband, Carlos supports her tremendously, being that he distributes the water to their clients. Her greatest wish is to offer her children a higher education, and that they take full advantage of it and become professionals. Felicita is determined to continue selling treated water and also has in mind setting up a cold beverage bar. With these goals in mind, she requires of investment capital to achieve her objectives in the least time possible. With your help, Felicita will accomplish her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Felicita se dedica a la venta de agua tratada a domicilio y deacuerdo a la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene 37 años y es madre de cinco hijos, por quienes desea progresar, su esposo el señor Carlos la apoya bastante ya que él reparte el agua a sus clientes.Su anhelo más grande es brindarle estudios superiores, y que los mismos aprovechen al máximo y sean unos profesionales.Felícita tiene el firme propósito de seguir vendiendo agua tratada y también tiene en mente poner su bar ( venta de bebidas heladas). Con estos propósitos en mente requiere de un capital de inversión para lograr su objetivo en el tiempo menos pensado. Con tu ayuda la señora Felícita logrará su propósito.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer greater quantities of water and implement a small cold beverage bar.

loans.name: La Hoyada 23 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La Hoyada 23 de marzo is the name of an association of 17 women who carry out many activities in order to survive. It is a great sacrifice, but is the only way in which to earn a living and to meet the demands of being the mother of a family.

Bread, crafts, textiles, knitting, socks, perfumes and baby clothes and toys are some of the the products on offer, sold by walking around in markets and squares in the city of El Alto.

They all work every season of the year, and this is why this group would like capital to invest in their businesses so that they can vary and increase their wares by satisfying the current demand, and thereby earning the money they so desperately need.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La Hoyada 23 de marzo, es el nombre de la asociación que reúne a un grupo de 17 mujeres que para poder sobrevivir se dedican a muchas actividades que les representan sacrificio, pero es el único camino para poder generar sus recursos y hacer frente a las obligaciones que les demanda el ser madres de familia. La venta de pan, la venta de artesanías, textiles, tejidos, calzados, perfumes y artículos de bebé, son algunos de los productos que son ofertados de forma ambulante en las ferias y plazas principales de la ciudad de El Alto. Todas aprovechan las distintas temporadas que se dan en el año, por tal motivo, este grupo de socias precisan de capital para invertir en sus negocios y poder variar e incrementar sus mercaderías con el fin de satisfacer la demanda existente, de esta manera generar sus ganancias que tanta falta deshace.

loans.use: This member group needs capital to invest in their businesses so that they can vary and increase their wares so that they can satisfy current demand and in this way earn more than they spend / este grupo de socias precisan de capital para invertir en sus negocios y poder variar e incrementar sus mercaderías con el fin de satisfacer la demanda existente, de esta manera generar sus ganancias que tanta falta deshace

loans.name: Thi Phong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phong, 36 years old, married with two school age children, is a leader of her village’s women association. She is active and resourceful. Besides her community activities, she raises livestock and “đi chợ” for extra income. She is applying for a loan to invest in her livestock. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyễn Văn Tám applies for a loan to buy feed for livestock.
  • C. Thị Luận applies for a loan to buy breeding pigs and “đi chợ” scrap metal.
  • C. Văn Giang applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Huệ applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • C. Thị Vinh applies for a loan to buy breeding pigs and “đi chợ” scrap metal.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phong, năm nay 36 tuổi, là chi trưởng Hội phụ nữ thôn. Chị có chồng và hai con đang đi học. Chị là một người phụ nữ tháo vát và năng nổ. Ngoài việc tham gia công tác đoàn thể, chị còn chăn nuôi và đi chợ thêm để cùng chồng nuôi các con ăn học. Chị vay để thêm vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Anh Nguyễn Văn Tám vay để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Chị C. Thị Luận vay để mua lợn giống và đi chợ sắt. Anh C. Văn Giang vay để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ vay để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chị C. Thị Vinh vay để mua lợn giống và đi chợ sắt.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Fatuma's Hakuna Matata Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 30 years old and is married with 3 children, ages14, 10, and 7 years old. Fatuma is a tailor. She started her business in 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring (clothes) items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatuma M., who has a food vending business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items (clothes) for her business.

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en: Mrs. Sushila M. is 25 years old and lives in the undeveloped region of Thecho, Lalitpur with her husband and a son. Most of people in this region are farmers. Her husband, Mr. Nanda M., is 60 years old, and for the last 26 years has installed and repaired gas cookers for a living. Mrs. M. is seeking a loan to buy the goods and supples she and her husband need to continue running this business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a business that installs and repairs gas cookers.

loans.name: Nay

texts.en: Nay Y., 55, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband (pictured above) and four children, working as a farmer. She typically makes $3 US each day and her husband makes $3 US as well, raising pigs and fish. Their children are also able to help support the family through their work as a motortaxi driver, a garment factory worker, a construction worker, and as a waitress. Inflation has been very high in Cambodia over the past year and it has affected food prices and the costs of other basic necessities. Farming has also been very difficult, because of inconsistent weather patterns. Nay Y. has asked for a loan of $1200 US to build a shelter for the animals and also to purchase some feed. She believes this investment will allow her to increase her family’s daily income and also to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To build a shelter for animals.

loans.name: Oern

texts.en: Mrs. Oern U. lives in Trapaing Chambork Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and grocer. She is a 32-year-old widow with a child who is attending school. She and her child live in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Oern U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding activity.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow to start breeding activity.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and she has 9 children aged between 20 and 33. She has been a clothes (khanga) and spices seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 9:30 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Mwanakombo now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga) and spices for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and spices

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en: Kanchi T. is 30 years old and lives in Bhodhoka, Lalitpur, with her husband and son.  While her son is currently a student in primary school, Kanchi and her husband work in a small hotel which they opened together two years ago.  In the hotel, they serve traditional Newari foods, which are very popular in Bhodhoka because the majority of the people are Newari.  Having paid off her first loan from Kiva, which helped establish her hotel business, Kanchi is requesting another loan of $225, which will be used to purchase meat and vegetables to improve the quality and diversity of food served at her hotel.

loans.use: To purchase more food items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for a small business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 44 años, tuvo 4 hijos, tres de ellos aun viven con ella, el mayor ya tiene su esposa. Desde los 14 años trabajaba en un restaurante como moza, luego a los 18 años ascendió como cajera, época donde tuvo a su primer hijo, tiempo después conoció al que es su esposo y se fue a vivir a Patay, pueblo de su esposo, desde entonces, exactamente 19 años, tiene una bodega denominad “Don Diego”. Con Prisma viene trabajando desde el 2005, esto le ha ayudado a su esposo para la siembra su chacra de papa, y ella en su bodega. Al medio día envía almuerzo para su esposo y operarios, a veces lleva misma lo lleva, pero regresa rápidamente para no perder clientela, no tiene dificultad en su negocio, ni en la chacra su esposo. Esta socia está en el ciclo VII (7mo préstamo) es una socia muy activa y puntual en sus pagos. Con este dinero comprará arroz y azúcar, varios sacos, porque los precios están variando constantemente, el con el resto comprarán fertilizantes para sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Nelly is 44 years old and has 4 children, 3 of them still live with her and the oldest is married. From the age of 14 she worked in a restaurant as a waitress and later at the age of 18 she became a cashier, during which time she had her first child. Later she met her husband and went to live in Patay where her husband is from. For 19 years she has had a small grocery store called “Don Diego”. She has been working with Prisma since 2005, helping her husband plant their potato farm and working in the grocery store. At noon she sends lunch for her husband and the workers. Sometimes she takes it herself but returns quickly so she doesn’t lose customers. She doesn’t have any problems with her business or her husband’s farm. This is her 7th loan and she makes her payments regularly and on time. With this money she will buy several bags of rice and sugar because the price is constantly changing and with the remaining money she will buy fertilizer for the potato farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and sugar for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Maria Irene V. tengo una tienda en la cual tengo variedad deproductos de liemmpieza para el hogar, productos para damas como ser cremas, lociones, shampoos, acondionadores, cosmeticos, tambien vendo zapatos, sombreros y articulos electrodomesticos para el hogar, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio el cual me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia y algunos gastos personales, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas mercaderia para poder tener bien surtida mi tienda ya que en estas epocas de navidad los productos se venden bastante, por lo antes mencionado estoy solicitando credito y con las ganancias que obtenga poder mejorar la calidad de vida de mi familia.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Maria Irene V.. I have a store in which I sell a variety of home cleaning products along with feminine products such as creams, lotions, shampoos, conditioners, and cosmetics; I also sell shoes, hats, and home electrical appliances. I have worked in this business for several years, and it is how I generate an income for supporting my family and for any personal expenses. Right now I need to purchase more merchandise so that my store can maintain a good selection, since a lot of products are sold during the Christmas holiday season. I am requesting a loan for this reason, and the profits that I would obtain would help me to improve my family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Norme es socia del Bancomunal San Juan.  Norma tiene 42 años vive en casa de sus padres con su esposo,  es profesora de primaria tiene tres hijos de 14,13 y 4 años están en el colegio estatal, a Norma le gusta hacer manualidades empezó hacer adornos  con madera de tulipán  aproximadamente hace dos años y los vende en los colegios a los profesores, también realiza trabajos de enchapado de puertas  como reposteros de cocina, roperos etc, su negocio funciona en su casa y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo de la empresa Unique.
Ha pasado momentos difíciles le atropello una moto golpeando su brazo derecho estuvo por quince días en reposo. No pudo salir a trabajar

Norma pide un préstamo a Finca de 1200  para comprar materiales para enchapar puertas y hacer sus adornos en madera de tulipán, esta contenta por que recibe orientación de cómo llevar su negocio, 
Los sueños que le gustaría realizar son tener su casa propia, tener una librería bazar y llegar hacer directora de  venta por catalogo de Unique
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the San Juan cooperative bank, 42 years old, and lives in her parents’ house with her husband. She is a primary school teacher and has three children ages 14, 13 and 4 who are in public school. Norma enjoys making handcrafted items, having started out two years ago making decorations from tulip wood. She sells these at schools to the teachers, and she also makes wood veneer doors such as those for kitchen confectioners, wardrobes, etc. Her business is run out of her house, and she also dedicates herself to selling Unique brand beauty products by catalog. She has had some difficult times, particularly when she was hit by a car which injured her right arm and forced her to be on bed rest for fifteen days. She was not able to work during this time. Norma requests a loan from Finca of 1,200.00 Peruvian soles, with which she will purchase materials for making her doors and decorations. She is glad to be receiving orientations on how to best run her enterprise. Her dreams are to own her own home, to have a bookstore/bazaar, and to become a director of Unique brand product sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for making wood veneer doors.

loans.name: Vilma Rebeca

texts.es:
En base a sus estudios sobre sastrería e industria del vestido es que Vilma se animo a abrir un pequeño negocio en su propia casa una vez que consiguió las máquinas que requería. Hoy en día atiende en su casa a sus clientes y ofrece el servicio de compostura de vestido y confección de ropa. Cuando sus clientes no pueden ir a visitarla ella los visita.

A lo largo de los veinte años que lleva en su negocio la mayoría de sus clientes han sido mujeres, lo que la ha llevado a especializarse en ropa femenina, ya sea para niñas o mujeres adultas.

Su esposo trabaja como técnico electricista y junto con él, ella ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su casa, ya que sus hijos son todos mayores. 

Vilma asegura querer alquilar en un futuro un local dentro de un mercado para poder abrir una juguería, pero ello mas adelante porque actualmente le seria muy difícil pagar el espacio.
texts.en:
Based on her tailoring and fashion industry studies, is that Vilma decided to open a small home-based business once she got the machines she needed. Today she serves her clients from home and offers clothing alteration and tailoring services. When her clients can’t go to her she goes to them. During the 20 years she has been in the business, most of her clients have been women, which has made her specialize in women clothing, for both young girls and adult women. Her husband works as an electric technician and along with him, she helps cover the home expenses now that all their children are older. Vilma says she wants to rent a market location to sell fresh juice, but in the future because currently it would be very difficult to pay for the space.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and materials for her business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra.Isabel Román de 46 años, separada hace 17 años,tiene tres hijos de 29,25 y 24 años de edad, el mayor de ellos es casado y vive en forma independiente con su familia , el segundo vive y trabaja en el exterior y el último de ellos está cursando el 5to. Año de la carrera de Derecho, y el sueño de la señora es que su hijo llegue a terminar la carrera universitaria que está siguiendo.y se convierta en un buen profesional en el futuro.

Se inició en la fabricación de muebles en el año 2002 con un ahorro que había obtenido de su trabajo anterior y actualmente ya tiene su clientela bien formada, que recurren a ella por su excelente trabajo y su atención personalizada.

El cliente solicita el préstamos para la compra de maderas, clavos y terciadas, para realizar sillones de maderas, camioncito y de esta forma satisfacer la gran demanda de los mismos
texts.en:
Isabel Román is 46 years old, has been separated for 17 years and has three children aged 29, 25 and 24. Her eldest child is married and he lives independently with his own family. Her second son lives and works in another country. Her youngest son is in his fifth year of Law studies. Her dream is that her son will complete his university studies which he has begun and that he will be a good lawyer in the future. She began making furniture in 2002 with savings she had from a previous job and currently has a good customer base who keep returning to her because of her excellent workmanship and personalized attention. She is asking for this loan to buy wood, nails and plywood in order to make wood armchairs, small trucks and be able to satisfy the strong demand for these objects.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and plywood

loans.name: Jorge Nicolas

texts.es: Jorge Nicolas es soltero, de 50 años de edad, con 3 hijos estudiando la primaria (1º, 4º y 6º grado) es trabajador de la Alcaldia Municipal con 5 años de servicio desempeñandose como Policia Municipal, su compalera la Sra. Teodora Alvarez no trabaja, se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos y el hogar, don Jorge ademas de su salario recibe una pension del INSS como lisiado de guerra, esta solicitando su primer credito  a AFODENIC para la construccion de una letrina, ademas desea forrar su casa, ya que la mitad es de concreto y el resto de madera y zinc, con el dinero del credito necesita hacer lo posible para cumplir con lo planificado, en caso de no poder concluir la obra, solicitara un nuevo credito para finalizar, ya que su sueño es alcanzar una vivienda digna para sus hijos y su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge Nicolas is 50 years old and single. He has 3 children in elementary school (1st, 4th, and 6th grades). For 5 years he has worked for the town as a municipal police officer. His significant other, Teodora Alvarez, does not work. She is a homemaker and takes care of the children. In addition to his salary, Jorge receives a disabled veteran's pension from INSS. He is applying for his first AFODENIC loan so he can build a latrine. He also wants to put siding or covering on his house since one half is concrete and the rest is wood and zinc. He will try to finish these plans with the loan money. If he cannot finish the job, then he will apply for a new loan because he hopes to have a decent home for his children and his partner.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contruction: latrine

loans.name: Justiniana

texts.es:
La Sra. Justiniana  tiene 56 años y está casada con el señor Catalino Franco. Ellos viven en casa propia y tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad.

Desde muy joven, Justiniana fue a la Argentina donde trabajó durante diez años. Al regresar al país utilizó su ahorro para empezar su negocio y poder afincarse definitivamente. Primeramente empezó con la ventas de bebidas, luego vendió articulos de primera necesidad, pues en su vecindad no existía ni un negocio. Dicha despensa se encuentra a quince kilometros de la ciudad.

Gracias a su esfuerzo pudo educar a sus hijos quienes ahora ya son todos mayores de edad.  Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderias.
texts.en:
Justiniana is 56 years old and is married to Catalino Franco. They live in their own home and have six children, all of whom are grown. When she was very young, Justiniana went to Argentina where she worked for 10 years. When she returned to her own country, she used her savings to start her own business and be able to settle down permanently. She started selling beverages, later she sold basic necessity items for in her area there wasn't one business. Said store is located 15 kilometers outside the city. Thanks to her efforts, her children were able to go to school and now they are all grown. She needs this loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma tiene 39 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos, uno de ello aun es estudiante y el mayor ya trabaja para pagar sus estudios técnicos. Ella es costurera, pero sólo cose ropa para niños y ropa interior según pedidos. Adicionalmente, vende plátanos y carbón fuera de su casa, ambas actividades las viene realizando desde hace 8 años y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque así se mantiene ocupada y sus preocupaciones las deja a un lado, además le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar. Posteriormente, quiere incrementar su venta de  plátanos en racimos al por mayor, ya que esta fruta es muy rentable. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se siente muy contenta porque le dieron la oportunidad de seguir creciendo en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más plátanos y carbón, en un monto de 700 soles, lo demás lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura.
texts.en:
Wilma is 39 years old, a single mother, and lives with her two children. One of her children is a student and the other works to pay for technical studies. She is a seamstress, but she only sews clothes for children and underwear depending on orders. Additionally, she sells bananas and charcoal out of her house. She has been carrying out both activities for 8 years with the unconditional support of her children. She enjoys her work because she is able to stay busy and leave her worries on the side. Additionally, it is profitable because she is located in a good location. In the future she would like to increase her sales of bananas in bunches at wholesale, since bananas are very profitable. This is her first loan through MFP and she is very happy because it will give her the opportunity to continue growing her business. With the money from the loan she will use 700 soles to purchase more bananas and charcoal. The remaining money will be used to purchase sewing materials.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ezel

texts.en:
Mrs. J. is a member of PMPC Microfinance PDP-LP. She is a dressmaker and tailor, and also operates a NFA rice dealing business ("bigasan ng bayan"). She is married to Gilbert J., a van driver. They are blessed with two children, who are in day care.

She is 28 years old and has been a member of the PDP-LP program for more than a year. This is her fourth cycle of loan. She is requesting an amount of PHP 10,000.00, which is intended for additional NFA capital. Her loan history shows no default and she is a member in good standing.

In addition to her dress tailoring and rice dealing work, she has taken on a sideline business in ice candy and ice selling. She hopes that, by God's grace, her business will thoroughly bloom. She wants to provide whatever is best for their children, as one of her children is a gifted little boy undergoing therapy and taking special classes. She hopes that her children will become professionals and achieve whatever they dream of.

loans.use: To raise additional capital for her businesses.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo tiene 48 años, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en su casa propia. Durante casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, nació en una familia agricultora que le ha transmitido todos esos conocimientos del cuidado de las plantas como una fuente de ingresos económicos. Alfredo cultiva los productos que dan en su zona, como la papa, olluco y otros tubérculos. Durante estos años, ha tenido buenas ganancias, así como pérdidas, debido a los cambios de clima, pero el deseo de Alfredo es continuar con sus actividades agrícolas y transmitir a sus hijos sus conocimientos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y tiene muchas ganas de trabajar con su banco comunal, así como aprender de cómo mejorar su producción. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de sacos de abono y preparar sus tierra para una buena producción.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 48 years old, and lives with his wife and children in a house he owns. Almost all of his life he has dedicated himself to agriculture; he was born into an agricultural family that has endowed him with all that there is to know regarding taking care of plants as a source of income. Alfredo harvests products that grow in his area like potatoes, olluco (a potato like tuber from Peru), and other tubers. During these years he has had good earnings as well as losses due to the changes in climate, but Alfredo’s wish is to continue with his agricultural activities and to teach his children all he knows. This is the first time that he has taken a loan with MFP, and he has a great desire to work with the communal bank and to learn how to improve his production. The money that he requested will be used to purchase fertilizer and prepare his land for a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Emobor

texts.en: Emobor sells sarongs of various colours and sorts. She is married with 2 children and she is 31 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia D. L. C. C. D. 41 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Rosa vive con su esposo quien se dedica a L. profesión D. albañil y su hija quien le ayuda en el negocio. Rosa posee una tienda con productos como granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas entre otros; el crédito elL. lo  solicita por que quiere surtir su tienda comprando variedad D. mercadería que le ayudara a aumentar sus ganancias ya que carece D. muchos productos demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia D. L. C. C. is 41 years old and lives in the department of Ahuachapán with her husband, a bricklayer, and their daughter who helps with the business. Rosa has a store with products like basic grains, treats, drinks, etc. She is requesting a loan because she wants to supply her store with a variety of merchandise to increase her earnings since she lacks many products demanded by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by PameL. Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her store

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice , a member of th Kyumbi Young Ladies' Self-Help Group, started her retail business in Machakos, a semi-arid area of Kenya. Due to drought and the declining purchasing power of the area, she relocated her business to Makutano, a trading centre that is growing rapidly. Alice is married and has three children. She is requesting for a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to increase her stock. Her dream is to ensure that her children get the best education. She also aspires to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: Increase stock/ expand business

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Teodosia es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Teodosia vende leña en su casa, producto que es adquirido en los diferentes pueblos de la región, además Teodosia vende emoliente (bebida caliente preparada con semillas de lino y hierbas) actividad que realiza por las mañanas y noches.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Teodosia sueña con educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Glorioso Community Bank. She is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. Teodosia sells firewood out of her house. The firewood is acquired in the different towns of the region. In addition, she sells emoliente (a hot drink that is prepared with flax seeds and herbs) in the mornings and evenings. Teodosia needs a loan for 1050 soles to purchase firewood. Teodosia's dream is to educate her children and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.en:
Baltazara E., 66-years old is engaged in buy and sell business and piggery. Currently, she has a sow and in the coming months she is expecting piglets where she could sell at a higher cost to support her family.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 18,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. she will use the loan to finance her business like buying feed to grow pigs. 

She likes the CEVI credit services because it has low interest rate. She said that her loan is really a help.

loans.use: business financing

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells food and snails. She purchases her goods from village markets and sells them the city. She has been in this business for 13 years. She is 42 years old and married, and she has 7 children. She is hoping for a loan of N50000 to purchase more food and snails to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food and snails to sell

loans.name: Alicia Adelayda

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Alicia es casada, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, Alicia tiene una polleria en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida céntrica, actividad que viene realizando hace 3 meses y le esta yendo bien. Alicia tiene proyectado implementar una tienda de abarrotes.
Alicia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Alicia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Communal Bank called Ccori Ayllu, which means Family of Gold. Alicia is 31, married, and has four children. Alicia has a business selling cooked chicken in a rented space, which is located on a central avenue. She has been doing this for three months, and it is going well for her. Alicia plans to set up a grocery store. Alicia needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Alicia’s dreams are that her children become professionals and that they have their own business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Ernesto Javier

texts.es: Don Ernesto B. de 42 años de edad, casado, vive en Laureles Sur, junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 10,16 y 19 años de edad, todos estudian para el porvenir del futuro, el señor Ernesto es panadero desde hace nueve años hace variedad de panes para distribuirlo en diferentes ventas de la capital, en el invierno las ventas son bajas ya que por la mucho agua que cae se le hace difícil entregar el pan o vender. Con este crédito invertirá En materia prima como: harina, manteaca, azucar, levadura, para elaborar mucho pan y vender más para obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa como comprar una moto que desde joven adeseado tener. Agradece el financiamiento  a la institución por estos cuatro ciclos que ha ayudado en la mejora de su casa como su negocio.
texts.en:
Don Ernesto B. is 42 years old, married, and lives in Laureles Sur. He and his wife have three children (ages 19, 16, and 10) who are all studying so that they can have a better future.

Sr. Ernesto is a baker and started his business nine years ago. He produces a variety of breads for distribution to different retail establishments in the capital. During the winter, sales are lower because of the rainy season since it is more difficult to deliver and sell bread during this time.

He will use his loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, shortening, sugar, and yeast to produce and sell more bread so that he can obtain better earnings. His plans include finishing construction of his house and purchasing a motorbike for one of his children. Thanks to the funding he received from the Institution during the past four loan cycles, he has been able to improve his home as well as his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, shortening, sugar, yeast, and other ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Norah Kihunya

texts.en:
Norah is 31 years-old and married with two children. She sells cereals to her customers at Umoja estate in Nairobi. She has been running her business for a period of about three years and has been making a profit of approximately 5,000 Kenya shillings a month. 

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by her mother who is also member of a borrower group. Norah will use the loan to restock her shop with more cereals. She hopes to be a great supplier to other institutions one day.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase cereals.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy M. is now 50 years old and married to a responsible man, Remelio M.. In order to support the needs of their 2 children, Cristina and Justine, her husband works abroad as a seaman. Remelio suffers from being away from his family in order to sustain their needs because now they have more expenses for the education of their children; sending children to college is very expensive. Both children are now in college, the older one taking up nursing and the second, mechanical engineering. In order to help her husband in providing for their family, Daisy runs a sewing business. She sews curtains that she sometimes sells or sometimes customers order from her. This business has operated for 18 years now and and hopefully will continue to grow. Through the money that she saves they been able to buy their own tricycle (type of cab in the Philippines that has a three wheels), and the revenue from it also contributes to their income.

When she became a member of Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), the loan that she received was a big help in improving her sewing business and its revenue really helps for their big expenses. Now, her 12th loan will be used to improve this business. She will buy all the necessary things that are needed so that her business will be more productive.

One dream of Daisy's is that their children will finish their studies, because she believes that education is one of the keys to having a better life in the future. Daisy hoping that her business will continue to grow and someday she can have her own dress shop to generate enough income so that her husband has no need to go abroad to provide for them.

loans.use: To finance her sewing business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong N., 48, and her husband, Mr. Chhen Sao, 52, live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1982 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are garment factory workers and another two attend school.

Kong has been selling clothes and shoes for three months. She buys them from Phnom Penh market for resale in Sdao Kanleng market approximately 10 kilometers from her house. Her husband has been selling porridge in front of his house for five years.

Kong is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Judy Antonieta

texts.es:
La señorita Judy es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - J.” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de J., provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 24 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es soltera y no tiene hijos.
Yudy se dedica a la compra y venta de combustible y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró combustible.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar gasolina y kerosene.
Su sueño para el futuro es construir su casa y comprarse un carro. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la ayuda a las socias mayores de edad.
texts.en:
Judy has been a member of the "Santa Rosa de Lima--J." Village Bank in the J. District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno, for the past 5 years. She is 24, and has a secondary school education. She's single and doesn't have children. She earns her living buying and selling fuel, and tells us that she used her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 300 soles, to buy fuel. She'll seek a loan for 700 soles so she can buy gasoline and kerosene. Judy's dream for the future is to build her own house and buy a car. What she likes most about her village bank are the meetings and the help she gets from the older members.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gasoline and kerosene.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: H. Célestine est née le 31 Juillet 1976 à Akpadanou au Bénin. Célestine vit depuis une dizaine d'année à PK11 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à ALANMENOU Rémi, un chauffeur, Célestine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à PK11. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Célestine n'a fait que l'école primaire. Pour aider son mari à assurer l'entretien et l'éducation des enfants, Célestine mène comme activité, la vente de boissons (liqueurs, sucreries, boissons alcoolisées). Célestine vend également divers produits (savons, riz, pâtes alimentaires, lait, etc.) à PK11. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, que Célestine s'approvisionne. C'est la première fois que Célestine sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but de renfocer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Célestine H. was born on July 31, 1976 in Akpadanou, Benin. Célestine has lived for about ten years in PK11 in the Sèmè-Podji area. Married to Rémi ALANMENOU, a driver, Célestine is the mother of four children, all in school. All of the children live with their parents in PK11, and the couple shares the family expenses. Célestine only attended primary school. To help her husband provide for the children's expenses and education, Célestine has a business selling drinks (liqueurs, juice drinks, alcoholic beverages). Célestine also sells a variety of other products (soaps, rice, pasta, milk, etc.) in PK11. Célestine gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. This is the first time that Célestine has requested a loan from Alidé, in order to build up her business and better respond to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cases of drinks (liqueurs, juice drinks, and alcoholic beverages)

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou I., 60, is a widow who lives with one of her children in Takeo province. She sells silk scarves at the local market and is able to make about US$2 of profit every day. She is aided by her son who is a motor-taxi driver.

Nou I. is asking for a loan of US$400 to increase her stock of scarves.

loans.use: To increase her stock of scarves

loans.name: Las Preciosas Group

texts.es:
Cruz C. de 42 años, su esposo es vendedor de llantas en el centro de Guayaquil, con el tiene 4 hijos de 25, 15, 14, 13 años.

Cruz hace 8 años atrás es vendedora ambulante de ropa, zapatos, sabanas y otros, le ayuda su hijo de 25 años. A veces se le hace complicada la transportación de la mercadería pero sigue adelante por su familia.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más sabanas, zapatos, blusas para tener más variedad en su mercadería.

Cruz es la coordinadora del grupo las Preciosas ella en la foto esta vestida con una blusa floríada en la esquina de la derecha. El grupo las Preciosas viven en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil,  es integrado  por 4 mujeres emprendedoras. Ellas trabajan vendiendo barquillos, ropa, perfumes.

Cruz compartirá este préstamo con el grupo las Preciosas. Ellas mutuamente se han comprometido ser responsables en pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Cruz C. is 42. Her husband sells tires in downtown Guayaquil, and together they have 4 children, 25, 15, 14 and 13. 8 years ago she began to work as a street vendor selling clothing, shoes, sheets, and more. Her 25 year-old son helps her. Sometimes she finds it difficult to transport the merchandise but she pushes ahead for her family. With the loan she would like to buy more sheets, shoes, and blouses so that she can have more variety in her merchandise. Cruz is the coordinator of the Preciosas group. She is pictured dressed in a flowered blouse in the corner on the right. The Preciosas group lives in the outskirts of the city of Paraíso de Guayaquil. The group is made up of 4 working women and their businesses are selling ice cream cones, clothing and perfume. Cruz will share this loan with the Preciosas group. They have all agreed to be responsible in the repayment of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheets, shoes, blouses

loans.name: Monica Asucena

texts.es:
Monica Asucena G. C. tiene 23 años, es soltera, y vive con su mama y abuelos maternos.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas. La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Monica estudia contabilidad y auditoria en la Universidad de Bolivar.  Ayuda en la agricultura los fines de semana y las mañanas antes de ir a la universidad.  Su familia siembra maiz, habas, y frejoles en menores cantidades.  Sacan los productos a las ferias en San Pablo y San Miguel.  Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en la agricultura para comprar abonos y urea.

Su meta para el futuro es acabar los estudios y conseguir trabajo en su profesion.  No tiene muchos tiempos libres, pero le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Monica Asucena G. C. is 23 years old, single and she lives with her mother and her maternal grandparents. She belongs to the solidarity group "San Jose of the Orchids" which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the community of San Jose de Palmas. Most of the people in the community are farmers and they grow corn and potatoes as their main crops. Monica studies accounting and auditing at the University of Bolivar. She helps with the farming on weekends and in the morning before going to school. Her family grows small crops of corn and various types of beans. They sell their products at the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel. She would like a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her agricultural work. Monica's goal for the future is to finish her studies and find a job in her profession. She doesn't have much free time but she likes to listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette T., 38, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Aden T., a company painter, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her food vending business for five years.

Jeanette has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than eight years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 18 times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy food ingredients for her business. She earns a profit of PHP 9600 per month from her business.  

Jeanette is now requesting a loan of PHP 9,000, which she will use to buy food ingredients for her business.

She dreams that someday she will have her own restaurant so that she can finance her children’s education. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy food ingredients for her business

loans.name: Joseca

texts.en:
Joseca R., 27 years of age, wants to have her own business to manage and grow and to be able have her own profit to augment her husband’s small income as a fisherman. This is so because the way she perceives life now is different from the way she did when she was still single. Now she always has to consider her husband and two children (eight and nine years old) in her decision-making and plans because she owns the responsibility of giving them a better life in the future. 

When Joseca decided to request another loan from ASHI, which will be used as an additional capital to grow her hog fattening, rice and fish selling businesses, her husband’s opinion was asked. His support inspired her to pursue her plans for the business until it becomes profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for fattening, rice and fish for selling.

loans.name: Juneper

texts.en:
Juneper F. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 28 years old. Juneper is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Juneper owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Juneper has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juneper joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juneper has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Juneper is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Juneper from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en: Chimgee is 27 years old and lives with her husband and son in Hovd province, Mongolia in a ger, or traditional nomadic tent. Her husband, Munhbaatar, is currently working in Korea on a three-year labor contract. Chimgee operates a business selling consumer products in a local market. She has been in this business since 2006, and has stable operations and a loyal customer base. Her husband helped her with her business until 2009, when he left to work overseas. Chimgee purchases her products every month or two, and sells them from a shipping container which she owns and which has a capacity of 20 tons. She spends 2,000,000 – 2,500,000 tugrugs (about $1,430 – 1,785 USD) every month to make her purchases, and plans to buy a larger shipping container in the near future. Chimgee is very open and focused on the future. She says, “I would like to continue operating my business until my husband returns." She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 tugrug (~ $1,125 USD) to buy additional items to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Chiara Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chiara inicia su séptimo ciclo con 18 socias. Las socias son del Distrito D. Chiara que se encuentra a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales menores, lácteos, abarrotes en general, cereales, quesos y la agricultura.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Rosa que es fiscal D. su Banco Comunal, Rosa es soltera y tiene 26 años, vive con sus padres, Rosa viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales los cuales comercializa en los mercado D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Rosa compra animales que venD. en la feria D. animales D. la ciudad. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. cereales. Los sueños D. Rosa son construir su casa, comprar un terreno para sembrar y construir su casa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles haciendo un total D. 12,100 soles.
texts.en:
The Chiara Communal Bank is starting its seventh loan cycle with 18 members. They are from the District of Chiara, which is located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. The members engage in different business activities that incluD. farming and selling small animals, dairy products, groceries, grain, and cheeses.

Such is the case of Sra. Rosa, who serves as the Communal Bank auditor. Rosa is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She travels to different fairs in the region to buy grain and then sells it at the city market in Ayacucho. Rosa also buys animals to sell at the city animal fair. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of grain. Rosa dreams of building her own house in Ayacucho and buying a plot of land where she can plant crops.

The members need different loan amount ranging from 300 PEN, 600 PEN, to 750 PEN, for a grand total of 12,100 PEN to the entire Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna M. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 43 years old. Myrna is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Myrna has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer at her bar and is requesting a loan to buy supplies of crates of beer for her business.  Rose is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen B. is a 59-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing business.  She lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Linaon, Cauayan , Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1995 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average income of PHP10,000.  

Helen is now borrowing PHP 18,500 for the renovation of her pump boat.  This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Helen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

-------------------------------------
About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is persistent in working towards her dream of making her doormat-making business more profitable. Despite having difficulty maintaining her business because she cannot reinvest her profits into it since it is also the main source of her family's daily expenditures, Grace is hopeful that someday her dream will land in the palm of her hand. To make this happen, Grace wants to request a much larger loan to support the needs of her business and at the same time to sustain its operation. With her great passion for giving her children a better future and decent way of life, Grace will be willing to work hard and supplement her husband’s irregular income as a doormat vendor.

As a loving mother, Grace’s dreams are always for her five children and family. She wants to bring her children a higher quality of life. In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. Grace hopes to secure access to capital for the continuation of her business. Her previous loans were carefully used as additional and rolling capital for her doormat-making business.

Grace is hopeful that her business will grow and that someday she will have more customers around the village. She also dreams of sending all her children to school until college so that they can get better jobs. One of her dreams is to be able to build her own house; one that is durable and spacious.

loans.use: To support the needs of her business and at the same time to sustain its operation.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: La Señora Edelmira F. tiene una familia muy unida, cuanta con dos hijas ya grandes y su esposo el Señor Facundo. Todos en la familia trabajan para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Quieren mejorar la casa y agrandarla, requieren de este préstamo para construir un cuatro en la parte trasera de la vivienda y así vivir con mas comodidad.  Poco a poco le han hecho mejoras a su vivienda, ellos agradecen su apoyo.
texts.en:
Ms. Edelmira F. has a very close-knit family, composed of two adult daughters and her husband, Facundo. The whole family works to contribute getting a better quality of life. As they would like to improve and enlarge their house, the requested loan will be used to build a room in the back of the house that will grant them better living conditions. They have improved their house, little by little, and they are thankful to the lenders for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Edwin Alexis

texts.es:
Edwin reside en Arambala departamento de Morazán, tiene 18 años de edad soltero vive con sus padres, por la mañana estudia segundo año de bachillerato y en la tarde se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como ejotes güisquil, pepino entre otros para de esta forma poder obtener ingresos para sus estudios ya que sus padres no se lo pueden dar por la situación económica.
Desde pequeño se dedica a trabajos agrícolas ayudando a sus padres.
El crédito lo invertirá en compra de abono y semilla para la hortaliza.
Esto le ayudara para la alimentación de sus padres y sus hermanos y para sacar su carrera como bachiller.
Sus aspiraciones son graduarse de bachillerato y si es posible seguir estudiando y tener una casa propia y seguir ayudando a sus padres mejorando las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin lives in Arambala in the state of Morazán. He is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents. In the morning he goes to high school, and in the afternoon he dedicates himself to planting vegetables such as green beans, chayote, cucumber, etc. In this way he obtains income to pay for his studies since his parents are unable to provide for him. Since he was young, Edwin dedicated himself to agricultural jobs, helping his parents. He will invest this credit in purchasing fertilizer and seeds for the vegetables. This will help him to provide for his parents and siblings and complete his high school degree. Edwin’s dream is to graduate from high school and if possible continue studying. He would like to have his own house one day and continue helping his parents to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for a vegetable garden

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito F. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 41 years old. Tito is married. To make a living, Tito owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Tito works hard to provide his family's needs like food and clothes.

Tito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tito is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tito from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou F. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Marilou is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa María quedo viuda muy joven, tiene siete hijos ya que se caso muy joven, pero es una persona admirable ella sola logro sacar adelante a todos sus hijos, ella inicio un negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina, solicita este crédito para hacer crecer su negocio, quiere comprar mas estufas para cocer las tortillas y así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa María was widowed very young. She has seven children because she married very young. She is admirable because she managed to raise all her children by herself. She stared a flour tortilla making business. She is asking for the loan so that her business can grow. She wants to buy more stoves to cook the tortillas thus increasing profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stove.

loans.name: Kipas Ole

texts.en:
Kipas Ole K. is 37 years old. He is married to Everline K. and a father of three school-going children. Kipas is a farmer on his own piece of land. He has been farming for the last 10 years.
