He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Kipas' dream is do large-scale farming and start dairy farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend 37,500 Kenyan shillings to prepare land for planting potatoes

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen A. is 20 years old and married; her husband is a member of the UNHCR staff. She has one child who goes to school.  Hellen is currently in the business of selling beans and maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Syinat's Group

texts.en:
Syinat T. is a mature-aged woman. She and her spouse, who is already on a pension, have been bringing up their three children, the youngest of them is a student. 

Syinat makes her money by working as a school teacher.  Unfortunately her low salary can’t satisfy all life's necessities.  Her daughters are currently working in Russia, this way they support their parents financially. Additionally, Syinat together with her husband are engaged in cattle breeding.

The family aims to improve their living conditions.  For this aim to be achieved they want to increase cattle stock.  For this purpose, a loan needed to be obtained.

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 .

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase breeding cattle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. A mother of two school-age children, she started her business by selling accessories from her home. Today she is the proud owner of an accessories and perfume shop. She has been working hard in her store for the past five years. She helps her husband, who works as a carpenter, with the family expenses and helps to pay for her children's school fees. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Ameen S.A.L., a Kiva field partner, to further diversify her merchandise selection of new accessories and provide a variety of perfumes. In the future, she plans to expand her business so she can sell bags and gadgets in her shop.

loans.use: To further diversify her merchandise selection

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Micheline est née en 1979 à Abomey dans le département du Zou. Mariée à Adi, un chauffeur, elle est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. La famille s'est installée depuis dix sept ans environs à Hêvié dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les besoins de la famille. Pour y faire face, Micheline mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, farine de manioc, etc.) depuis une dizaine d'année. Micheline s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au marché de Cococodji. C'est la troisième fois que Micheline sollicite auprès de ALIDé un concours financier, en vue d'étendre davantage son commerce et de mieux répondre à sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Micheline was born in 1979 in Abomey in the province of Zou. Micheline is married to Adi , who is a driver, and is the mother of four children, all of whom attend school and are in her care. For the past seventeen years, the family has lived in the area of Hêvié, in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Together the couple takes care of the needs of their family. 

To cope with expenses, Micheline has been running a business selling food (maize, cassava flour, etc.) for the past ten years. Micheline purchases her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Cococodji's market. This is the third loan Micheline is requesting from ALIDé, in order to further expand her business and better serve her customers.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Yamadibougou, préfecture de Barouéli, sous-préfecture de Konobougou; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des articles de boutique, du sel et de la farine de blé                                                                                  
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des articles de boutique, du sel et de la farine de blé.                                                                         
INDA S. s’approvisionne en articles de boutique presque hebdomadairement au marché de Konobougou. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group are all married. On average, they are 35 years old and have 3 children. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Yamadibougou, prefecture of Barouéli, sub-prefecture of Konobougou in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region  of the Republic of Mali).

They met through family ties and are engaged in the sale of shop goods, salt and wheat flower. The women of the Tiessiri group are on their ninth loan, which will be used to purchase shop goods, salt and wheat flower.    
                                                                              
INDA S. gets her supplies of shop goods almost every a week at the Konobougou market. She sells the goods in the village center, for cash or credit, to a customer base of women and men.

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs that will be used to pay the loan installments, to cover health, food and schooling expenses, the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To purchase various shop goods

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 32 years old. Arlyn is married and has three children aged 13, 7 and 6. 

To make a living, Arlyn raises rice for sale. Arlyn earns approximately PHP 4500 from farming.

Arlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more furniture

loans.name: Mujeres Soñadoras (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Soñadoras esta formado por un grupo de 10 mujeres y un hombre quienes laboran en diferentes actividades diarias las que les permiten apoyar económicamente a sus hogares y salir adelante, son personas muy carismáticas y alegres. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad  más importante del país, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María Cruz J. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Soñadoras, vive por el camino a MiraF. en la ciudad de Cuenca, este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia. Tiene 55 años de edad, es  viuda y tiene  5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y casados, 4 de ellos viven independientes y uno vive con ella y comparten los gastos del hogar. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña María Cruz trabaja como empleada doméstica en diferentes casas, trabaja medio día. También es comerciante de gallinas y cuyes, trabaja en esta actividad los días miércoles y sábados hace 2 años. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más gallinas y cuyes para su negocio. Su sueño es  tener su propia casa.

La Señora. María Carmela P. vive por el sector de Medio Ejido en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 21 y 19 años de edad, dos de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes y su hijo de 21 años trabaja y le ayuda en la economía de su hogar. Su esposo le ayuda en su negocio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña María Carmela se dedica a la atención de un kiosco y mesas de billar, este negocio lo tiene hace 5 años y labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada  por su vecina quien es una socia activa.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su kiosco como: colas, agua, confites, bocadillos, etc. Su mayor sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Soñadoras (Women with Dreams) communal bank is a group of 10 women and one man who work in various daily activities that allow them to support their homes and get ahead; they are very cheerful, charismatic people.  They live in various parts of Cuenca, which is the country’s third most important city.  Its residents are kind, cordial and they maintain their culture and traditions.

Mrs. María Cruz J. is a member of the Mujeres Soñadoras communal bank.  She lives along the road to MiraF. in Cuenca.  This is her first loan with the communal bank and she was invited by a girl friend who’s a member.  She is 55 years old, widowed and has five adult, married children.  Four of them live independently and one still lives with her and shares household expenses.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Mrs. María Cruz is employed as a domestic employee in several homes.  She works half days.  She is also a chicken and guinea pig merchant.  She has worked at this line of work on Wednesdays and Saturdays for the last two years.  Money from her loan will be used to buy more chickens and guinea pigs for her business.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

Mrs. María Carmela P. lives in the Medio Ejido sector in Cuenca.  She’s 40 years old, married and has three children who are 23, 21 and 19 years of age.  Two of her children are married and live independently and her 21 year old son works and helps with the household economy.  Her husband helps her in her business.  They do not own a house; they rent.

María Carmela tends to a kiosk and has billiard tables.  She has had this business for five years and works from Sunday to Sunday from 8am until 10pm.

This is her second loan with the communal bank and she was invited by a neighbor who is an active member.  The money from her loan will be used to buy more products for her kiosk like: soft drinks, water, sweets, snacks, etc.  Her greatest dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy chickens and guinea pigs.  For soft drinks, water, snacks, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, in the Goshen Amani group. She joined the group as a businesswoman who runs a poultry business. She started this business six years ago; she was previously selling clothes for a living. Alice has also managed to build rental houses through Faulu Kenya. She hopes to build more rental houses in the future. With her loan of 50,000 KES, she will buy chickens for her poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her farm

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely L. is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 42 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $100 when she sells a raised pig.

In 2010, Fely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional animals. 

Fely is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María de Jesús Rodríguez C., vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es un lugar muy bonito donde ay una laguna que día con di acres mas.

       Ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: huevo, harina, canela, royal, azúcar, entre otros para la elaboración de panes, así también se dedica a su negocio de abarrotes donde comenta que la  bien ya que con ello a lo grado salir adelante con su mama desde que su papa falleció.

      Lo que lo inspira a esta dos actividades fue su madre  ya que desde muy joven ella les en seño a elaborarlo y así poder sostenerse para que si  algún día se casaba tenía como trabajar  y apoyar a  esposos con los ingresos del hogar.

     Chuy   como la llaman de cariño en su localidad, comenta que con las ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte en la miasma actividad y como también en la compra de mercancía para surtir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes.
  
     Lo que más desea es que con el tiempo logre tener su propia actividad y así poder tener  su ganancia mucho mejor  para sobre vivir.
texts.en:
María de Jesús Rodríguez C. lives in the State of Coapilla of Chapas, Mexico.  It is a very pretty place where there is a lagoon that gets bigger every day.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as eggs, flour, cinnamon, honey, sugar and others for the making of breads.  She also has a small grocery business that is going well.  She has been able to get ahead with these activities, together with her mother since her father passed.

Her inspiration has been her mother, who from the time that she was young taught her how to work and this way support herself.  If someday she married she had a way of working and helping her husband the family income.

Chuy, as she is lovingly called in her area, states that the profits that she earns she invest back into her business as in the purchase of merchandise to supply her small grocery store.  

Her biggest wish is to have her own bakery and thus be able to have more income to survive.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for the making of bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Vilma Violeta

texts.es:
Vilma de 52 años es una mujer inspiradora en sacar adelante a su familia que decidió abrir su tienda de vivieres.

Ella labora sola en todo el día,  está casada su conyugue es comerciante independiente tiene 2 hijos que están en escuela. Con el préstamo desea comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite para aumentar la productividad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma is 52 years old. This inspiring woman wanted her family to get ahead, so she decided to open a grocery store.

She works every day by herself. Vilma is married and her husband works as an independent merchant. They have two children who are in school. She wants to use her loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, and oil so that she increase productivity in her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Cristian Joel

texts.es:
Cristian es un hombre soltero de 23 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual  es propia y cuenta con todos los servicio ( agua, luz y desagüe) en el distrito de Chepen, ubicado a una hora de la  provincia de Chiclayo y a 2 horas del departamento de la Libertad (Trujillo).  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y tiene festividades religiosas que forma parte de las costumbres de los pobladores.
Cristian  labora como chofer de su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 3 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en su mismo distrito, apesar de la gran cantidad de personas que realizan el mismo trabajo, el trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades.
El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento y cambio de algunos repuestos que necesita su mototaxi para poder seguir trabajando y mejorar la calidad de vida de él y la de sus padres.
Cristian es un hombre muy responsable y conocido en Chepen por ser trabajador  y buen hijo por estar al pendiente de lo que necesitan sus padres.
texts.en:
Cristian is 23 years old and single.  He lives in his parents' house which they own.  The house benefits from water, electricity and sewerage.  It is located in Chepen district, one hour from Chiclayo province and two hours from La Libertad (Trujillo) department.  The residents of this district farm and raise livestock.  They also celebrate religious festivities which form part of their customs.

Cristian works as a motorcycle taxi driver.  This mode of transport is used for transporting people short distances and carries a maximum of three passengers.  Cristian has been in this business for approximately three years.  He carries out this service in his own district.  In spite of the large number of people who carry out the same work, Cristian works from very early in the morning and tries to transport a large number of passengers to their different destinations so that he can make as much income as possible to cover his needs and expenses.

Cristian has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to have maintenance work done on his vehicle and to install some spare parts it needs so that he can continue working and improving his own quality of life and that of his parents.

Cristian is a very responsible man and is known in Chepen for being hard working and also a good son because he takes care of his parents.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Sandra Grimaneza

texts.es:
Sandra Grimaneza tiene 23 años, es soltera vive con los padres y un hijo en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Sandra se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y trigo y a la comercialización de legumbres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y comprar una casa.

Le gusta  dedicarse a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra Grimaneza is 23 years old and single. She lives with her parents and her son in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. She has one son.

The member belongs to the rural communal bank "Grupo Pucara" located in Pucara, a neighborhood of the parish of Guanujo in the canton of Guaranda, which is 15 minutes away from the office of the microfinance institution Cooperativa San José. This group is composed of 22 members who work in agriculture, rear cattle and sell vegetables.

Sandra is a farmer. She grows corn and wheat, and she sells vegetables. She gets her supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells her goods at the wholesale market of the same city.

She applies for a loan to buy agricultural consumables. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to improve her business and buy a house. She likes to devote herself to her son.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines es madre D. familia D. 67 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio solo D. luz, ubicada en el distrito TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía. 

DesD. hace 6 años Ines a colocado en su casa  una bodega donD. venD. todo tipo D. productos para el consumo y uso diario, al tener su negocio instalado en su domicilio le permite atender a cualquier hora a sus clientes, ésto le permite diferenciarse D. otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos D. su hogar.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es D. 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con más variedad productos, una vez que sus ventas aumenten podrá cubrir su préstamo y tener mejoras económicas para llevar a su casa.  Ines es una mujer que con esfuerzo y trabajo quiere que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ines is a 42 year old housewife who lives with her husband and her three children in their own home. The house has electricity and is located in the TambogranD. district in the department of Piura. This region focuses on agriculture, animal husbandry and crafts.

For the past six years Ines has installed a general store in her home where she sells all kinds of food and daily use products. The fact that the store is located in her home allows her to attend to her customers at any hour. This differentiates her from other stores and enables her to make a better income, which allows her to pay for household expenses.

She will use the loan for 2000 nuevos soles requested from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a larger quantity of merchandise, expanding her business with a bigger variety of products. Once her sales increase she will be able to cover her loan and obtain a better economic situation for her household. Ines is a woman who through effort and work wants her children to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Avema

texts.en: Avema is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and six children. For the last ten years, she has made a living by running a meat shop where she sells pork and beef. She is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Avema has been a member of HSPFI since 2007 and hopes to expand and improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more pork and beef to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en:
Edreda is 45 years old and a single mother with eight children. She lives with her family in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for twenty years. Edreda’s business has been profitable despite the challenge of limited finances to meet the demands of her customers. 

Edreda is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell. Her dream is to own a wholesale clothing shop. She also would like to buy a plot in town and build rental houses to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria Luisa es casada, trabaja como comerciante de productos varios: cosmeticos, ropa, calzado, otros; solicita su 3er crédito para invertir en mejora de su vivienda, espera construir un dormitorio, para poder tener mayor amplitud en el local de su negocio; cuenta con apoyo de su compañero de vida, el cual  ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ademas obtiene la ayuda de su hija mayor, que le brinda apoyo economico mensualmente. Maria Luisa esta agradecida con AFODENIC ya que a recibido el apoyo y siempre a salido adelante.
texts.en: María Luisa is married.  She works selling general merchandise like: cosmetics, clothes, footwear and others.  She is asking for her 3rd loan to invest in home improvements.  She hopes to build a bedroom in order to have more space for her business.  Her life partner supports her efforts; he helps cover household expenses.  She also gets help from her oldest daughter who provided monthly economic support.  María Luisa is grateful to Afodenic because she’s gotten support and has always gotten ahead.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 3 children. 

Nena is provides manicure & pedicure services. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for pedicure & manicure services.

Nena is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for pedicure & manicure services.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun, 34, is a married woman with two children. 

She intends to use the loan to buy feed concentrate to fatten her pigs. She has several pigs and intends to feed thE. concentrate to fatten thE. more quickly. She wants her animals to reach the ideal weight to sell thE. in the local and nearby markets. 

She wants to earn higher profits for her family and her parents’ wellbeing and to grow her pig-raising project. This is her first loan. She has had no previous loans from state banks. Hattha Kaksekar Ltd. offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate. She would like to request the funds to purchase pig feed. Mrs. Chhun is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras, vive por la parroquia de Turi, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y muchos laboran diariamente en la ciudad de Cuenca, su población mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 55 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, 4 de ellos son casados e independientes y sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente. Su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que habita es el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

Doña María se dedica a la ganadería y vende la leche que obtiene de sus vacas. Hace 5 meses también cuenta con una tienda de comestibles en la que trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y  lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es mejorar su tienda y ampliarla.
texts.en:
Ms. María is a member of the communal bank Mujeres de Chilcatotoras [Women of Chilcatotoras]. She lives by the Turi parish, a place with a cold climate. Her people devote themselves to livestock and crop farming, and many labor daily in the city of Cuenca. The people maintain their culture and traditions. 

Ms. María is 55 years old, married, and as fruit of her marriage has conceived seven children: four of them are married and independent, and her unmarried children work and help her financially. Her husband works in construction and the house they inhabit is the fruit of the couple's own efforts. 

Doña María devotes herself to livestock farming and sells the milk she obtains from their cows. Five months ago she also began a grocery store where she works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank and will invest it in the purchase of basic staples for stocking her store. 

Her goal is to improve and expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples for her store.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa D. 66 años D. edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito La Arena que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

DesD. hace varios años Luisa se dedica la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad (leche, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y D. bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta D. sus productos  trata D. cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.  También elabora y venD. chicha e jora a los clientes que llegan a su negocio, obteniendo otro ingreso para su casa.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías e insumos para seguir preparando su chicha D. jora, con el único ideal D. que su negocio sea cada vez más granD. y tenga productos surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Luisa es una persona responsable y dedicada que se preocupa por brindarles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
66-year-old Luisa lives with her family in their own home, which lacks basic services and is located in the rural district of La Arena, belonging to the administrative division of Piura. This area is characterized by farming and ranching.

For several years, Luisa has been selling staple products (milk, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc) and beverages. Her business is situated in her home, for her comfort and safety. With the earnings generated from selling her products, she tries to cover all her costs and improve the living standards of her family. She also produces and sells chicha D. jora, a traditional corn liquor, to the customers that visit her business. This provides an additional income for her household.

In order to carry out her business, Luisa applied for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa, which will be used to buy more goods and supplies so that she can continue to prepare her chicha. Luisa's only ideal is for her business to grow again and to have assorted products to offer her customers. Luisa is a responsible and dedicated person who cares about providing the best for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and supplies so that she can continue to prepare chicha de jora, a traditional liquor

loans.name: Rodina

texts.en: Rodina is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has two children. Rodina is making and selling snacks like rice and cheese cakes. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Rodina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rodina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Svey

texts.en:
Svey, 43, is a married woman who has been living in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province.  She has spent her life cultivating various kinds of crops such as rice, potatoes and soy beans. She is married to Mr. Lim who also works in the same business. They have given birth to three children, all of whom are attending school. Their children also assist Svey on the farm when they are free from studying. This humble couple typically make a profit of around $7.50 USD,  which they use to help meet  the family’s needs. 

The coming rainfall is good for her crops; therefore, Svey would like to request a loan to buy some fertilizers to put on the farmland and to fix her broken threshing machine. In the future, she wishes to expand her existing farmland and see her children through to a high level of education.

loans.use: to buy some fertilizers to put on the farmland and to fix her broken threshing machine

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a variety store business in the Philippines.

Clementina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Clementina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь занимается торговлей женской одеждой на рынке «Малоимущих» в городе Бердянске, где она проживает со своим взрослым сыном. Любовь продает носки, трусы, колготы и т.п. Такой товар всегда быстро реализуется, долго не залеживается и пользуется постоянным спросом. Любовь работает в этой сфере бизнеса уже 10 лет. Ее оборотный капитал составляет 15 000 гривен.  

Любовь планирует использовать кредит в 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара и пополнить оборотные средства. Любовь хочет закупить товар по низкой закупочной цене и удачно его реализовать, предоставив себе самой возможность расширять бизнес дальше. Любовь можно охарактеризовать как постоянного и последовательного предпринимателя. Она всегда вежливо относится к покупателям, находит к ним правильный подход и это неизменно располагает людей приобретать вышеуказанный товар

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Lubov is involved in sales of women's clothing at the "Maloimuschikh" market in the town of Berdyansk, where she lives with her adult son.  Lubov sells socks, underwear, stockings and such.  This merchandise is always sold fast, never sits on the shelf and is in constant demand.  Lubov has been working in this business field for ten years.  Her revolving capital amounts to 15,000 hryvnia.  Lubov plans to use the 12,000 hryvnia loan to expand the merchandise assortment and to refill her revolving funds.  She wants to buy the merchandise at a low price and successfully sell it, thus, providing herself with an opportunity to expand her business further.  Lubov can be characterized as a consistent and thorough entrepreneur.  She always treats her customers politely, finds the right approach to them, and this undoubtedly makes people more likely to buy the above-mentioned merchandise.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of merchandise and refill revolving capital

loans.name: Reyda

texts.en: Reyda, a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school, has had a grocery store in Yei South Sudan for five years. Requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase maize flour and cassava flour, Reyda will use the extra income arising from it to build a very big shop for her business expansion in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Chérif Aïdara

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié, sans enfants qui tient une boutique de vente de vêtement pour enfants en centre ville.Il achète ses articles chez les grossistes de la capitale et les revend au détail.Avec les revenus de son activité, Il prend en charge sa femme et participe à l'entretien de la grande famille.Il paie aussi des factures d'électricité et de téléphone ainsi que la location de la boutique. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un prêt de 500000f pour acheter des robes, des chemises et des pantalons pour enfants.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en:
Chérif Aïdara is a young married man, with no children. He owns a children's clothes shop in the centre of town. He gets his supplies from the wholesalers in the capital, and resells the clothes to his retail customers. The income from his business allows him to take care of his wife and contribute towards his extended family's expenses. He also pays for the electricity and phone bills, as well as the rental on his shop.

In order to strengthen his business, Chérif Aïdara is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs with which to buy dresses, shirts and trousers for children. He would eventually like to open a second shop.

loans.use: to restock on dresses, shirts and trousers for children.

loans.name: Embassy Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 20s, is married. She has been running a clothing sales business for one year now. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more clothes to sell, and bought a fridge, the latest TV set, and a cupboard. She has paid back her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Embassy." This group has a total of 17 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Maribeth has a shop that sells snacks like rice cakes, kutsinta and suman. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Maribeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maribeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Sainte Trinite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SAINTE TRINITE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Noèlie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Noèlie est âgée de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Noèlie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Noèlie est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Marcelin. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Noèlie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Noèlie vend depuis trois ans, des fruits de façon ambulante. Noèlie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Noèlie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SAINTE TRINITE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Sainte Trinite group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to increase the level of their business. 

The representative of the group. by the name of Noèlie, is the one who has her hand raised on the photo. Noèlie is 28 years old and lives in Bénin. Noèlie never went to school. Noèlie is married to a teacher by the name of Marcelin. The couple has three dependent children who all go to school. Noèlie lives together with her husband and children. 

In order to take care of the diverse family responsibilities, Noèlie has been selling fruit as a street vendor for three years. Noèlie gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. In seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her turnover and her income, Noèlie is requesting a second loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the Sainte Trinite group.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Siena

texts.en:
Siena works hard to support her family. Siena is married and has a business of selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Siena has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Siena has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Siena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. A mother of five children. two of her children, ages 16 and 14 year old, still attend school. She also engages in buying and selling of rice as supplemental income. She lives in Talibon, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to purchase rice and fertilizers. These materials will help Gertrudes and her family grows and sell rice, thus improve the yield of her farm and ability to handle her finances. She can now provide the needs of her growing children and continue to send them to school.

In the future, Gertudes would like to expand her sources of income to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase rice and fertilizers

loans.name: Laumata

texts.en:
Laumata was given a loan by SPBD to start up her sewing business from home. She specializes in making dressy shirts and puletasi (Samoan dresses). Being married with 5 children to but through school she needs extra money daily for fees for her children.

They were depending on their plantation with was taking long to produce.

She just has been given a loan of $175 which she used to purchase material, buttons needle for making more shirt and puletasi. Her stock has increased to ten shirts and fifteen puletasi weekly. Her profit after all expenses has increased up to $120 weekly which helps her meet her loan repayment and be able to purchase stock e.g fertilizer etc to improve their plantation. With her next loan, she plans to diversify and maybe open a sewing shop in town, where there’s more people increasing the demand for her service.

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Dargah

texts.en: Dargah is living in the Beylagan region and is engaged in the cattle breeding business. He sells livestock and also sells fresh meat. He has borrowed loans from Normicro Beylagan branch for a long time. His first loan was in the amount of $400. Now, his fifth time he applies for a loan and needs $1200 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak M. is a moto-taxi driver in Phnom Penh.  He lives with his wife and their child who works as a tailor earning $2.50/day.  Prak M. can make $2/day driving people around.  He will use this loan to buy two sewing machines and some clothes for his child's business.  In the future, he hopes to continue investing in his child and helping them to build a business of their tailoring skills.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and some clothes

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng C. is 31 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband (pictured here because Heng Charthy was working in Poipet when we visited) and their 2 young children.  She buys and sells small baskets and other handmade items near the Cambodian-Thailand border in the city of Poipet.  Her husband works as a driver for a private company and can earn $3/day.  Mrs. Heng C. currently earns $3/day in her business, but would like to have this loan in order to buy a motorbike.  With the new motorbike, she will be able to transport her baskets to new markets and earn more income.  In the future, she hopes that her business expands to new areas so that she can earn enough money to send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transporting her product to new markets

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. Y. T. is 23, married, and has two small children. Like all the other members of her women's group, she weaves and embroiders the traditional women's top called a huipil. She will use this loan to purchase the two basic types of yarn she needs for creating her art. The first type is the yarn used for weaving, and then she also buys cones of embroidery thread.

Maria's big dream is to get an electric pump on the well at her house. She thinks it might take her a couple of years, but she wants to make it happen.

Maria, like several other women in her village, reports that the children under age 2 are very regularly sick, with fevers, headaches, and stomach aches. It seems to clear up a bit when they get to age two, but it's a challenge that all the young families here seem to face.

Here is a video of the women of Maria's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving and embroidery thread

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
LUCIA is 53 years old, she is married and has 4 children, she buys meat and she cures it (by adding salt) in order to later resell it to the people on the communities close to her house. She belongs to the group Lomita 6 along with Mrs. Cecilia Gómez Solís (who sells cosmetics and perfumes) and Mrs. Luz Solís Suárez (who sells plastic-ware). With the loan, Lucia will invest the money on her business to buy more inventory to increase the quantity of products offered.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

LUCIA, tiene 53 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos se dedica a comprar carne y le agregan sal y la secan para posteriormente vender como cecina en la comunidades aledañas a su casa. Pertenece al grupo Lomita 6 junto con doña Cecilia Gómez Solís (vende cosméticos y perfumes) y doña Luz Solís Suárez (vende pocillos plásticos).Con el préstamo invertirán en sus negocios comprando lo necesario para aumentar las ventas teniendo mas cantidad de productos.

loans.use: SALE OF CURED MEAT

loans.name: Dianora Alberto

texts.pt:
Dianora is married and the mother of 3 children. Dianora's husband works for himself as a carpenter. Dianora wants to start a business selling chickens. That's why she joined the loan program. She lives in Maxixe with her family. She wants to help her husband with household expenses. Dianora is an employee at a State Institution. Her children are studying , one at a secondary school and the two younger ones at elementary school.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Dianora e casada e mae de 3 filhos. O marido de Dianora trabalha por conta propria. Ele e carpinteiro. Dianora quer iniciar o negocio da venda de frangos. Por isso ela entrou para o programa de credito. Ela vive na Maxixe com sua familia. Ela quer ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa. Dianora e funcionaria. Ela trabalha numa Instituicao Estatal. Os filhos de Dianora estao a estudar estando um no ensino secundario e os dois mais novos no ensino basico.

loans.use: Dianora wants to use the money to purchase roosters and feed

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Mrs. Say M., 31, is a widow and runs a hairdressing stand at a busy market. She typically makes around $5 each day. She doesn’t have any children living with her since she is divorced from her husband. One reason Mrs. Say M. is happy with her business is because she is able to meet a lot of people. She is currently applying for a loan to purchase more hairdressing tools and make-up products to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more hairdressing tools and make-up products to meet her growing customer demands

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila is 38 years of age and has been selling prepared meals for a long time now. She sells meals during breakfast and lunch time. Her dedication to this daily activity comes with the purpose of providing an education and well-being to her six loving children. Along with her husband, Lester, who supports her in this business, they give their children everything they need to progress and thus, be resourceful assets to society. Lucila has the goal of growing her business and in the future, build a restaurant that will help her improve her financial situation and lifestyle. To accomplish this she requires investment capital. Let’s support this mother, who with effort and dedication, works arduously to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucila de 38 años de edad, se dedica a al venta de comida desde hace mucho tiempo, ella vende en la hora del desayuno y el almuerzo, su dedicación a esta actividad diaria lo hace con el propósito de otorgarles bienestar y educación a sus seis queridos hijos. Ella junto a su esposo el señor Lender, quién la apoya en su negocio de venta de comida, brindan a sus hijos lo necesario para que progresen y posteriormente sean útiles a su sociedad.La señora Lucila tiene un propósito acrecentar su negocio y más adelante llegar a construir su restaurante el cual ayudará a mejorar su nivel económico y calidad de vida, para cumplir este fin requiere de un capital de inversión.Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: Increase her capital to grow her business selling prepared meals.

loans.name: Sayu Komang Artamiat

texts.id:
Sayu Komang Artamiati is a housewife who diligently assists her husband to earn additional income to meet the family daily needs. She makes several kinds of traditional snacks such as fried banana and others to be sold in a local school canteen.

She gets a reference from a local organization in her village to get a loan from Dinari. The money will be used to add the variety of the merchandise at the local school canteen. With a daily cost of IDR 200 thousand, she can earn net profit up to IDR 30 thousand (around USD 3.3) which is very important for her as she can help in meeting her family daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sayu Komang Artamiati adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang senantiasa tekun menjalani usahanya. Penghasilan suaminya terkadang tidak mencukupi keperluan hidup keluarga. Untuk menambah dan mencukupi keperluan hidup keluarga Sayu Komang Artamiati menitipkan barang dagangan hasil buatannya sendiri di kantin sekolah. Barang barang yang yang jual seperti aneka makanan ringan buatan sendiri seperti pisang goreng dan aneka jajanan tradisional. Melalui organisasi yang ada didesanya Sayu Komang Artamiati mendapat kepercayaan dan mendapatkan dana dari Yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipergunakan untuk menambah modal usahanya yaitu menambah variasi barang dagangannya yang ada di kantin sekolah. Modal yang dikeluarkan dalam sehari Rp. 200.000,- dapat mendapatkan keuntungan bersih sekitar Rp. 25.000,- s/d Rp. 30.000,-. Dari tambahan penghasilan harian ini, Sayu Komang Artamiati dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya dan dapat mencukupi kebutuhan kedua orang anaknya.

loans.use: To add merchandise for her stall (Membeli barang dagangan seperti makanan dan minuman ringan untuk melengkapi warungnya)

loans.name: Nabijon

texts.ru:
Nabijon Z. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 42 years old and has 5 children. He has a college education and works at a branch of “Agroinvestbank” In addition he works in agriculture. He has a plot of land where he grows wheat and potatoes. He has been in this business for 6 years.

Quality seeds and fertilizer are necessary for planting and he does not have the resources to purchase them. This is why he is applying for a loan. After reaping a quality harvest, Nabijon will be able to supply the market with quality products, attract new clients and earn a good income. In addition he will be able to supply his family with flour and potatoes for a long time, as the main food sources for the population are flour (bread and baked goods) and potatoes. Nabijon will pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зайлабиддинов Набиджон Урупбоевич проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Ему 42 лет он женат и имеет 5 детей. Образование высшее. Работает бухгалтером в филиале « Агроинвестбанка».Кроме того он занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. Занимается этим виджом бизнеса уже 6 лет.На засев земли необходимы качественные семена и удобрения , на покупку которых у клиента нет средств. Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. После получения качественного урожая клиент сможет обеспечить рынок качественной продукцией , привлечь новых клиентов и получить неплохой доход. Кроме того он сможет обеспечить свою семью мукой и картофелем на долгое время , так как основным продуктом питания населения сельской местности является мука( хлеб и хлебные изделия) и картофель. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy D. and her husband married in 2004 and have one son. They live with her mother and one sister. The family lives along National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanthy has been a scarf weaver since last year. It’s skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to wholesalers in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a scarf weaver as well. She hopes that her business can support her family to get better from day to day.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase cotton for weaving scarves.

loans.use: To purchase cotton for weaving scarves

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with two children. She is from Novaya Kahovka where she sells footwear for children and teenagers in the city market. Alla is an experienced market vendor – she has been working in the trade for 12 years. Today she earns about $400-600 of net profit per month. She has about 70 different types of shoes for sale. 

Alla’s business is an important source of income for her family and she works hard to provide for the daily needs of her family. Alla is very energetic and cheerful. She dreams big and always tries to be optimistic in her endeavors. Alla is seeking a loan of 2500 Grivnas to expand her vending business. She is hoping to generate enough profit and savings to open a new vending facility in the near future.

loans.use: To increase her shoe inventory

loans.name: Shallot

texts.en: Shallot A. is 39 years old. She is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She lost her husband through a motor accident 6 years ago. She works harder than ever since her responsibility increased as a single parent. She sells pork and meat pies in Obuasi Market. Pork is used to prepare all kinds of local dishes like fufu, banku, and palava sauce. It is one of the most popular meats enjoyed by many Ghanaian traditional homes. She buys in bulk and retails to her customers at a profit. She wants to use the loan to buy more pork, flour, and oil in bulk for her meat pies. She believes this will provide her with adequate income to finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Nyame Bekyere (meaning "God will provide") Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more pork, flour, and oil in bulk for her meat pies

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat P. is a villager in Damnak Smach Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer. She is a 35-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a pig seller while another one is attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

Since her first business is going well, Mrs. Phat P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to sell in the market. Previously, Mrs. Phat P. obtained a loan from AMK to start pig selling business and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to sell in the market.

loans.name: Grâce

texts.fr: Née le en Septembre 1978, Grâce K. est une femme mariée qui a cinq (05) personnes à charges dont deux sont ces propres enfants et vit avec son mari plombier. Elle est restauratrice dans une école primaire de la place. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour  améliorer son activité et se lancer dans le commerce du maïs et riz. Elle désire rembourser son crédit sur une période de douze (12) mois.
texts.en:
Born in September 1978, Grâce K. is a married woman with five (5) people in her care, of whom two are her own children. She lives with her husband, a plumber. She runs a canteen in a local primary school. She is asking for this loan to improve her business and begin selling maize and rice. She intends to repay this loan over a period of twelve (12) months.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To run a restaurant and sell cereals

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 55, is married with four children between the ages of 24 and 7 years old. She has been a clothing and juice seller since 2005, working daily from 10:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. and earning a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asha is now requesting a loan to increase her current stock for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: To increase her current stock for the improvement of her business.

loans.name: Christine Luyombya 's Group

texts.en:
Christine is the leader of a five-member group. She is 52 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 18 and 34. The youngest one is still in school, the rest are working. She owns a six-room house where she lives with six people and takes care of three orphans. They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets four meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She runs Christine Retail shop, which sells general merchandise. Christine has about 15 customers a day. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises at 50000 per month and the water and electricity bills. Christine has been with MCDT for seven years and is requesting her seventh loan. Her first business was poultry faming, but she has changed to selling general merchandise. She has worked with the same group mates for the past seven years.
Christine will use this loan to invest in her business. She wants to expand her business and be able to do shopping in Dubai.

loans.use: TO boost her business

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
La señora Salome tiene 76 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Astopilco 480 de Rio Seco, distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo año de primaria debido a que no tenía apoyo, al quedar huérfana la recogió una prima hermana. Se casó a los 20 años de edad y tuvo 10 hijos, lamentablemente 2 de ellos fallecieron. Tiene a su cargo tres nietos huérfanos  por los que sigue trabajando.
Su negocio consiste en preparar menú, es decir en su casa vende almuerzos tanto para comer ahí mismo o para llevar.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas mandó arreglar su refrigeradora y compró servicios.
Con este crédito de S/. 700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará insumos para trabajar en el verano.
Salome sueña con tener un negocio muy grande y que sus nietos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Salome is 76 years old, belongs to the group “Mientras Tanto Decicisiones,” and lives on 480 Astopilco Street of Rio Seco, in the district of El Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the state La Libertad, Peru. She studied until the second year of primary school due to the fact that she didn’t have monetary support. After being orphaned, she had to take care of a sister. Salome married when she was 20 and had 10 children, sadly, two of them died. She has in her care, her three orphaned grandchildren and it is for them that she keeps working. Her business consists of her preparing a lunch menu, which she sells in her house to be eaten there or to go. With her first loan of 300 ($100) soles that she repaid in 4 installments, she sent her refrigerator to be fixed and paid for servicing. With this loan of 700 soles ($250), that will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy food supplies so that she can work in the summer. Salome dreams of having a very big business and that her grandchildren will grow to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy food supplies so she can work in the summer.

loans.name: Neema E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Neema M. from Kyela. She is married with four children, between the ages of 10 and 18. Neema has been running a ratail shop since 2005. She purchases commodities at wholesale and sells them at retail to people around the area. The commodities she sells are rice, cooking oil, soda, soap, matches, etc.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Neema currently earns about 40 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and soda in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. Neema thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and soda in bulk

loans.name: Lourdes Verónica

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Lourdes es conviviente tiene 38 años, cuatro hijos de 20, 19, 16, y 13 años que esta en el colegio 
Ella empezó en el negocio de venta de cerveza vio la oportunidad por que por su casa hay una cancha deportiva y no se vendía nada, entonces ella empezó vendiendo 10 cajas, actualmente vende 25 cajas en cada campeonato. 

Necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles compra de cerveza, comprar juguetes por la campaña de navidad y prendas interiores para la venta 
Su meta es poner una tienda bazar pues por su casa no hay tienda
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the San Juan cooperative bank. Lourdes has a partner, is 38 years old, and has four children ages 20, 19, 16, and 13 who are in school. She started her business selling beer after seeing an opportunity given her house’s proximity to a sports field where nothing was sold to attendees. She started selling 10 cases, and now sells 25 cases at each championship. She needs a loan of 1,400 Peruvian soles to purchase beer, toys for the holiday season, and undergarments to sell. Her goal is to open a bazaar store because there are none near her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and toys for the holidays.

loans.name: Grupo Nohemi Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Noemí originario de la comarca El Chilamate comarca del municipio de Granada, está compuesto por tres señoras: Johana  de los Ángeles P. M., Inés Nubia L. M., Liseth del Carmen C. C.; todas bien conocidas entre ellas y con compromiso de solidaridad en su grupo.
Doña Johana de los Ángeles P. de 28 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos pequeños, trabaja vendiendo ropa usada en el mercado de Masaya desde hace 5 años, vende ambulante y en piso, ya tiene muchas clientes que le compra ropa seleccionada. El crédito lo necesita para comprar pacas de ropa de calidad en Managua, por ahora lo necesita para ropa de paca escolar aprovechando esta época de entrada a clases. Espera tener un tramo donde exhibir ropa usada y nueva donde le ayuden sus hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
This is the group named Noemí, which originates from the El Chilamante region of the Granada municipality. The group is comprised of three women: Johana de los Ángeles P. M., Inés Nubia L. M., and Liseth del Carmen C. C.. They all know each other very well, and have committed to solidarity within the group. Johana de los Ángeles P. is 28 years old, married, and has two small children. For the past five years, she has worked selling used clothing in the Masaya market. She works both as a traveling saleswoman and at a stationary location. She has many customers that buy select clothing from her. She needs this loan to purchase packs of quality clothing in Managua. For now, she needs school clothes to take advantage of the start of the school year. She hopes to have a tram where she can exhibit her new and used clothing, and where her children can help her in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her business until she achieves the success she has always dreamed about.

loans.name: Eyman

texts.en:
Eyman is a 43-year-old divorced woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. Eyman has been working as a seamstress for nine years. She does all types of clothes as well as wedding and evening dresses. Eyman requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beads and thread for her work.

This is the first time that Eyman has requested a loan. Eyman is special in her work because she does it well and likes what she does. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capital. In the future, Eyman plans to open a shop.

loans.use: Eyman will use the loan to purchase pearls and thread for her work.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is an entrepreneur who is married to Noli M., a lease jeep driver. She is already 28 years old and blessed with three children named Fritzie, who is eight years old, Gerald, who is five years old, and their youngest Manuel Jay M., who is four years old. The family is living in a rural area of Barangay Minante 2. 

For almost three years, Emilia has been engaged in a vegetable and fish vending businesses that she schedules twice a day. She also has ventured into a direct selling business of personal collection items that is generating a monthly income averaging PHP 4,000. She dreams of having a more progressive business, which she can accomplish by having a business stall near her house. Thus she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to improve her business activity and reach her business goals.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos 1 Group

texts.en:
This Bank of Hope group is requesting their 7th loan for their micro business. They have shown great responsibility paying their previous loans so Esperanza has approved the amounts they have requested. They think this new loan will help them continue with the stability they've had in their activities ever since they've been Esperanza clients.

Nuris D. is the group coordinator and she sells clothing and shoes. She will use this loan to purchase clothes and shoes her customers have already requested. She's made this her sales method to ensure she doesn't buy more merchandise than necessary or more than she is certain she will sell.

Nuris hopes to improve her economic condition and give her teenage children better opportunities than the ones she had. Her main goal is to take 50,000 pesos in an upcoming loan to set up a store (her current loan is for 15,000 pesos). Please help us continue support these entrepreneurs through this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: Purchase clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 39 años, es madre de una hija de 12 años, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja un una maderera. La casa donde viven es de sus suegros. Desde hace 7 años brinda servicio de costura de ropa para niños y mujeres en un pequeño espacio al frente de su casa que acondicionó como su taller textil. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes y que éstos se sientan satisfechos de su buena labor, además le es rentable porque cuenta con una gama de clientes regulares que aprecian su trabajo y acuden a ella cada vez que necesitan. Lo difícil es no contar con un taller adecuado y las máquinas necesarias. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque ha visto que son personas coordinadas y muy responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará sus dos máquinas necesarias para su labor.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old, the mother of a 12 year old daughter, and lives with her husband who works in a lumber yard. They house where they live belongs to her husband's parents. For the past seven years, she has been providing her services as a seamstress, making clothing for children and women in a small space in the front of her house that functions as a textile workshop. What she likes about her work is getting along well with her customers and ensuring that they are satisfied with her good work. Moreover, the work is profitable because she has variety of regular customers who appreciate her work and who turn to her whenever they need something. The hard part is that she doesn't have an adequate work area or the necessary equipment. This will be the first time she has taken a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She likes working with her communal bank because she has seen that they are very organized and responsible people. With the funds which she is requesting, she will buy two machines necessary for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy machinery for making clothing.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie Carbajos tends a vegetable garden. She is 28 years old and is married with three children. She has applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000.00, which will be used to purchase fertilizer.

Ana Marie and her husband farm their garden as their main source of income. They plan to begin buying and selling vegetables at the market so as to increase their income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: But

texts.en: But S. started her business a long time ago. She is a grocery seller. She is 39 years old and a mother of three children, all three of whom are single and assist her in the business when they are not studying. She currently sells her items, such as cooking ingredients and sweets for kids, to the villagers. Another income source comes from her husband who works as a military policeman. The family has been building their house for a long time but due to the family's financial problems the construction is still not completed. Therefore, But S. requested a loan of $500 in order to finish building their house.

loans.use: To finish building their house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her capital and purchase more potatoes.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa es socia del Bancomunal el roble
Vanessa es conviviente tiene 22 años, un hijo de 4 años que esta en el jardín estatal.  
Vanessa termino de estudiar en la escuela estatal, no estudio por que salio embarazada, y se dedico a su hijo, pero un día  aprendió de una amiga coma hacer dulces, leche asada, crema volteada y kekes, y para ayudar en la economía de su casa decidió hacer para vender dulces, reparte a las diferentes tiendas por su casa. Semanal reparte un aproximado de 200 dulceras de leche asada y de crema volteada.
Desde que Vanessa esta en Finca, aprendió ahorrar, ayuda en los  diferentes responsabilidades del Bancomunal.  
Vanessa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de pirex, moldes para kekes, leche, azúcar, vainilla. Para la preparación de sus dulces.
El sueño de Vanessa es crecer en su negocio y tener algo solido como un puesto.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a member of the “El Roble” (Oak) Community Bank. Vanessa is 22 years old, lives with her partner, and has a four year old son who is in a public kindergarten.

When she became pregnant, Vanessa stopped attending public school in order to dedicate herself to raising her son. One day she learned from a friend how to make sweets such as leche asada (milk custard), crema volteada (flan), and cakes. To help with household expenses she decided to sell her sweets to various stores near her house. Each week she distributes approximately 200 pots of her custard and flan.

Since joining Finca, Vanessa has learned to save money and to help with the various responsibilities of communal banking.

Vanessa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy Pyrex, cake molds, milk, sugar, and vanilla for the preparation of her sweets. Vanessa’s dream is to expand her business to have something rock solid.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine-V Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying Pyrex, cake molds, milk, sugar, and vanilla for the preparation of her desserts

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children – all sons. All are currently in the senior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana.

Paulina is a trader. She trades in foods such as yams, plantains, etc. She sells at the market square in her community. Paulina buys the food from nearby communities. She also supplies to chop bar (cafe) operators and she treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Paulina has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy food in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her children a quality education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 7 hijos, Olga vende gelatinas que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoriamente en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vasos y gelatina.
Los sueños de Olga son cambiar de negocio por otro mas rentable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Communal Bank “Solución”. She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 7 children. She prepares gelatin and then sells it every day in the wholesale market in Ayacucho.

She needs a loan of 750 soles to purchases glasses and gelatin. Olga dreams of pursuing a more profitable line of business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchases glasses & gelatin

loans.name: Stombroch Group

texts.en:
Here are Aminata M. K., Isatu B., Kadiatu K. and Fatmata S.. They are small scale business people base in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group Stombroch. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and improve on their standard of living. 

Aminata B. (middle), age forty-five is the leader of this group. Aminata was born in Magburaka town; she is married with three children – two are already grown-ups and one is in Junior Secondary School II. Aminata sells fire-wood. She has been in this business for five years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma N. is engaged in the vending of vegetables and fruit in their village at Rizaluna, Cordon, Isabela. She stands as both father and mother to her two children: Angel Queen, three years old; and John Angel, two years old. Gemma is thankful because, despite all the problems she encounters in life, she remains strong in overcoming all of those things through the guidance of our Almighty God.

Gemma would like to improve her business so that she will be able to increase the income she generates but, sad to say, her business capital is not enough. Thus, to further improve her business, she decided to seek the assistance of Kiva lenders. She is asking for a loan that will help her develop and progress her vending. She is requesting PHP 5,000 to use in her business buying and selling different vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Marisela Del Carmen

texts.es: La Joven Marisela N. de 21 años de edad, casada, vive en el barrio villa reconciliación, tiene un hijo, la seguridad de su familia es primordial. Tiene su negocio de venta de ropas, seguir invirtiendo en el es unos de su planes a corto plazo. Tiene su negocio desde hace 10 meses lo inicio para obtener mayores ingresos, ha encontrado dificultades ya que la falta de financiamiento por ser tan joven el negocio no ha permitido obtener préstamo. Agradece a la Institución por el crédito que le ha otorgado ya que lo invertida en la compra de productos como: ropa para damas, caballero, niños, juguete artículos para la navidad, zapatos, perfume. Ofreciéndole a sus clientela una variedad de productos para este tiempo de celebración y aumentar sus venta generándole mayores ganancias siendo de benéfico para su familia.
texts.en:
Marisela N., 21, is married and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She has a son. Her family’s security is essential. Her business is selling clothes, and her short term plan is to keep investing in it. She has had the business for ten months. She started it to get greater income, but she encountered problems. She lacked funding, and she was not allowed to get a loan because she is so young. She is grateful to the Institution for the loan they gave her. She bought products like women’s, men’s, and children’s clothes; toys for Christmas; shoes; and perfume. She offers her customers a variety of products for this time of celebration. She will increase her sales and generate greater earnings, which will benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various women's clothes and toys

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir G. has been in the house repairing business for 4 years. He was born in 1976. Zakir is married, but does not have children. He lives in Fuzuli region. 

Zakir requests a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his house repairing business.

loans.use: To improve his business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Fifty-nine-year-old Catalina is a rice farmer who, despite being single, enjoys laboring at her farm. While her business is going well, the farm still lacks inputs, so she is requesting a loan of Php12,000 from CEV. Catalina will use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies and also to pay the laborers at her farm.

loans.use: Farm Inputs

loans.name: Shirly
