texts.en:
Shirly S. is from the village of Liposong Ozamiz City. She is 38 years old. Shirly is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Shirly owns & operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Shirly has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Shirly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Shirly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Shirly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to pay for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a la vez dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 46 años, es madre de cinco hijos( tres de ellos mayores de edad).
Mirna se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y paralelamente alquila una cochera de vehículos el cual le genera un ingreso diario. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace ocho años donde se ha caracterizado por ser puntual y mantener la fortaleza de salir adelante. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que le permitieron invertir en la venta de jugos, actividad que le salió como lo esperaba. Actualmente necesita un crédito de 2000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados una parte en la compra de cajas de gaseosas y otra para mejorar su casa. La meta de Mirna es construir cuartos para que lo alquile.
texts.en:
Mirna is very dedicated to her family, while at the same time being dynamic and hard working. She lives in the Campo Verde district of the Ucayali region. She is 46 years old and the mother of five children (three of them adults). Mirna sells soft drinks and also rents out her garage which brings her a daily income. She has been a part of the “Las Nazarenas” communal bank for the past eight years where she has earned the reputation of being responsible and maintaining the attitude of success. Her first loan was for 300 PEN which she invested in juices for resale, which worked out the way she had predicted. She is asking for a loan of 2000 PEN ($700). She will invest part of the money in boxes of soft drinks and the rest she will use to improve her home. Her goal is to build rooms that she can rent out.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks for resale and home improvement

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana T. de 50 años de edad, tiene una casa de cemento con un servicio básico que es agua y caminos pavimentados su casa esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, esta separada de su esposo con el que tuvo 3 hijos ya todos mayores de edad.

Ana comenzó su negocio de ventas de cosméticos con la motivación que tenia que mantener su hogar por lo que se separo de su esposo, ahora ana generalmente sale en la tardes todos los días a vender productos Yanbal, Romanel, Esika, todos estos productos los vende por catalogo, una de sus mayores complicaciones es recorrer todos los sectores a pie o en bus y no tener un lugar fijo.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar $ 200.00 de perfumes, $ 200 de aretes, y el resto del préstamo quiere adecuar su vivienda. En el futuro Ana quiere implementar un bazar en su casa, para tener estabilidad en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana T., 50, has a cement house that has basic services like running water and paved streets. Her house in is an outlying area of Guayaquil. She is separated from her husband with whom she had 3 children, all of whom are now adults. Ana started to sell cosmetics motivated by the fact that she had to support her household after her separation from her husband. Now, Ana goes out every afteroon to sell Yanbal, Romanel, and Esika products; all of them via catalogue sales. One of her biggest obstacles is having to go to all her sales areas on foot or by bus and not having a fixed sales point. With this financing, she wants to buy $200 worth of perfumes, $200 worth of earrings, and the rest will be used for home improvements. In the future, Ana would like to set up a store in her home in order to have more stability in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, earrings.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke R., 40, is married and lives with her five children in Dangkao, Cambodia. R. is involved in the business of preparing fabrics for sale at home and she is able to earn an income of US$2 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been engaged in this business since 2009. Her husband is a professional chef for wedding parties. He always has to travel everywhere to earn money, and he is able to earn an income of US$2 per day.

R. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, R. is requesting a loan of US$500 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy wood to build a food shop where she will sell soup and porridge. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a food shop where she will sell soup and porridge

loans.name: Juan Nerio

texts.es:
Juan tiene 50 años, es divorciado y tiene dos hijas (Maria Luisa tiene 17 años y Katherine tiene 9 años). Nuestro socio trabaja como chofer en una empresa privada y también alquila habitaciones de su domicilio.  El socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. Ya son dos años que se dedica alquilar habitaciones y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo su esfuerzo que pone en su labor. El socio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de las habitaciones y para el gasto familiar. El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Juan pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old, divorced and has 2 daughters (Maria Luise is 17 years old and Katherine is 9 years old). He works as a driver in a private business and rents rooms in his home. He is a very hard-working and enterprising father who strives to support his family. He has rented rooms of his home for the past 2 years and it has gone very well thanks to the effort he puts in. He is seeking this loan to perform maintenance on the rooms and for family expenses. He is very grateful for the opportunity he is receiving through this loan and commits to pay according to the timeline. Juan belongs to the "Maria's Daughters" village bank of the Arariwa Association.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his rented rooms and for family expenses

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia C. is from Barangay Buhangin, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 65 years old, married, and has seven children. The eldest is 47 years old and the youngest is a 27 years old. The couple is working hard to raise their big family. 

Lucia owns and operates a general store and sells charcoal in the local community. The couple also is engaged in “kaing” making business (small baskets). She has been engaged in her businesses for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a week.

In 1997, she joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in entrepreneurial business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI.

Lucia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. Having this loan will provide a chance to reach her dreams in life: to have a winning business, a good life, and financial means of supporting her family and funding the college education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: The loan fund will be use to invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn C., 47, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Ernesto C., a businessman, they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing three different types of businesses: her own tailoring shop, a buy-and-sell business and a charcoal repacking business.

Evelyn has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her dues consistently. Because of her good repayment history with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she has used the money she has borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now, with your help, Evelyn would like to obtain a PHP 20,000 loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, and she will use it to incorporate more into her inventories and purchase the raw materials and supplies that she needs to continue her operations. Evelyn dreams that her business will continue to grow for her children’s future. She wants them to have a good and comfortable life.


* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase supplies that she needs to continue her operations

loans.name: Esterlita Paculba Group

texts.en: Esterlita S. P. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Esterlita S. is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Esterlita S. is separated from her spouse and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Esterlita S. runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Esterlita S. has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Esterlita S. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Esterlita S. is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Esterlita S. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ma. Cindy

texts.en:
Ma. Cindy E. is from the village of Sugbongcogon in Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Cindy owns a store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp. Ma. Cindy has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

Ma. Cindy has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Cindy is requesting her first HSPFI loan, for 4000 PHP, to invest in her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her seafood selling business.

loans.name: Kil's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four low-income people. Mrs. Kil N., 55, has been selected to be the leader by the group members. Kil N. sells a few cakes to her neighbors for a daily profit, while her husband works at carrying loads at a local fish market. The couple has given birth to six children: three are married and three are single. One of them sells souvenirs to tourists. 

Kil N. will be using her loan to repair her existing house that is in poor condition. The other three borrowers who have jointly requested this loan are: S., who requests a loan to buy ingredients to continue selling cakes; N., who will be using her loan to repair her old house; and R., who is applying for a loan to buy raw materials to make cakes to sell.

loans.use: To repair her existing house that is in poor condition

loans.name: Las Orquidias Flat Group

texts.es: EN LA COMUNIDAD  DE JALOXTOC SE FORMO UN GRUPO DE 5 INTEGRANTES, MUJERES TODAS, LAS CUALES, EXPRESARON LA NECESIDAD QUE TENIAN POR OBTENER UN CREDITO LA SRA.MA.GUDALUPE F. C. SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE  POLLO MUERTO X KILO, LA SRA.ANA MARIA R. G. VENDE ANTOJITOS, LA SRA.ROSALINA T. T. VENDE COSMÉTICOS, LA SRA.DOLORES B. V. SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE COSMETICOS, Y LA SRA.ELVIA M. T. QUIERE INICIAR EL NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE ROPA, TODAS ELLAS SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO MINORISTA Y CON EL  CREDITO QUIEREN SURTIR Y AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO EL GRUPO SE LLAMA: LAS ORQUIDEAS LE PUSIERON ESE NOMBRE POR QUE SE IDENTIFICAN CON LAS FLORES, POR QUE SON MUJERES FRAGILES PERO TRABAJADORAS, LA SRAGUADALUPE F. C. ES LA REPRESENTE DEL GRUPO, ELLA VIVE EN UNION LIBRE, TIENE 3 HIJOS QUE LLEVAN POR NOMBRE:JAIR VAZQUEZ F. DE 8 AÑOS, JONATHAN VAZQUEZ F. DE 15 AÑOS,CINTHLI VAZQUEZ F. DE 17 AÑOS, SU HIJA ES LA QUE LE AYUDA EN EL NEGOCIO YA QUE COMO SE TRATA DE DESTAZAR EL POLLO PARA VENDERLO POR KILO ES ALGO LABORIOSO PARA SUS HERMANOS, YA LLEVA 6 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA CON EL NEGOCIÓ, TIENE MUCHOS CLIENTES YE L CARÁCTER PARA ATENDERLOS ES MUY BUENO ES IMPORTANTE MENCIONAR QUE ELLA ES UNA PERSONA MUY CONCIENTE DE LA SITUACION EN LA QUE ESTAMOS LOS MEXICANOS EN ESTE TIEMPO YA  QUE EL PRECIO QUE ELLA MANEJA CON EL PRODUCTO ES UNO DE LOS MEJORES DE LA COMUNIDAD.AGRADECIMIENTO:GRACIAS POR CONFIAR EN NOSOTRAS POR DARNOS LA OPORTUNIDAD APOYARNOS CON UN CREDITO EL CUAL NOS SIRVE PARA HACER CRECER NUESTRO NEGOCIO O INICIAR ALGUNO, POR EL INTERES QUE TIENE DE QUE SALGAMOS ADELANTE COMO MUJERES PRODUCTIVAS  POR QUE NO CUALQUIER PERSONA TIENE LA OPORTUNIDAD DE CONOCER ALA  FUNDACION REALIDAD, A.C.
texts.en:
In the community of Jaloxtoc, a group of five members (all women) expressed their need to obtain a loan. Sra. Maria Guadalupe F. C. sells butchered chickens by the kilo. Sra. Ana Maria R. G. sells snacks. Sra. Rosalina T. T. sells cosmetics. Sra. Dolores B. V. also sells cosmetics. Sra. Elvia M. T. wants to start a business selling clothing. All of these women are dedicated to their work and will use this loan to restock and expand their small businesses.

The group is called “Las Orquideas” (The Orchids) because they wanted a name that is identified with flowers because they consider themselves fragile, even though they are hardworking women. Sra. Guadalupe F. C. is the group leader. She is in a common law marriage and has three children: Jair Vazquez F. (age 8), Jonathan Vazquez F. (age 15), and Cinthli Vazquez F. (age 17). Her daughter helps with the business and is learning how to butcher the chickens. The other children keep busy by helping to sell the chickens by the kilo. Guadalupe has six years of experience in this business. She has many customers and has the personality required to serve her customers well. It is important to mention that Guadalupe is someone who is very conscious about the situation many Mexicans face during this time. Therefore, she manages to sell her products at some of the best prices offered in the community.

The group expresses their thanks for the trust and support placed in them by providing this opportunity. This loan will be used to start or grow their businesses. Anyone who is interested in seeing productive women succeed should have the chance to get to know Fundación Realidad, A.C.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiro Bulenga Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
N. Josephine is a 40-year-old, happy-go-lucky, married mother to five buoyant children. She has a real estate business which has been in existence for the last four years in Bulenga, Mpigi. It’s with profits out of this business that this diligently hardworking woman has sustained her family for all these years. All her boisterous children are in good schools.

After saving some cash from her erstwhile produce business, Josephine decided to venture into a much tougher and more engaging business challenge. Real estate was her preference and, with enough reserves of courage and conviction, she started this new business.  Since then she has never looked back.

In a month, Josephine makes profits in the range of 1,000,000 shillings. This is all down to her resilience, hard work ethic and experience that she has built up over these years. This loan, she reveals, will come in handy significantly in helping her finish up her new housing projects.

loans.use: To complete construction of her new low-cost rental houses

loans.name: Zoila Esther

texts.es:
Zoila Florián  vive y  tiene su negocio en Campeche, el corregimiento  reconocido en Colombia porque realiza el festival de la Ciruela, con la  exhibición de dulces, jaleas, jugos, ensaladas y otros manjares, que tienen como ingrediente principal esta fruta tropical. Es allí donde Zoila se dedica esmeradamente al servicio de transcripciones,  fotocopiado y tele comunicaciones vía celular, además de vender mercancías a crédito como ropa  cosméticos calzado etc,  Ella inició su negocio hace 3 años, vendiendo mercancías y ofreciendo servicios de telecomunicaciones, a lo que luego agrego transcripiones, pero hace  algo menos de un año acudió a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y compró su fotocopiadora, integrando este nuevo servicio, con el que aumentó mas sus ingresos.
En la actualidad solicita su segundo crédito y está aplicando a un monto de $1.100.000 COP, para comprar nuevos celulares y planes y  para prestar el servicio de internet tan útil y necesitado en este corregimiento; su  meta principal es independizar su negocio de su espacio doméstico y planea a futuro construir su propio local.
Zoila es una mujer que ama a  su familia,  vive con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos, entre los 19 a 26 años de edad, y es muy reconocida en este corregimiento perteneciente al Municipio de  Branoa  en el  Departamento del Atlántico.
texts.en:
Zoila Florián lives and owns a business in Campeche, an area well known in Colombia for holding the plum festival, where they exhibit candies, jellies, juices, salads, and other delicacies which feature this tropical fruit as their main ingredient. It is here where Zoila diligently provides a transcription service, a photocopy service, and a cellphone service. She also sells merchandise on credit such as clothes, cosmetics, footwear, ETC. She started her business about three years ago, selling merchandise and offering telecommunications services. She later added transcription services. Then, less than a year ago she obtained her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and bought her photocopier, and integrated this new service into her business, which helped to increase her income. For this, her second loan, she is requesting an amount of 1,100,000 Columbian Pesos, in order to purchase cellular telephones and plans, and to offer Internet service, something which is very much needed and useful in this region. Her primary goal is to move her business out of her home and in the future she plans to build her own building. Zoila is a woman who loves her family. She lives with her husband and she has four children ranging in age from 19 to 26. She is quite well known in this area, which belongs to the Municipality of Branoa in the Department Atlántico.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones, plans, and to offer Internet Services

loans.name: Imyat

texts.en:
Imyat M. is currently in the business of frying and selling local Sudanese bread and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour.  Imyat is 41 years old and is widowed.   She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 27 years old and married with three children between the ages of 2 and 12. Two of her children are currently attending school.

Viola is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley in Kenya. She has been farming for the last year and has employed one farmhand. Her main product is milk which she sells to Kenya Cooperative Creameries in Sotik town, Rift Valley, Kenya. She also operates a shop and a hotel (restaurant).

Her biggest challenges in farming have been lack of enough land to keep more dairy cows, lack of funds to purchase both land and dairy cows and poor pricing that keeps fluctuating.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable the family to acquire another asset that will be used as security for subsequent loans. She will also earn extra income from the sale of milk.

In the future, she would like to improve her dairy farming by buying quality dairy cows and building a modern dairy unit. She is grateful to Juhudi for the constant support and requests more funding in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Germalyn

texts.en: Germalyn L. is from the village of Manukan. She is 24 years old, single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Germalyn owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Germalyn is just starting this business. In 2010,Germalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Germalyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Germalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena E. is married and has two children. She has not received any form of education. Mena sells cassava and plantains at Takoradi. Most people use this combination for 'fufu' (a staple of the diet). Some also cook the plantains and eat them as lunch with any kind of sauce. Likewise cassava can also be eaten as lunch. 

Mena's husband is a mason.  Mena uses her earnings to help her husband with the general upkeep of the home. Mena will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs for sale. With the new revenue from her expanded business, Mena plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, is married and is the father of four children.

He has owned a garage since 1995 where he repairs cars. He is well-known in his local area since he has been in business for more than fifteen years and has good morals and a good reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI, which he wants to invest in renovating his garage and buying some tools. He aims to develop his work so that he will be able to change his quality of life for the better.

loans.use: To renovate his garage and buy some tools

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth B. is from the village of Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old and is married with six school-aged children. Janeth owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Janeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tuzmurane Group

texts.fr:
Geredi M., naquit à Ruhuha  l’Est du Rwanda, il a 65 ans, il est marié et il a 4 enfants, son ainé a 43 ans et son cadet a 28 ans, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il vit avec sa famille à Ruhuha Bugesera. Tous ses enfants vont à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé TUZAMURANE,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agriculteurs de riz et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Geredi et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervals pour leurs enfants. Le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les felitilisants de leur champ. Quand le groupe récolte, une partie de la récolte est vendue et une autre est utilisée pour les familles.
texts.en:
Geredi M. was born in Ruhuha, in eastern Rwanda. He is 65 years old, married and has 4 children. His eldest is 43 years old and his youngest is 28. He attended primary school. He lives with his family in Ruhuha Bugesera. All of his children have gone to school.
He belongs to Tuzamurane, a solidarity group of rice growers who guarantee each other’s loans. Geredi and his group work to support their families by improving their quality of life and paying their children’s school fees.
The group has taken out a loan from Amasezerano Community Banking to buy fertilisers for their fields. At harvest time, part of the crop is sold and the rest is saved for their families.

loans.use: Purchase of fertiliser

loans.name: Francisca Ruvenia

texts.es: Francisca Ruvenia M.
texts.en: Francisca Ruvenia M.

loans.use: To but toys, stuffed toys, cosmetics, and other things.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn C. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old. Genelyn is married and has a 12-year-old child. To make a living, Genelyn owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. She also plants vegetables like string beans. Genelyn wants to be a successful businesswoman. She also wants to have a healthy and happy family.

Genelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Genelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition feed for her child.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crushed rocks.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia R., from the city of Gala Ozamiz, is 38 years old, married and has five grown children. To make a living, Emelia has owned and operated a transportation services business in the local community for over a year, earning approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Emelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting her first loan of 15000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Emelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Pedro Ismael

texts.es: El señor Pedro Ismael V. R., es un hombre adulto de 53 años, casado que habita en el barrio de La Enramada, su esposa se dedica a realizar las tareas del hogar, ellos tienen 6 hijos todos son independientes, y sobreviven bajo sus propios ingresos económicos, ellos son agricultores desde hace 35 años, problemas de plagas han sido uno de los problemas a los que se han enfrentado Don Pedro a lo largo de todos estos años, fue con su esfuerzo que logro adquirir su terreno y aprender de esta actividad que se ha convertido en el sustento económico de su familia, él desea un Mantenimiento Fito Sanitario para sus cosechas que favorezcan a un mejor volumen de producción, con el crédito comprara fertilizantes, fungicidas y urea, esta inversión le permitirá  a futuro remodelar su casa para mejores comodidades para él y su esposa, para sus días de retiro.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro Ismael V. R., 53, is a mature, adult, married man living in the La Enramada neighborhood.  His wife’s a housewife.  They have six children who are all independent and support themselves.

They have been farmers for 35 years.  One of the main problems Pedro has faced throughout all this time is infestations.  It was with much effort that he was able to acquire farmland and learn this activity that has become the source of income for his family.

He wants to provide proper care for his crops that will lead to increased production.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and urea.   This investment will make it possible for him to remodel his house to make it more comfortable for him and his wife when they retire.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Felix; el tiene 40 años de edad y es divorciado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura y también es contador, el socio tiene un pequeños terrenos donde cultiva maíz y papa, el socio quiere mejorar las tierras de cultivo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the community bank "Comuzone I". It is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco. 

The member's name is Felix. He is 40 years old, he is divorced, and he has a son. He is an agriculturist and accountant. He has small plots of land where he cultivates potatoes and corn. He wants to improve his fields. He requests a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation. 

He is very happy with the loan and he is committed to the payment terms.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um C. is a 39 year-old married woman who raises pigs to sell. She has been running this business since 2004. Um C. makes an income of approximately $1 per day. Her husband sells firewood in the village using his motorbike for transportation. He gets an average profit of $4 a day. In order to make more profit, Um C.’s husband wants to purchase a cart to connect to his old motorbike in order to buy and transport more firewood to sell. That is why Um C. would like to request a loan from Kiva. The couple has three school-aged kids.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to hitch to an old motorbike, and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Xochitl

texts.es: La señora Xochitl R. Vázquez está ubicada en la comunidad de Huitzililla, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos México, ella tiene 32 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijas Vanessa de 10 años de edad está estudiando el 5º. Año de primaria, Mariela tiene 4 años de edad está en el Kínder, ella vende producto Amway, colchas y zapatos por catalogo y solicito su préstamo para comprar productos Amway, colchas, zapatos y para poner la instalación de la luz a su casa va a comprar cable, soque, apagadores y para pagar la mano de obra.  Ella ofrece a sus clientes colchas, zapatos y productos ama como jabón, detergente, shampoo, vitaminas, nutrientes para el cuerpo, cremas etc.  Ella inicio con el negocio hace 5 años una amiga la invito y le recomendó ir a capacitación con un crédito que adquirió pago su pedido. Ella sale a ofrecer sus productos va de casa en casa caminando. Antes de este negocio vendía comida tacos de arroz, picaditas, dobladas, tlacoyos. Su negocio es importante porque tiene dinero extra, porque le va bien en este negocio se vende muy bien, sus clientes son sus amigas, maestras. Ella quiere ampliar su negocio meter más producto y lo piensa lograr reinvirtiendo las ganancias y sacando otro crédito, su hija Vanessa le ayuda en el negocio lleva los catálogos a la escuela y vende con sus maestros. Su negocio le va a ayudar a su familia a tener más ingresos, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son poner la luz, el piso de loseta y el baño, sus planes y esperanzas para el futuro es tener negocios y dinero que sus hijas sigan estudiando y este préstamo le va a ayudar a que estén bien económicamente. La señora Xochitl quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les doy las gracias por sus créditos que me están haciendo ya que es el mejor porcentaje de interés”.
texts.en: Mrs. Xochitl R. Vázquez lives in the community of Huitzililla, Ayala city, in the state of Morelos México. She is 32 years old and finished the 3rd year of middle school; she has her certificate. She lives in a common law marriage and has 2 daughters. Vanessa,10 years old, is in the 5th grade of primary school. Mariela is 4 years old and in kindergarten. She sells Amway, blankets and shoes via catalogue. She asked for her loan to buy Amway products, blankets, shoes and to install electricity in her house. She is going to buy cable, sockets, switches, and will pay for the labor. She offers her customers blankets, shoes and Amway products such as soap, detergent, shampoo, vitamins, nutrients for the body, creams, etc. She started this business 5 years ago. A friend invited her and recommended she go to a training. She paid for her order with a loan she acquired. She offers her products by walking door to door. Before this business, she sold food such as rice tacos, picaditas, dobladas and tlacoyos.  Her business is important because she has extra income. Since her business is going well, she sells well and her customers are her friends and teachers. She wants to grow her business by adding more products. She is planning on re-investing her earnings and taking out another loan. Her daughter Vanessa helps her with the business. She takes catalogues to school and sells to her teachers.  Her business is going to help her family to have more income. The improvements she wants to make on her home are putting in electricity, and fixing the floor and the bathroom. Her plans and hopes for the future is to have businesses and money so that her daughters can keep studying. This loan is going to help her be alright financially. Xochitl wants to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad that “I thank you for the loans you are giving me since it has a better interest rate."

loans.use: To buy Amway products, detergent, shampoo, blankets, shoes, cable, sockets, switches and labor to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Maira Everida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Maira, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 13, 12(mellizos), 9 y 5años, los dos mayores están en  colegio y los dos menores en escuela, uno de sus hijos es discapacitado. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella trabaja en la playa, tiene unas mesas donde limpia el pescado que llega en las pequeñas embarcaciones hasta el lugar, mientras que su esposo se dedica a la compra y  venta de mariscos, el se desplaza todos los días desde la madrugada  a las playas cercanas a comprar sus productos que luego los lleva a Chone a entregar o a vender al menudeo a los clientes que el ya tiene en ese cantón.

Este crédito es para comprar mariscos para que su esposo los lleve para la venta diaria. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace dos ciclos y se  desempeña como secretaria del banco, le gusta porque los créditos salen sin tantos requisitos.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia en un lugar seguro ya que vive muy cerca de la playa y esto no es muy seguro.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Guadalupe communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes away from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where we met Maira, 34.  She’s in a common law relationship and has five children who are 13, 12 (twins), 9 and 5 years of age.  The two oldest are in high school and the two youngest are in elementary school.  One of her children is disabled.  Her husband is a merchant.

She works at the beach.  She has a few tables where she cleans the fish that arrives in the small fishing boats while her husband buys and sells sea food.   He goes out daily at dawn to the nearby beaches to buy his products which he then takes to Chone to deliver or sell retail to customers he has in that canton.

This loan is to buy seafood so that her husband can take for his daily sales.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning two cycles ago and she is the bank Secretary.  She likes it because the loans are granted without so many requirements.

Her dreams are to have a house of her own in a secure place because she lives very near the beach and this isn’t very safe.

loans.use: To buy seafood.

loans.name: El Quesillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Quesillo está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Rosa Carolina L.  quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace varios años e invertirá el crédito en mercadería en especial blusas ya que tiene mayor demanda.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Gladys Vásquez quien tiene una tortillería hace 8 años y Rosa E. Calero quien vende ropa desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The “El Quesillo” group is made up of three, hard working people.  One of them is Rosa Carolina L. who has sold clothes for several years.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise, especially blouses, because they are in highest demand.

The other group members are Gladys Vásquez who has had a tortilla ship for 8 years and Rosa E. Calero who has sold clothes for the last 8 years.

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Mrs. Torn is a married woman, who was born in 1979. Her husband is Mr. Bros. They have three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school, while the other child is 7 years old.

She and her husband are both farmers. Indeed, they own a 2-hectare plot of land, where they grow rice. Some of the rice they grow is sold for a profit, while the rest of the rice is used to feed their family. Mr. Bros is also a construction worker and a palm juice collector.

It is time for her to plow her field, which presents a problem for her. As such, Mrs. Torn is seeking a loan to buy two oxen that will be used to plow her field.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana H. està aplicando a su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprarà materias primas e insumos, frutas de cosecha y tambien haria mejoras locativas a sus instalaciones; inversiones que proyectan ser exitosas porque vende sobre pedidos y tiene muchos clientes especiales  por el volumen y la cosntancia de sus compras como las tiendas del sector y como està quedandole su espacio productivo muy pequeño necesita urgentemente hacer reformas para agilizar su proceso. Con los creditos de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, Ana se encuentra muy feliz y da las gracias a sus financiadores en Kiva por apoyarla a salir adelante y quitarle un peso de encima con los prestamos anteriores a particulares que ella tomaba con intereses muy altos;  Ana tambien con los crèditos logrò  comprar su molino que le ha permitido aumentar su producciòn y asi mimo sus ventas y todo en vias de mejorar su nivel de vida.  Si usted quiere conocer la historia e Ana puede ingresar al siguiente enlace: 
http://kiva.org/lend/177081
texts.en:
Ana H. is applying for her second Kiva loan.  She will use it to buy raw materials, supplies and fruit.  She will also make some structural improvements to her premises.  These investments are likely to be successful because Ana sells to order and she has a lot of customers who make a lot of regular purchases, as do local stores.  As her production space is proving to be very small, she urgently needs to make some changes in order to speed up her production process.

Ana is very happy with the loans she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she gives thanks to Kiva lenders for supporting her as she strives to get ahead in life.  She has had a weight taken from her shoulders as previous loans that she took from private individuals charged very high interest rates.  Ana used previous loans to buy her mill which has enabled her to increase her production and her sales.  This has all helped to improve her standard of living.  If you would like to know more about Ana's story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/177081

loans.use: to buy raw materials, supplies and fresh fruit, and also to make some structural improvements to her premises

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad S. is from the city of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old. Trinidad is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Trinidad owns & operates a transport services business. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Trinidad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Trinidad from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Four members comprise this group loan. Each member’s portion of the loan will be used for different purposes in order to improve their family’s standard of living. Born in 1970, Mrs. Pov, the group leader selected by the members, is a pig and chicken breeder whose profit helps to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand and so is applying for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food.

Pov's husband is a teacher and farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land upon which he grows rice to feed his family and to sell. This couple has four children who are studying in local public school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANADAHUAYLILLAS”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la Provincia de Quispicanchis, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Rosalia, la socia tiene 31 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 5 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores ella cría cuyes y gallinas, la  socia vende estos animales a los restaurantes de la zona, ella requiere l crédito para poder comprar cuyes y gallinas y de este modo aumentar su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales como cuyes y gallinas.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The community bank is called "THE ENTREPRENEURS OF ANADAHUAYLILLAS".  This bank is located in the town of Andahuaylillas, within the province of Quispicanchis and region of Cusco.

Ms. Rosalia is a 31 year old member.  She is married and has 2 children, ages 13 and 5. As a community member, she is engaged in raising small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs which she sells to local restaurants. She requires a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens by which to increase her business and to improve their quality of life.  She is requesting a loan to purchase animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

The [community bank] member is grateful and wishes to express her discipline with making the repayments.

loans.use: to purchase animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy forma parte del Banco comunal “Villa el Estero” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de paquetería, específicamente perfumes, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este negocio lo realiza puerta a puerta, se dirige directamente a la casa de sus clientes, ya que además brinda facilidades de pago. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 8 años y comenzó vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo. Además Nancy trabaja en una casa particular cuidando personas de la tercera edad. Por lo que su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su trabajo dependiente y su negocio. Sin embargo igual aprovecha de ofrecer sus productos en su trabajo. Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras, ya que los precios son a bajo costo, por ende más convenientes.
Con éste préstamo comprará artículos para su negocio, específicamente cosméticos, camisetas, calcetines, perfumes y bufandas.
Su meta es establecer su negocio instalándose en un local, para abastecerlo con mayor variedad de productos y así obtener mejores ganancias. 
Nancy vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad. Sus sueños son obtener su casa propia, para brindarle a su familia una mayor comodidad, para esto ya postuló al subsidio habitacional y continúa ahorrando. 
Nancy está muy agradecida del préstamo y facilidades de pago que brinda Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido un gran apoyo para su negocio. Además disfruta mucho de las reuniones que tiene junto a su grupo, ya que son muy amenas. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Biobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the communal bank "Villa el Estero" which is in the city of Concepción.  She sells items such as perfumes, cosmetics and underwear on a door-to-door basis and offers easy payment terms.  She has been in business for eight years and began selling by catalogue.  Nancy also works for a family as an elderly care giver and divides her time between her job and her business.  She buys her products through distributors for lower cost and more convenience.

She plans to use the loan to set up a shop and stock it with a variety of products to increase her earnings.  She enjoys the meetings with her group.

Concepción is located near the basin of the Biobio River, one of the largest in the country, in southern Chile.  Bordering on Mapuche territory, it is an important location in our history because of the battles and relevant settlement, especially during the Arauco War.  The city currently has a significant economic and demographic development and is considered to be one of the most relevant urban, demographic, administrative, financial and commercial centers in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: To buy inventory for retail sales, such as cosmetics, t-shirts, socks, perfumes and scarves.

loans.name: Yoni Edilberto

texts.es:
Yoni tiene 32 años D. edad, él es soltero y vive en casa D. familiares, Yoni resiD.  en un sector rural llamado El Cuadrado en el distrito D. Motupe, ubicado a dos horas D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo. en donD. cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

Yoni se dedica a L.  comercialización D. animales menores, aves D. corral en variedad y ovejas, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio, este negocio lo desarrolL. en los distintos caseríos D. Motupe o en el mercado Modelo D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo. Esta actividad L. realiza desD. hace mas D. 5 años, en los que a adquirido experiencia en el rubro y clienteL. fija a su negocio.

Yoni está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en L. compra D. animales menores con sus respectivos alimentos balanceados.  

Yoni es una persona responsable, trankiL. y cuenta con buenas referencias por parte D. las personas que lo conocen.
texts.en:
Yoni is 32 years old, single, and lives at the house of his relatives. He resides in a rural subdivision named El Cuadrado in the District of Motupe, which is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. Yoni receives all basic services.

He sells small animals, including all types of poultry and sheep. The animals are raised in pens located behind his home. Yoni conducts his business in different villages in the District of Motupe or at the Modelo Market in the city of Chiclayo. He has been in business for more than five years. Throughout this time, he has acquired experience in this line of work and built up an established customer base for his business.

Yoni is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN. He will invest in the purchase of small animals and the appropriate balanced feed.

Yoni is a responsible and peaceful person. He has good references from the people who know him.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, bread & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, bread & biscuits.

Concepcion has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, bread & biscuits.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El Sr. Adolfo de 44 años de edad, vive en la zona Mutualista en  casa familiar, convive con la Sra. Olga que tienen un hijo de 3 añitos, el Sr. Adolfo se dedica al servicio de taxi, hace mas de 4 años el cual le esta yendo bien ya que con sus ganancias fueron juntando hasta llegar a abrir un "punto de llamas" en su mismo domicilio, el cual lo atiende su esposa la Sra. Olga que de esa manera le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El crédito que se le otorgo fue para hacerle mantenimiento en general de uno de sus vehículos (compra de repuestos). El Sr. quedo muy agradecido por la confianza que le brinda Emprender al otorgarle  dicho crédito.
texts.en: Adolfo is 44 years old and lives in his family home in the Mutualista zone. He lives with Olga, and together they have a son who is just 3 years old. For more than 4 years, Adolfo has worked providing taxi services. The work has gone well for him; in fact, by saving up his earnings, he has even been able to open a "call point" [dispatch center] in his own home. The call point is operated by his wife Olga, who contributes in this way to the household expenses. The loan that has been granted to Adolfo will be used to perform general maintenance on one of his vehicles (buying replacement parts). Adolfo very much appreciates the confidence placed in him by Emprender in granting him this loan.

loans.use: to carry out general maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Ma Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana es del barrio D. San Pedro, nos comenta que en su comunidad se enloda mucho y nunca pueD. estar una persona completamente limpia, esta el lugar rodeado D. milpas y D. caminos D. piedra y D. tierra, es un lugar muy fresco ya que hay muchos arboles, pasto, hierbas y las milpas.
Doña Juana tiene 7 hijos, dos D. sus hijos estudian la primaria porque los mayores estan trabajando, tiene 42 años D. edad y 22 años D. casada, tiene casa propia su esposo es comerciante y venD. jarceria en los dias D. plaza, para doña Juana ha sido siempre muy dificil salir adelante ahora tiene 2 años con una tienda D. abarrotes,un pequeño local que abrio en un espacio en su casa, lo dificil para ella ha sido ir por la mercancia, tiene que pagar taxi especial para ir por sus cosas y la vayan a dejar a su casa, y éste es un servicio muy caro, aparte D. que no tiene un carro para ir personalmente por sus cosas y le salga mas barato; tambien nos dice que ahora en temporada D. lluvias las ventas bajan muchisimo, pero ahorita quiere invertir en comprar huevo, azucar, jabon las cosas mas utiles para la gente D. este lugar.
Doña Juana busca mejorar su situacion economica y que su negocio prospere, que venda mejor, sabe que no hay muchas tiendas y la suya pueD. ser una con las mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Juana is from the San Pedro neighborhood. She comments that her community becomes very muddy and it’s impossible for people to be completely clean.  This place is surrounded by corn fields, rocky and unpaved roads.  It’s a cool place because there are many trees, bushes and the corn fields.

Juana has seven children.  Two of her children are in elementary school because the oldest ones are working.  She is 42 years old and has been married for 22 years.  She has her own house and her husband’s a merchant selling cleaning supplies on market days.  

For Juana it’s always been very difficult to get ahead but now she’s had a grocery store for two years, a small space she opened up in her house.  What has been difficult for her is going to get the merchandise.  She has to pay a special taxi to go get her things and to bring her back home and this is a very expensive service because she does not own a car to go personally to get her things more inexpensively.  She also tells us that sales drop considerably during the rainy season but she wants to buy eggs, sugar and soap which are the most useful things for the people from here.  

Juana seeks ways to improve her economic situation and improve her business, to sell more.  She realizes that there aren’t many stores and hers could be one of the ones with the best sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married and 46 years old with five children. His plan is to continue sending his children to school so they can finish their studies someday. He needs to work harder to make this dream reality.  
 
Samuel plants rice on his farm. He has been doing this for 14 years and the business and usually earns the average net income of P28,000 each harvest, especially during wet season. With this loan he hopes to be able to supply for their needs and education of his children. 

Samuel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow on his farm. He will also use the loan to pay for the laborers fee for working in his field. Samuel knows that this loan will be a great contribution to his future success as a farmer, husband and father.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow on his farm.
